yDxvqN2ClHvASNbFK1lnAw.text: Don't get Texa'z' food in Phoenix.  It wasn't very good.  The meat was a very small portion (not exactly following the saying of everything is bigger in Texas).  The side dishes were not very good, but the desert was pretty good.  Did I mess up and not get the chicken fried steak which this restaurant is known for?  My health had the best of me when considering it was a fried dish, so I avoided it.  But then I opted for a very lean slab of beef which isn't exactly the healthiest either.  I do have to commend them in making Shiner Bock their house beer.  Luckily it wasn't the Lone Star.  The Shiner Bock Black was pretty good.

F8jy8y-sCEIBG3jXpZ0iAw.text: This place is fantastic all the food is served bigger than the table and just because the portions are huge there is no lack of flavor this place is great I felt like I was actually in Texas ... You have to try it if you want to know what a real country fried steak is.

0mKhJztqp3pbNMZtPjDN4Q.text: I love the chicken fried steak! Me and the wife could have definitely split it. It would have been plenty for 2 people. The ambience is ok but the food makes up for it.   As all the other reviews say "get the chicken fried steak!"

d-8ek11biRl1-Qd9rX75sg.text: This is a really cool place but I really wish they had Lone Star. Love the Bock that's the only thing missing.

Jju1NisunTRJ1_QzgbmPig.text: This place is AMAZING!! Best steak I have had in awhile, their chicken fried chicken is great and don't even get me started on their mashed potatoes and gravy!! You can't go wrong with anything here and their service is FABULOUS!!

1WQmG2V1Szi7LKMz_r7mZw.text: Being from Dallas, Texas, I have a certain standard I hold my Texas food to. And TEXAZ always exceeds it. Best chicken fried steak with the best white gravy. Very Texas dive-y looking. Wait staff will always remember who you are. Quick and amazing. Love them!!

FtJJ1FzB9dCed0tzkjBRMw.text: Most places I goto that have a smaller menu, I figure that it's due to them keeping it simple and as a result, having really good food. Now I totally missed the disclaimer on them menu saying that they do not season meat, but had I seen that it would of explained alot.   I got a chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes and a salad with ranch dressing. The salad came out and the iceberg lettuce looked about 4 days  past due to the point where it had started to change colour. The ranch dressing covering the top tasted good but was a bit much.  The chicken fried steak that came next was huge x2, covered in white (un seasoned) gravy with a side of mashed potatoes covered in the same gravy. I feel that when I go out, I should not have to add extra seasoning to my food and having missed the warning, my first bite was not what I was expecting. The other reviews nailed it by saying it was bland, the flour batter on the steak, the steak itself, the white gravy, all very bland. Had I ordered without gravy, I could put some of the 30 condiments that were on the table, on the steak but, alas I thought the gravy would not work with hot sauce.  I'd probably come back and try it again now knowing that the meat isn't seasoned but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

NGVOHfn_tf9_TxWxWbLgbw.text: First, the parking situation here is less than ideal.   This restaurant has a friendly staff and atmosphere that is a refreshing change from the cookie cutter chain restaurants that seem to be everywhere,   Upon entry, I was greeted by the hostess and shown to my table.  The waitress was there to take my drink order in less than 1 minute, however, I was here for the Chicken Fried Steak and ordered it, Mashed Potatoes and a Garden Salad along with my drink.  She brought some rolls, my drink and salad back within 2 or 3 minutes.  The main course, Chicken Fried Steak and Mashed Potatoes arrived a short time later.  I am not a small man, but this plate was packed with food and was too much for me to eat.  Everything tasted pretty good.  Overall, a good experience.  I would definitely eat here again.

f68wvbioQ4CmVQ8vB3PoxQ.text: Tried this place for the first time today for lunch.  The decor and feeling of the restaurant is unbeatable.  Takes you somewhere totally out of Phoenix(Texas).  The staff are super friendly and accommodating.  Now, to get to the food.  If you want real food for a good price the lunch menu is amazing.   I guarantee you will not leave hungry.  I had the chicken fried steak and you get two large portions of chicken fried steak a heaping portion of delicious mashed potatoes and corn.  A must have for anyone in the area!!!

29oH6myzmZQzp6v4fpgJRw.text: This place at one time seemed too "high concept", but multiple visits have convinced me that it is rather genuine: A plain-old Texas cultural embassy.  I think I've never had a bad meal there. The steaks could be thicker, I suppose. And they do grease 'em up before they grill 'em, but the over all effect with the mashed potatoes is pretty satisfying.  I always get a Shiner Bock when I'm there. At one time it was one of the few restaurants in the valley that had them available.  Parking is pretty bad, and the seats could be more comfortable. But basically, come hungry and leave happy.

4sh_Cc1GynGVO5c-9tOelA.text: Most recent visit here was for lunch, I need to eat here more often.  My buddy had the chicken fried steak and I had a pulled pork sandwich with cole slaw.  The pulled pork was juicy, smoky and very tasty with the fried onion straws. As for the CFS, I tried a bite and that's all I got as it quickly vanished from my compadres plate. Lunch service time was excellent and the food was great. And to top it off the prices were very good for lunch specials.

OpKbL_oNAOICjZzghlJdeA.text: Ladies and gentlemen let's get our feed bags on the portions are huge here. When you enter the restaurant there is a lot to take in lots of things all over to look at but pretty cool. I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak two fork tender pieces of beef lightly battered fried and topped with  homemade gravy. All entrees served with salad or Cole Slaw homemade mashed potatoes and gravy or texaz fries bread and butter. I would say this meal could feed someone for a week it's a lot of food but really good so if you want a great Chicken Fried Steak it's a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uBRraOlatAinAIecP4jnng.text: Good honest food.   I don't know what I could possibly say that hasn't been said already.   Go and see for yourself.   I'd get the prime rib any day of the week.   The chicken fried pork and chicken is great as well.   Real mashed potatoes and creamy chicken gravy are just perfect.   Try the bread pudding if you have any room left,  but I bet you won't.

o_MrH4pps5Wrw1KjhslRDQ.text: Went to Texaz on a whim wanting some steak and we were thoroughly disappointed. I ordered the t-bone, which was small and grey. There was no sear on the steak at all. The filet piece of the steak was about the size of a JFK half dollar. Huge disappointment. My friend got the shrimp dish done on the grill instead of fried. One of the shrimps was raw and they were tiny. Huge rip off for $16. Two stars for friendly service, good potato wedges and biscuits. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

DJfF_Nr200B-UV3KPWgAHA.text: What great food...had been wanting to visit this restaurant and I was not disappointed. Food was awesome and service was top notch. My daughter was given some candy and a toy to play with. Nice personal touch.

raaeu5uQMKuaiCEYKTUBXg.text: I've lived in the valley off and on since 1990, and have eaten here without exaggeration at least 100 times.  This is True Texas to the bone!  I've pretty much had everything on the menu, and have never had anything I didn't like.  The Smoked Prime Rib is Stellar as are The Mashed Potatoes.  The Chicken Fried Steak and Chicken as well as the Catfish are the real deal.  They don't heavily season their food out of the kitchen.  Last time I checked that's what the salt and pepper on the table is for!  I personally like the Chili they serve as well, reminds me of the Classic Texas Brick Chili my Mom made when I was a kid.  The Atmosphere, decor is True Central Texas. You have to have lived there or visit a lot to truly appreciate The True Texas vibe of this place.  I'm truly at home here and will keep on coming back.  Steve and the gang have a great long standing tradition here. Anytime I have family or friends from Texas in town visiting I always bring them here, and they always leave with a smile on their faces just like I do... Very refreshing to have such a down home, feel good vibe Restaurant such as this in The Valley of The Sun.

25Tz41ck7kVm8tqOePoSEg.text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots in Phoenix. It's a locals only kind of joint, where the walls are covered with Texas signs, license plates, etc and the ceiling is covered with business cards and baseball hats. The booths are deep and cushy, and let you settle in and get comfortable. Or, if you are dining alone, you might choose to sit at the bar, especially when they are crowded at lunch.  My favorite lunch is the grilled chicken sandwich, only available at lunch, which comes with onion, lettuce, tomato, and pickle on the side. Try the dirty mashed potatoes with gravy for a real home cooked meal feeling. If you order a side salad, they come with sliced olives!  For dessert, I recommend the home made pecan pie with a scoop of Blue Bird vanilla ice cream on the top.  The price is good, the food is good, and the service is always great and with a smile.

_m_vrLyxbwVkkMcOtL77dA.text: Went here today for my first time ever with my boyfriend....As a native Texan I can't believe I have never been here before. It was like stepping into an East Texas hometown, neighborhood restaurant. The decor had city limit signs, neons, pictures of Willie Nelson and Ronald Reagan. The delightfully tacky interior made me feel like I was home again.   Well, obviously like every other person that has written a Yelp review on TEXAZ Grill, we ordered the Chicken Fried Steak for our entrees. They first brought out rolls and biscuits. I like that the table has honey, hot sauce, and every other necessary condiment so you don't have to wait to have the server bring it over. We received a small plate of salad. Just enough to satiate the appetite's requirement for lettuce greens and ranch dressing.   My eyeballs literally popped out of socket when the server brought over our C.F.S. Oh Lawns, the portion was ENORMOUS!!! Like I told the server, everything really is bigger in Texas. The tender cubed steak was battered perfectly and smothered in a nice country gravy. Nonetheless, I decided to douse it in Cholula Sauce to give it a nice little kick. The mashed potatoes were definitely made Southern Style by mixing in the skins. By the time my tummy was ready to explode, I still had a full plate enough to share with two people. I am super surprised how large the portion is compared to the price point. Overall, a great deal and delicious meal. But eat here too often, and you will be contributing to the obesity epidemic in America.

_XPFv6eaRXdfzIX027OQOw.text: Exactly as expected. I had the country fried steak and I was full within ten bites. Must have been having one of those mornings.   Not really my thing, but a great experience and a really cool place. I will admit that I ate all the leftovers the same night, and it was still pretty damn good.  Guess Mama didn't make that much Chicken Fried Steak growing up.

7bdZImTdhip359moYXatqg.text: They don't make steakhouses like this anymore, fitting because you can't find this food anywhere else but TEXAZ Grill on 16th st and Bethany. Sure the parking lot is tiny and the original 70/80's decor is now full cycle into hip retro territory but by all that is righteous and proper in this world their CHICKEN FRIED STEAK and CHICKEN FRIED CHICKEN (yup, fried chicken breasts) is mind numbingly delicious.   This place is a must have for any True local Phoenician. Leave your ego at the door, they don't care. Comfortable and better than home. Good for the whole family or yourself looking for a meal.

Q4EXpsaAV15Lhub4fA35Ag.text: Wonderful food, great staff, awesome service!!! I have been eating here for decades and have never had a bad experience!!!

XZ3EeILWsCpHusftIdvR9A.text: Cool place Absolutely filled with Texas memorabilia. Authentic Texas diner style food. I had the Brisket sandwich which was very big and delicious. My dining companions had the Chicken Fried Steak which was gigantic and delicious. They have Shiner Bock beer(Texas Beer). Parking is a bit tight but worth it. Lunch prices are very reasonable. Four Stars. I will be back to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch menu.

OYJ0Ifk9n76IZE6jLTsp7w.text: First time here and received the best customer service from our waitress!  She was so sweet and nice.  And the food was delicious and reasonably priced.  Portions were pretty decent and we even had some leftover food to take home.  The decor is definitely something else... business cards on the ceiling, hats, posters, vintage signs, etc.  It's actually really cool.  The only negative I have about this joint is the parking.  It's some tight parking out there but it's manageable.  I'd come back again... the rib eye I ordered was on point!

vWqAzMJf6eeQYKyLp96UCA.text: Stopped in here not knowing what to expect and was pleasantly surprised with the strange decor and all of the hats hanging everywhere. The bartender was very friendly and talkative. Didn't have a chance to try the food (waiting for an Uber to take us to our next location) but our drinks were spot-on.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kitty smoking a pipe!

uzuzGRA9wXSBU357UuA8xQ.text: The staff at the Texaz Grill were very friendly and attentive.  The food was very tasty and boy, did they give you a lot! The owner/manager came by to talk to us and to ask us how our food and experience was. Very down to earth/homey. We totally recommend trying out the Texaz Grill.

r-HC3RjeiQHnBGX3fJxaaQ.text: My wife and I stopped in last night for the Tuesday night special of beef back ribs. It had been maybe fifteen years since we had last been here, and was both looking forward to some good ribs. However last night the ribs where charred way to black outside. Literally charcoal black. We both had beef ribs, but at least two of the five on each plate where not eatable.    Think forgotten under the broiler for way too long and then topped with lukewarm bbq sauce.  I ordered steak fries and received quartered potatoes that where also hard and dry and bland. Maybe I'll try back in another fifteen years.

gMusSpWDQisJgbvBNNyEMQ.text: Best chicken fried steak ever!!! They have huge portions, great service, and the food is delicious. One if my favorite parts is the atmosphere inside. It's a really cool spot. Owners are always there working and walking around. Awesome spot!  *phoenix foodies approved

LHxA5vYQCSywNOEy3cIPVA.text: This place has been located here for years and kept passing by their sign that said soooo many Chicken Fried Steaks served...naturally that peaked my interest.  So we finally made a point to go and try.  Their special was a BBQ Platter w/various smoked meats that had a sauce on top.  The meat itself was not seasoned a whole lot, for my taste, but the BBQ sauce was ok.  Their sausage was from Southside Market in (Elgin, TX) which was real good.  They also ship so this is a great way to test the sausage before you buy.  We also tried the Chicken Fried Steak, which comes with 2 pieces (1 HUGE piece that almost covered the entire plate and the other piece was 1/2 that size, so still very big).  The gravy they use was seasoned well, but again the Chicken Fried Steak was not seasoned enough for my taste.  The waitress, which I can't remember her name was very nice and attentive, which I like.   The restaurant itself was decorated with a lot of memorabilia, which was kind of cool and more importantly, it was dirty/dusty...so that is a good thing. I would definitely comeback again just to try other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Steak
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ Platter

haLcfVVNf74_pcm0H3upNQ.text: You only need to know three words walking into TEXAZ Grill: chicken fried steak. It's a huge monster, with a crispy double dipped batter layer encasing a beautiful tenderized steak, smothered with a beautiful white gravy. Without a doubt TEXAZ Grill has the best chicken fried steak in the Phoenix area, perhaps even Arizona!  Portions are huge too! The dinner portion actually gives you two steaks while the lunch portion gives you one. The coleslaw and mashed potatoes on the side were huge as well.  The restaurant is a bit small and the parking lot a bit smaller, but the interior is definitely cozy and the staff is very friendly. It really makes the meal worth it on top of the kick*** CFS. You NEED to try this out!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak so awesome it doesn&#39;t fit on the plate!

6QNYqIv5vOI5EEsSuhV6iQ.text: It's a beef place. I get it.  BUT....yours truly was in the mood for Catfish so I took a chance and WON!  This catfish was super crispy on the outside. Fluffy and plump on the inside. Just delicious.  Added a side of creamy peppery thin cut coleslaw and some chunky potatoes.  Tabasco, Lemon, Tartar Sauce.........tastebuds are happy.  First time ever tried Bread Pudding (YUM) and a Booker's Single Barrel Bourbon on the side was a perfect finish to a perfect meal.

Ncoi4AUV-hh_IaNTdtEzqQ.text: Yummy yummy yummy I got the chicken fried steak huge portion I had to take half home ...gravy was delicious our watress was very friendly and food was delivered to our table quick ...we got fried macaroni  cheese as an appetizer omg was so delicious ..better than Texas road house or Bobby qs ...def would recommend

weXp0NjktGqJGi9BKpWrGQ.text: Amazingly delish! I couldn't even begin to tell you how yummy all the food was. Totally coming back! Had the Chicken Fried Chicken, but coming back for the Prime Rib and Pork Chop!!! Must come and visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I mean come on!!!

Tk0O-j6ihxqFaQtdii2nGw.text: For Texas-sized portions at reasonable prices, look no further.  At Texaz Grill, they've perfected the art of breaded, deep fried foods.  I had the fried catfish, and tried the chicken fried steak.  The fried catfish was perfect.  The buttermilk breading was just the right amount of crispiness and had a great flavor to complement the delicate taste of the catfish.  The fish itself, was some of the best I've had.  The meat was very tender and flavorful.  The chicken fried steak was very good, with tender pounded beef and crispy breading.  There were 2 giant pieces on the platter, and it was topped with a generous amount of gravy.    As for sides, you have your choice of salad or coleslaw, and mashed potatoes or Texas fries.  I had some salad, which wasn't too impressive since it tasted like someone had made it way in advance, making it taste soggy and wilted.  The coleslaw was decent, in a mayo-based sauce that was tangy and sweet.  The mashed potatoes were a hearty portion of skin-on mash.    Service was friendly and drinks were refilled as needed.  Parking, on the other hand, is a nightmare if you come at a busy time.  Prices for dinner range from the teens to the low 20s, depending on what item you get.    So, I'd probably be interested in going here again next time I'm in the mood for some fried food, but only if it's at a less busy time where parking won't be as much of a hassle.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried catfish and mashed potatoes
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak

rj3yrAHK1Eh1DlQ5BIyVjQ.text: Really good prime rib. Tasty and tender. Cooked to perfection! Loved the smoked flavor. They cook it over pecan wood and add smoky ah jus. Very reasonably priced the mulligan cut is 16 ounce. And it was available at 9 pm

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My prime rib was cooked to medium well perfection

e5Gm_Qjjvl7z40vrkyb8FQ.text: Great food fun atmosphere.  Ordered the chicken fried chicken.  I recommend you get the small serving it fills the plate.   Seasoned perfectly and even though deep fried it was very lite and not greasy at all.  My husband got the brisket it was so tender and the smoke taste was phenomenal!  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Business cards line the ceiling.

FeCAd5csBhkx_akVOO4aeA.text: Once again some time has passed before we came here for dinner but we find ourselves happy we made our way back. The meal starts off with a simple salad and some fabulous biscuits and the entree was a massive serving of chicken fried chicken. We left happy and stuffed. The service was friendly efficient and there is a lot of look at on the walls and ceiling. It does appear that the menu is much smaller since our last visit but we got what we went there for so that was no concern to us.

dNjOBVPT7mZyshdr1_Hs_g.text: Can't believe it took us this long to try this place! Friends had eaten here and loved it. Husband and I decided to try it out and stopped in for Sunday dinner. The place has a relaxed, homey comforting feel. We both had the smoked prime rib. Came with small dinner salads which were cold and had chopped olives (like a tapenade) on them making for a tasty addition. The smoked prime rib was amazing. The flavor was incredible! Overall really enjoyed the meal and had great service...could easily become a new favorite spot for us.

PEY5yr3yAJvFOY3VIhFBBA.text: Peach cobbler hands down the best. Son likes fried catfish and chicken fried chicken.  I like the ambiance like a dive kind of place  Best food for hungry man....that's for sure. He's only 18, but my hungry man son likes big portions and lots of heavy foods.  Susan, night manager is super nice too.
