-EhI8VFxmqEH6ujMfO3fdg.text: Our waitress was Donna. The service was good Ole TX hospitality. It was a great evening thanks to Donna and the crew at TXAZ grill made it great.

vasDiAwrpuOTiu465aCTlg.text: Came by with my best friend, I'm a Texan myself and suggested this place due to the name... Well it met my expectations and surpassed them. The owner (I believe) was very friendly and interactive with all guest including our table not to mention the food, it was extremely  delicious and fulfilling!

aioFWdD6rP0H8JM1WjCRBg.text: Went to diner with friends. We ordered 3 specials (liver and onions) shrimp cocktail and a diner salad. I've been a server for some years and I gotta say walking into a busy restaurant like this one you expect to wait but nope! We were sat immediately and the waiter promptly greeted us. He coursed out meal perfectly which is hard. But the food!!!!! Was so amazing!!! I thought I hated liver and onions but now thanks to this restaurant I'm a huge fan.

8qNuEdjq8H8oegZPcVza-Q.text: Found this on Yelp & decided we HAD to come check it out. I'm a huge fan of chicken fried chicken, I know everyone said this was known for the steak but I figured they would both be great.  I was correct! Our server & all other staff we came in contact with was super sweet. Our food came out piping hot exactly how we ordered it. Huge pieces of chicken, my husband & I could of easily shared it. Only complaint was the breading fell off of every piece I would cut. Eh. Oh well. We will def be back.

aBpvBK6lOnZ7CKfhqpmqPw.text: I've been wanting to hit up TEXAZ Grill for a while and finally got a chance to last week for lunch. Had read about their chicken fried steak and my mouth was watering before I arrived just thinking about it. Unfortunately, I was completely underwhelmed by my plate. The portion was large and reasonably priced for lunch, but everything on the plate was so bland. The CSF also tasted more stale instead of having a nice, crispy crunch. My friend had the catfish poboy which wasn't anything special. I'll give them the home-fried potatoes...nice crisp outside and perfectly cooked inside. Waitress was friendly and efficient. Prices are a lot more expensive for dinner. Probably won't be back.

ZmEHd5i85zg0-ixI321_XQ.text: Really good chicken fried steak, great service and large portions.  Will definitely go again.

IGDbaoPl9XWZ3zo_Z3QSbQ.text: I have been eating here for years. Great food.  Portions are smaller than they where a few years ago, and the pricing has gone up. The mashed potatoes and country grave is second only to my mothers. My kids can share the chicken fried chicken. So much chicken!

3JmYM9DVQYqtMVyLJ1WCEQ.text: I was told about this place as soon as I came to town from GA two years ago. Kicking myself for waiting so long to visit. Great chicken fried steak and viddles! Come and get it! Don't forget to ask about the "clean plate club".

J73xJKqRyfIanWXsTL97hw.text: I gotta give it to TEXAZ for the huge portions that come out of that kitchen, very Texan indeed. I could seriously split an entree if I was pretty hungry, and I don't say that much. So, do yourself a favor and don't be worried about how many calories you're about to intake when you visit this establishment.  Now, the food itself was okay. I was seriously expecting an explosion of chicken fried steak in my face! I was ready for pure sodium sin that would allow my taste buds to dance in circles around every morsel with pitch forks raised in True devil worshiping style. This was probably why I wasn't insanely impressed. The steak itself was pretty good, but the gravy wasn't what I expected at all. I've been spoiled in the past with overwhelmingly flavorful sausage gravy with biscuits, and that's what I was expecting. So be warned if you're expecting something similar to that. But, again mentioning portions, that was the biggest chicken fried steak that I've ever had.  Fried okra, a dinner salad and their red chili were also chosen off the menu that night. The okra was pretty good, just battered and deep fried, and served with some sort of sauce (I didn't examine it well enough to say what it was). The salads were pretty good, but go for the vinaigrette because the ranch was sort of bland. Oh, and be prepared for a lot of dressing. Lastly, the chili...it was served the proper way with cheese and onions, which was nice, but I wasn't blown away with the flavor of this either. In all honesty, it seemed like they meant to cook it with MGD, but didn't cook all of the alcohol out...it was essentially beer flavored chili.  I'm going to go back to TEXAZ for sure (waitress was pretty sweet by the way), but I think my next visit will be for lunch. Some of their sandwiches look fantastic, and I'm really hoping to become a big fan of TEXAZ after trying some of them.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red chili
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sooo much!
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried okra

5f2o5kgMcYXTsvqkj2oXpA.text: Steak was flavorless and the chicken fried steak was tough. The mashed potatoes and gravy were delicious though. I won't be returning that's for certain.

8lfTXZPLGqsgZ_5T4FaqMQ.text: My  ex-hubby and I used to frequent this place in 1991 when it was called The Lone Star. It was awesome then...and it's still just as awesome!!! I moved away for 20 years and when my ex-mother-in-law came into town we decided to give Texaz Grill a try, not even thinking that it was the same place.   Boy! Were we pleasantly surprised!!  Nothing has changed! Not the decorations, not the menu, not the friendly staff, not the quality of the food...NOTHING!!! Ok. I'm lying. There was a different picture on the back of the ladies room door.  We all ordered the Ribeye with the house salad/house dressing, homemade mashed potatoes and cream gravy. I've dreamt about those mashed potatoes!! The steaks were perfect! Juicy, tender, flavorful, cooked to order. Chain steakhouses have NOTHING on this place!  We finished our meal with the homemade bread pudding with whiskey sauce. Trust me, you've never had bread pudding so good! Full of cinnamon, raisins, and pecans with the most delightful whiskey sauce.  If you live in Phoenix or are just passing through stop in at The Texaz Grill! You won't regret it!

ua-2SC_IdppYupdKLZcuSQ.text: Love Love Love. Waitresses are superb. Beef Kabobs - scrumptious. Prime Rib (if you get there early enough) is rare (my fav) and generous. The Shrimp cocktail - wow. And what's not to love on Fish Friday - Cod. Waitress' Coby and our gal are more than Outstanding. It gets kinda crowded, but we are a larger group (10+) and love our food and the smiling, quick, smart service.

eZZpKr-ugPtGqqTE4_svHw.text: How have I never been here before? This restaurant is ridiculous. It is over the top, covered in Texas themed stuff, business cards covering the ceiling, and complete with Texas sized portions. I came here with my dad and his friend yesterday for lunch and was very impressed with this place. The lunch prices are a total steal, with most entrees costing 8$ and the portions big enough for two people. We split the (house specialty) chicken fried steak and a brisket sandwich. I don't know that I've ever had chicken fried steak before, and I don't know that I would ever have it again (the idea of frying steak just doesn't sit well with me.... if I'm gonna eat steak, I want to taste it), but this CFS was fairly good. The meat was surprisingly tender, the gravy was flavorful, the portion was obscenely large. It came with very tasty mashed potatoes, a biscuit, and some plain jane corn. The biscuit was good, but not the best in town. The real star of this place was the brisket. Ohhhh the brisket gods smile on this place for sure. Their brisket is super tender and the sauce they put on it was heavenly. I ate the brisket with a fork out of the bun because the bun just obscured the awesome brisket flavor, no need for it. I will definitely come back here for the brisket!

EiSWzPNYIQlLbxU0grvcrQ.text: Only been there once as we were in the area for an appointment at Shasta pools. The chicken fried steak was large & delicious. The atmosphere is nice and inviting, so is the staff. No reason to be giving them less than 5 stars. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

eZe5AofS_cK09eBYlJzQqQ.text: Awesome place to hang out with family. Their steaks are phenomenal. I especially love their creamy and tasty smash potato. Will be back soon.

7MxcvjPeJMfbYb2-7-XUnA.text: Went here the other night with a group of friends. The staff was extremely accommodating for our crowd. The server was just awesome. And then there's the food. SO DELICIOUS! I had the chicken fried goodness and it was to die for. The gravy alone should be bottled and sold. If you are in the mood for some Texas sized portions and delicious Texas sized flavor....make this restaurant a stop for you!

mVK4muWETXMfCULyj2LHXw.text: I found this restaurant on Yelp and went for dinner based on the reviews. Texaz was great on all points. Even though the menu was not extensive the items were well rounded. Prices were very reasonable, portions were large and food was delicious! My husband had the chicken fried steak and I had the smoked, barbecue spare ribs. Service was efficient and friendly. I would definitely go there again.

R-JOnE1hyrKMxxlR8jBXuA.text: Alright.  I am finally writing a review for TEXAZ.    One word.  Friggin awesome.  Ok, two words.  I am a huge fan of the smoky prime rib of which I usually get the mulligan (or the American) cut, a 22 oz monster that comes with a killer jus and horseradish.. mmmmmmmmmmmm.  The chicken fried steak is what they are famous for but try the fried chicken.  Super juicy.  Make sure you get there a little early as they tend to run out of the prime rib...

PmFumCqp-4g04XmpVcYlxw.text: I'm not one to complain very often about a meal, but this is an exception. I came in to try their Prime Rib but I was told I couldn't order it until 4pm and it was 3:30. Since I was starving, I chose not to wait and ordered their ribeye with mashed potatoes and gravy. It came with a very basic salad which was ok. When my meal came, I dug into the steak which was cooked correctly but I noticed a lot of oily liquid on the plate. This mystery liquid covered up whatever flavor the steak had. The gravy on the potatoes was strange tasting and I only took a couple bites.  Any other day I would have sent the meal back, but I was so tired and hungry after coming from the airport that I managed to down most of the steak even though it wasn't at all good. I wasn't going to complain after eating a decent portion of my food. The service was adequate but I can't recommend this place based on my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I don&#39;t know what the liquid was.
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribeye

-30M_CfSAVChY7BygTORLw.text: Who the hell does this guy think he is?  Yes, he just sold the place, but my wife and I registered her birthday with Texazgrille.  Now we get an email saying we MUST use her certificate ON THE DAY OF HER BIRTHDAY as if to say she has nothing better to do on her birthday.  Usually, retuarants give at least a week to a month to utilize a gift ctf.  No thanks.  The food is ok and the parking sucks.  Forget it.

bhk24xjdScpj46Ok0p5mjA.text: Attentive friendly people, quick informative service, awesome smile inducing decor, great no need for bs cell phone climate, and...fricken huge delicious multi meal great deal chicken fried steak!!!  Less expensive that Taco Bell if you calculate per ounce and manage to dodge the barley soda:)

5AvNECfmwoZflp1alUqNTQ.text: Their chicken fried steak is the best I ever had and the hugest portion I ever had. It hung over the edges of the large plate by 3 inches on each side. Their prime rib is delicious too. Best is their 1/2 pound dinner cheeseburger which is incredible. All of their prices are very reasonable and the staff and owner are top notch.  Not one thing negative to say about this fine restaurant, except that apparently the word has gotten out to the Snowbirds, but they still always manage to seat us right away

JfYbZH0AEbOFP-bkif_l2w.text: Yet another visit to Texaz.   Tips for my Yelp friends: 1.  Happy hour 4-6 pm half price beers/wine/.etc  plus special entrees 2.  If you visit several times, be sure to get a "Clean Plate Card" started up.  Bring it back for each visit and something real good will soon happen. 3.  Ask for Devin as a waiter - excellent service.  My wife had catfish for the first time in her life; she enjoys many seafood varieties but never pulled the catfish handle.  Really enjoyed it. Southern style pork chops were great as always.  Do it!!!

74d56IzAOImdY2t5mQAZoQ.text: Some good traditional home cooking. The Chicken Fried Steak is a must try. The Prime Rib smoked over Pecan wood, OMG that was a treat. The gravy here is amazing and the Pecan Pie is from heaven. No matter how full I get with dinner I still order the pie and it manages to disappear. Thank God I don't live around here cuz it would not be good for my health.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hf9fFNJaXhtyezL4tG6gmg.text: My hubby found this place online and we decided to give it a try. We started with the onion rings. Beyond delicious. Then I got the filet and mashed potatoes and he got the chicken fried steak. Everything was amazing. The service was great. The people were friendly and we stuffed ourselves because it was so good we couldn't help ourselves. We will be back. Home cooking and comfort food like you would not believe. Overall fair prices, nice people and delicious food. Thanks for a nice time.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filet and mashed potatoes

yLKwXoSdWQKi4TyWjGZe8g.text: The TEXAZ Grill so far my best place and my favorite to get the biggest chicken fried steak I've ever eaten So light and crispy breading is to die for, you must get it with the Mass potatoes so yummy!!!! Like they said it's always bigger in Texas.  They do also have other amazing favorites too but if you are a chicken fried steak fan then you have to come down and try it out.  They have great customer service, great server they are so nice and sweet.  The inside is very busy but it has a lot of history on the wall you always find something new on the wall I haven't seen the last time you were there. So if you ever get a chance to stop in and get yourself a big ass chicken fried steak.  Mmm mm good.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xQAu1taS8FOW9SvEvv_NAQ.text: Four stars for the food.   This place is known for their chicken fried steak which is what I had. For me, a little too much breading and not nearly enough gravy. The flavor however was legit. Better than homemade. (I couldn't stand my step mothers chicken fried steak. Lol).   The plate came with mashed potatoes that were outstanding!  And corn which was as one would expect, and a buttermilk biscuit (nothing to write home about). We got an order of fried okra and that was fantastic. Just the right breading and the dipping sauce was out of this world!  The atmosphere here is of a style I like. Kind of divey, and full of nostalgia. Service was really good, and maybe just a little "too" attentive.   Fun place though!  I'll be back. I want to try their bbq brisket.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak!

LOaPXEk2bU5AkYVLc7kF-w.text: As a Texan, I am impressed! Especially by the amount of food for that price. I'm anxiously awaiting my next chicken fried steak :)

zZnBKNEscNbSQs3b0IU96g.text: I absolutely love Texaz Grill! I have been going to this establishment since I was a young kid and it went by the name Lonestar. (no affiliation with the chain restaurant) I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a little good old fashioned southern cooking. I am originally from Alabama and I give this place the  for their amazing southern vibes and food.

xC7iwy5BCJ9kmNjquKOdmQ.text: Oh my god so amazing the atmosphere in 5he building is so beautiful every were you look its different totally would recommend the kid chicken fried steak its the same size as the adult just u get ice cream

Wbwl2hLawFDBx68Rz-sqyg.text: If you are searching for that down home cooking, this is the place. Country fried steak, lumpy mash potatoes, milk gravy, biscuit and slaw with both mayo and vinegar - dinner trip 1. Just to be sure I had found my southern heaven roots I made trip 2 for lunch before my post. Fried catfish sandwich (did request a bun instead of hoagie - yes the fish was at least twice the size of the bun) and quarter potatoes. Splurged with the fried okra and pecan pie.  Of which was soooooo good. I will be back.  Portions are large - supported by others carrying out to go bags too.

7fijjCvFMzohdT7isPTCZA.text: I finally got the Prime rib that is served only on the weekends. WOW. Now I know why they run out every time early. So tender and flavorful, I mean, the fat was good. Very country with mashed potatoes and gravy but that's good too. I would like to give five stars but the CFS I had the first time was jus OK. You can call ahead and reserve a prime rib if you know your gonna be later as usual. They usually run out by 6pm.

aNaPBTI-wOrZolytLvTQLw.text: Me and my buddy loved this place.  He had the Chicken Fried goodness and I had the smoked Prime Rib.  DankAF!  Lovely staff who are super friendly

d0xzpKjuvih-3ut-abnokw.text: So decided to try Texaz grill since I heard they have the best country fried steak in AZ. They also have good reviews. Go in and it's $16.50 for a fried steak and some mashed potatoes. $15 for catfish. A bit pricey but I press on. Get the food and I'm greeted with quite possibly the saddest plate ever. A small wallop of country gravy for two massive steaks on this tiny plate. It was honestly a little insulting.   But again I press on. Rear up to cut into this steak that has been so hyped. I raise my fork expected to be raised to heaven and...I'm met with the most tasteless piece of fried food I've ever had in my life. That couldn't be so I try again and again until I finally give. It has absolutely no flavor. Not only that but the breading is very thick and little meat present. Decide to try their Creole seasoning courtesy of zatarans at the table. It helped but not enough to pick the pieces up of my shattered expectations. I've had astronomically better country fried steak at country boys down the street. Even dennys. Mashed potatoes is the same. No flavor. Even the gravy has none. As a Texan I'm appalled honestly that this is considered the best. I push the plate away and prep to bag it up. Maybe my dogs will eat it :-(they didn't).  Move onto the catfish and same thing. No flavor with thick odd breading. Not the usual delicious crisp light cornmeal breading I'm used to in the South but something heavy and bland. No taste at all. Even covering it in spicy cocktail sauce couldn't help. Thinking about it. It didnt seem like any catfish I've ever had. Seemed more like cod. Either way it was awful.  I'm defeated and we leave disappointed. Lol Worst $34 I've spent. Food was just lifeless. Save yourself the anguish and go to country boys on camelback or even Denny's. This is one disappointed Texan.

__sAGpguWxtLZMWsDDLb0g.text: Awesome fried catfish!  The cole slaw is awesome as well as the mashed potatoes.  The wait staff is very friendly.... ALWAYS enjoy going back to TexAz!

GiKrW5m8QjwafLEzVqzXwA.text: We made a reservation one month in advance for a Christmas get together for 12 People at 4pm. By 415 there were 6 or 7 of us there and more trickling in. The waitress tried to take away one of our tables because we were not all there at 410. I think they were bothered because we had presents on the table and in some chairs. Ar 5 the manager came over and said you had a reservation for 12 where is the rest of your party?  Really? By 515. We were all there ordering food and eating. I myself spent 90 bucks. The service was terrible had to ask for things 3 and 4 times.  Very few people were there until right before 7pm it started picking up but there were plenty of empty tables. A few minutes after 7 the manager came to our table where people still had food in front of them and said we had to leave because we had had the table for 3 hours. Mind you there were 10 middle aged women drinking and eating. No one was rude or loud except for the manager of this establishment. I have never been treated like this for no reason before. I will never go here again.

YaCN0by1djT6sWKB3j8sRQ.text: I meet up with my buddy from TX for some home cooking (as he said).  We sat up on the bar.  We were greedy and wanted our own meal.  Portions are HUGE, Texas size!  He got the chicken fried steak.  I got the chicken fried chicken.  It was very good... smothered in gravy kind of good.  WOW!  I did not think I could, but I ate the WHOLE thing.  ALL OF IT!  The service was great.  The only thing sucked is the parking...  I parked across the street and waddled or rolled back to my car after dinner.  Maybe I needed the extra walking steps for the calories I inhaled?

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried chicken

MZCF6R-FvjVyDRTs-UsJew.text: A long standing landmark that I recently visited for lunch was found to be a real treat. I have given this establishment 4 stars not for the venue or the ambiance of the furnishings, but, for the quality of the food, service and the wholesomeness of the experience. The food is home cooked and portions are very generous.  Their chicken fried steak is one of the main stays of this business. I had that item for my lunch. I took home the remains of my lunch and my wife and finished for lunch the next day. The steak hangs over all sides of the plate. The price of $9 was  a real bargain.  If in the area or if you want to try a restaurant that represents what the old west was about 50 years ago, this is the place. Nothing fancy just good fixins.

wI2WWMIaGwNgFKCYLvwgCw.text: Excellent fish fry. If you are looking for a lightly battered flakey cod with no heavy beer flavor this is the place for you Friday nights great price =) Not to mention juicy tender ribeye with big chunks of French fries.

fiJhC1GbxR9QLzlQ2JxLOQ.text: One of my favorite meals is the chicken fried steak, mashed potato's, both covered with milk gravy and a side of fried okra.  Talk about memories, my mom's is the best.  So when we discovered this place, we didn't know if it would match my memories or be another frozen mock up.  Walking in, the decor is really country chic, very old school, from the old photo's, the license plates to the lighting.  Our server was quick and friendly.  We got our food and it was delicious, since my meal didn't come with the fried okra, it was an add on, it came out way before our meal along with the bread, and both was eaten way before the main meal, but, they were hot and I didn't want them to cool off, so we ate.  As for the chicken fried steak, the breading was close, but not exact to my mothers, it didn't taste or look like a frozen piece, so it was one the best, chunky, breading, golden brown, tender steak.   So someone knew what they were doing with cube steak!

e8RXZPMRpi3yrs82CLZpYA.text: If you're expecting fine dining by candlelight, you're looking in the wrong place. TEXAZ GRILL is a down home, stick to your ribs place to get DELICIOUS food and good value as well! The staff have always been friendly and efficient. The atmosphere is relaxed, so loosen your tie, and your belt for that matter. If you've got the right attitude and appetite, you can't really go wrong here.  Granted, this is NOT Health food and not advertised as such, but for a truly guilty pleasure when my stomach's grumbling, you'll find me waiting at a table for a chicken fried steak. Drooling! :-) Thanks TEXAZ GRILL family. You've been MY personal go to restaurant for about 20 years. Have never been disappointed!

9pUu78Xk5DJVIXSe6B-KJg.text: Being a Texas Native and foodie. This place is legit. Being my first time here thanks to a Yelp search for chicken fried steak this was on top of the list, I had to check it out. Seeing the decor on the wall I had to make a Texas License Plate donation because after two years of being here I finally caved in and registered my car in AZ and coincidentally had it in my trunk. This donation yielded the opportunity to meet Steve the owner. Steve was awesome we chatted about Tex-Mex food and life in Texas. It was delightful meeting him.   Now on to the food. We ordered a dish on their daily special of biscuits topped with a chicken fried steak topped with eggs. This may sound weird but that's how you eat them in Texas. Food was killer. Steve was also generous in bringing us a sample of his BBQ brisket and mash potatoes. Again legit Texas style food. As BBQ competition person whose tasted some of the best BBQ in Texas I have to give two thumbs up, all the food had great flavor. And we even tried the cobbler topped with Bluebell ice cream. Which if it had anything other than Bluebell than that would be a sin.   We will be back to try other menu items and next time go with a bigger appetite.

NY_5Svxb9It9Cp1B_vL8vw.text: We hadn't been to Texaz in about ten years, so we thought it would be fun to take the kids last weekend. It's still crowded and with the animals, posters, newspaper articles on the walls and hundreds of ballcaps hanging from the ceiling, the atmosphere at Texaz is a genuine version of the type of place that chain restaurants pay designers big money to create. For kids, its a cornucopia of sights and sounds to look at which accounts for the two stars I'm giving it.  However, it doesn't get any more stars because the food has really gone downhill. Naturally my wife and I ordered the meal that this restaurant is famous for - chicken-fried steak with mashed potatoes and gravy and as I said, we hadn't been there in about ten years, but there is no way the food used to be this bland. Unfortunately, this was one of the most boring chicken-fried steaks I have ever had. The breading had no flavor and the gravy didn't add any either. I like good chicken fried steak, but this wasn't it. In fact, I'd be embarrassed to bring anyone from Texas to this place.  Sorry Texaz, I know you're a Central Phoenix institution, but you're riding on past glory.

_dbgrHxhPXmfukrZOInzog.text: It's always a good sign when you open a menu and it doesn't require a Cliffs Notes version.  That means what they do, they do really well. This place is no exception.   The chicken fried steak (the lunch menu version might I add) was very, very generous.  Two out of our party of three ordered that right up. The third was an order of chicken fingers from the kids menu.  The kids menu has a nice selection of choices that are sure to please even the pickiest of palattes (prime rib!), and the chicken fingers were really delicious - tender, juicy and seasoned well.  Though my kiddo preferred ranch dressing, I'd opt for a vat of their gravy if it were up to me!  The chicken fried steak was cooked perfectly.  Anyone who knows anything about chicken fried steak knows there is an art to the fork tender meat and that perfect crust-to-meat ratio.  Well, they nailed it.  Each bite of the "skin-on little bit lumpy like your momma would make" mashed potatoes was a heavenly little vehicle for their yummy country gravy.  The corn was corn.  Even the corn knows it's not the star of this dish, so it's there for support.  Biscuits were hot and tasty. Half the  biscuit got some gravy lovin' and the other half, a little kiss of butter and honey.  Blue Bell ice cream cups for the kids were a nice treat.  So the food's great, no lie.  But I'd come back even if it wasn't because the service was stellar: friendly, engaging and welcoming.  Do yourself a favor, especially if you're needing a taste of home, and check this place out.

y_GHSV9heMn2apes67sgrg.text: Very nice and accommodating, bottles of wine at great prices.. Food was good and very large, I will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great price on wine!!

S2rPVt1K1biUaJvFmsECpQ.text: I was in the mood for steak, while in Phoenix on vacation. After reading the reviews on Yelp, we decided to try Texaz. It is a local restaurant, which is appealing to me. We both had the smoked prime rib. The meat was cooked to perfection and was very flavorful. The mashed potatoes with creamy gravy were, likewise, excellent. Portions were big. The service was great. The only downside was that parking was a little scarce when we were there, but please don't let that deter you. I'll definitely want to remember this restaurant the next time I visit Phoenix.

qgsnTTOhU4lNYVMEtb0UMw.text: This native Texan has found a place to call home while traveling!  I now live in Colorado, but travel to Phoenix for work.  I stomped on my brakes and made some tires squeal as I stopped to turn into this place when I was perusing for places to eat.  I'm certainly glad I did.  There are certain health related lines the people of Colorado do not like to cross, and every once in a while I just really want everything deep fried.    I started off my evening with some Deep Eddy grapefruit vodka on the rocks.  Feeling like home already.  I sat at the bar, and the bartender was very nice and attentive.  She gave me advice on where to stay, what to do, ect.  I ordered fried okra as an appetizer because I miss all things okra.  It was hand battered and not the prefrozen BS you sometimes get at lower tier BBQ joints.  It came with this mustard based sauce which was delicious.  I of course sprinkled some Texas Pete's pepper sauce on top which is how God intended fried okra to be consumed.    I then moved on to the fried catfish.  I got the cole slaw and salad as a side.  I was a little worried because the catfish isn't corn meal battered like I'm so used to, but it was crisp, delicious, and hit the spot.  I squeezed lemon on top and sprinkled on some zatarains seasoning blend, and gave it a good dunk in the tartar sauce.  I ordered the lemonade drink special which featured titos vodka, prickly pear syrup, lemonade, and bubble water.  It was very refreshing and complimented my dinner.    This will be my watering hole every time I come into Phoenix.  Definitely worth the stop.

IwwxNiuLgjmTuLxKQGk8Tg.text: We went on Mother's Day so the place was a bit busy, but the people were very accommodating. When you walk in you think you might be in the wrong place, but once you're seated, it's like you're family. The service was great. Food was delicious and you can't beat the prices.

3WYy6sTQi6EdKpenAQBssA.text: We just left Texaz, and I just had a write a review because the experience was so amazing!  We were with a big party of 13 people ranging in ages from 3 to 40.  The owner came by and played trivia with all of the kids at the table and gave out prizes for the right answers. How often does something like that happen?    Service - Our service was top notch!  We each ordered several courses and our server was always on top of drink refills, each order was correct, and we had to ask for nothing as she anticipated what each of us would need.  She was quiet but very thoughtful.  Food - Giant - Texas size portions, great tasting and very reasonably priced, considering our group was mostly teenagers what more could you ask for?  The chicken fried steak is amazing!!!  Decor/ambience - lots and lots of things on the wall and an infinite amount of Texas kitsch.  I would recommend Texaz for lunch or dinner any day of the week.  It was a great experience and the food was outstanding!

71HJiozS5x3f7MY7yqiyQA.text: This place is great and Steve, the owner, is always there and stops by to chat often.  I ALWAYS have the chicken fried chicken sandy with longhorn cheddar.  Fantastic!  They have a secret sauce that goes well with the sandy, its basically a glorified thousand island.  It comes with a side of the house gravy that I use with the potatoes.  The wife ALWAYS has the catfish and she just loves it.  The soup yesterday was a Mexican cheese soup, tomato based with spices and longhorn cheddar.  Let me tell you that this soup was out of this world.  I will be checking the website often to see when it is back and will surly go have it again.  Most of the soups are great and every day there are different specials.  Definitely have to check this place out if you have not been.

Mca493kzuaHrTlMl6XfnCw.text: Had a great meal here.  Loved the chicken fried chicken!!  Don't go here if you want fancy food - it is down home style and BE HUNGRY!!

l1c0sjbN7qgsO08RQ03zdg.text: I kept reading about the chicken fried steak from here in various papers so of course, I had to come in here and order their infamous chicken fried steak.  All the reviews were True to their word. The chicken fried steak is gigantic in portion smothered in country gravy served with mashed potatoes and corn. And of course, buttery biscuit.  Well, I don't remember much after ingesting a quarter of the chicken fried steak cause my brain went into a food coma.  I do remember doggie bagging still enough food for 3 meals, staggering to my car and driving home.  Where I hope, once home, I took a nap.

e6CG5jpuF-z8dh_fSembNQ.text: This was my first visit to this restaurant. At first because the parking lot was very tight my initial thoughts were I'm not going to like this.   It was definitely worth the visit. Staff and food were great.   My family and I will definitely be back.  We tried the prime rib, and chicken fried steak.  Very tasty.

2Iykzd_oOI6F8QFbkYG1Pg.text: Love everyone here! Great food, great people! Grab a drink with a Tammy at the bar! Cheap drinks from 4-6!

SehergAeGGjETmBtfnkncg.text: Best food in the valley! I love this place! I go there about twice a month! I would go there more often but I live in Tempe. This place is worth the drive if you live within a hour of this place. I would eat there three times a week if it was in my neck of the woods! Way to Tex az you got a customer for life!!!!!

fjY7Wa61N5OLchpoCR0Krw.text: Had the Chicken Fried Steak... Oh man talk about Yum!   This place does it right,  fast friendly service,  reasonable prices.. They have all the bases coveted and they been doing it a long  time.   It's difficult to please this critic but they did.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak so good!

ATLJgoVJ16sW1rr2fta4Cw.text: I saw so many great reviews from this place so we decided to try it. I had very high hopes. I loved the atmosphere and the kids loved the Texas trivia game, but that's about the only good thing I could say. My steak came out and was not cooked the way I asked. They took it back to fix it. The steak had no flavor and was just covered in butter. I thought it was just my steak, but even the kids didn't eat there's.  The waitress asked my daughter of something was wrong since she only ate a few bites so I explained she didn't like it. She just said ok and walked away. The shrimp was good, but pricey. The bugers were just ok. At the end they were pushing for us to take it home since we ate almost none of it. We politely declined and she still came out with boxes trying to get us to take it. The chicken fried chicken that my daughter's friend ordered  was another item thatcwas horrible.  The gravy had no flavor and when I tasted it the piece I had was so fatty. I pulled the skin out of it and it didn't even look fully cooked. Maybe we were there on an off night, who knows, but for me it was very pricey for the quality of food we recieved.  Nothing had flavor so I guess that's why all the sauces and spices are in the table.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried chicken. No flavor and fatty
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. NY strip. No flavor

ArYQumpNab7F4klxLEWzuQ.text: First time here, been meaning to try it for years.  The fried okra is good, as was the coleslaw.  I ordered the "small" chicken fried chicken with mashed potatoes, it was delish.  Couldn't finish it.   Boyfriend had the regular order of Chicken fried steak and it was huge.  Couldnt finish it. Our waitress was SUPER nice and the food and drinks came timely.  Great hospitality, great food.  Yummy comfort food, country restaurant with a very inviting and homeie feel.  We will eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Okra.
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Regular order of Chicken fried steak.
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. SMALL chicken fried Chicken

vL6xnneR8SGU0rywXFNbCA.text: It had character!  The shrimp cocktail was great!  The salad was a simple iceberg with tomatoes and a great tasting dressing.  I got the beef kabob and was disappointed in the beef.  The mashed potatoes were awesome, though!  The waitress was great.

JYt-q7c94rBcguGZpEhYbA.text: Rib eye steak so good, it felt illegal to use A1 steak sauce.  Mashed potatoes were homemade and gravy was great.  Biscuits are soft, soda glass is big so you don't have to worry about a ton of refills.  Coleslaw was very good too.  Only thing i didn't like was the parking lot.  Very limited and tight so take a cab or small car.  Big pickup trucks will have a hard time in that yard.  But the food was great ill be back.

whqksoRz8G26W3IWCoZQrQ.text: Been here many times and I absolutely love this restaurant.  Would totally recommend as the food is great, awesome atmosphere, and the owner is a stand up guy.  I get the chicken fried chicken every time I go and I live it.  The chicken is awesome and very moist, the gravy on top is also to die for. It is very rich and creamy but it doesn't overpower the taste of the chicken.  I would totally recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal.

rd6rR5ODUe4O9S3uXyv4bA.text: Id definitely recommend this texas style hole in the wall joint.  It reminds me of my days I texas.  Funny bumper stickers and hats as decor. Expire fed friendly waitstaff that know how to get you feeling comfortable or put you I your place.   I went with a cold bud light as the domestic choices just spoke to me! The chopped brisket sandwich was really quiet good despite being served upside down.  Maybe that's the thing.  I ordered a frito pie and and it came on bag ready to go.  What a good ole Sunday place. They brought be a fun little fried rice cake beignet thing with a good amount of powdered sugar and life was good.  If this place wasn't in a strip center I think you'd believe you were in a shack on a ranch grubbing down. Enjoy!

FgVgiMLynTtCa0dh5zJ1wg.text: Still our family choice for birthday celebrations and still 5 stars!   Had another amazing chicken fried steak meal there tonight for 10....finished off with the substantial hot fudge sundae and treated like royalty throughout!

Ppki_UBDQ2tznQmmNHc3pA.text: The BEST Prime Rib, Thursday night special and Rib eye in town. And Tammy makes it worth it all!

V6zjzW6-y36ldAvXewjugA.text: Awesome service, awesome look and feel, and AMAZING food!  Parking sucks, but its worth the struggle!

EostdTsi8jgDR9KZLe8l0A.text: Always a must every time we visit Phoenix. The chicken fried steak is as good as anywhere we've dined throughout the south.The atmosphere reminds us of the honky-tonks in Nashville, Tn. minus the dance floors and live music. Servings are gigantic, the food is cooked to perfection, icy cold beer and nothing but friendly prompt sevice. Nothing pretentious, simple down home cooking, reasonably priced. What's not to like if you're in the mood for comfort food.

oRQmSEMYH0WljOUnYYDglQ.text: While in Phoenix we stopped in here for lunch.  There is a great ambiance here and a great Texas style feel to it.  I had the chicken fried steak.  The menu claims it is fork tender.  While I wouldn't go quite that far, it was very good, served with mashed potatoes and plenty of cream gravy.  The star of the show was my wife's brisket club sandwich.  It was absolutely delicious and so tender.  It was served with a very course cut of home fries (Texas size) and was also very good.  If you get the chance, definitely stop in.

-_x95yCUiCxtlalp1d_uOQ.text: Wow! Great comfort food.  I had the catfish and it was perfectly crispy and delicious.  The service is just as good.  Southern hospitality at its finest!

-p2ygpBCIzJfXOfy-GDYcg.text: TexAZ Grill is a low key hidden gem in Phoenix.  It's location is modest, its decor is eccentric, very Texan inspired, and the size of the restaurant is fairly small.  The portions however are not so small.  I went for Brunch and of course I had to try the chicken fried steak everyone raves about. I was not disappointed in the CFS, just as the man other yelpers state, it is Indeed very good. Not made of the usual ground beef type of meat, it was more of an actual deep fried thinly pound steak.  What also came as a surprise, was how much I enjoyed the side dishes. The gravy was amazing, as were the biscuits and if your thirsty, may I suggest the Turlingua Sunrise. I cannot wait to come back and try a big juicy steak.  God bless Texas!

krrqSgiPss5o16cpYNZ79w.text: This is my favorite place in the whole world.  Chicken fried steak is my absolute favorite meal ever and they make it just the way I like it. From the salad with house dressing to the enormous portion of steak and potatoes - I am in heaven.  Plus I love the little chilled glass for my Shiner.  If you homestyle cooking this is your place

a2Q8VDLgRDVWrzEm5M2_HA.text: Ehhh it was okay ... I guess I didn't get the memo about the chicken fried steak , I order something else and it wasn't all that ... bartender was cool overall cool place just needs to more on menu

F7MfS6CZ7kps2Wg_GjUHQA.text: To be fair, this review is based only on the CFS, as we both had it. The best way to describe it is "Quantity over Quality. It is way, way WAY overrated.  We saw the chicken fried steak review in the Arizona Republic's annual Roundup of the best in Arizona and went to try it out. The CFS is itself pretty ordinary, but then, how good can CFS be? Is a pretty simple dish made from a cheap cut of meat. The accompanying mashed potatoes were just okay. I must say that the coleslaw is the best I've ever had.   The portions are over the top gigantic. There is no way a normal person can eat this meal: for $14 you get two absolutely enormous pieces of meat covered in breading and smothered in cream gravy. As a result, there was a lot of waste-we paid attention, and didn't see a single person come close to finishing their meal. Of course, a lot of people then take it home, but warmed up chicken fried steak? Really? The waitress agreed that they serve way too much food-she said they often suggest to management just serving one piece of meat, But for some reason they don't, except for lunch. I guess they prefer to make their contribution to America's obesity problem.    We arrived 6PM  Friday night and had a short, 10 minute wait. They only take reservations for 6 or more.

r3G9wPHrScT_1tlduKqoKw.text: Yes! The best preparation for a chicken fried steak I have had in Phoenix so far.  With that said the gravy was lacking in flavor.  Whether this was intentional or not, I had to put a lot of salt and pepper on it to taste the gravy.  The atmosphere is what you would expect from a diner.  Trucker hats and outdated memorabilia galore. The best part of the experience was the owner/chef coming out to converse with everyone in the restaurant to see how the food was.  Props for that!  The staff was also very friendly and attentive.    Plan in gaining a pound or two when eating here.  I give this 4 stars for the great home style cooking you would expect from a noted local restaurant.  Minus one star for possibly having a little too high of expectations of the food.

qKYDGH2g01dtYyliJtAnDQ.text: Great place to get delicious Rib Eye and Prime Rib. The portions are good size and the food was good. Coming from San Diego I wished there was a place like this nearby us. All of the staff there was very friendly and pleasant and gave good service. I would try again when back in town.

NEN-DoKGWRgn-pi30COlsw.text: Go here - the food is really good. I had chicken fried steak + house salad for lunch today and it was as good a meal as I've had in a long time. You may need to hit the gym afterward, but worth it.

YigI991YJZjX7_XFAQ1z6Q.text: I ordered my meal and within three minutes there is my plate of chicken fried steak wow I thought three big giant pieces of chicken fried steak until I go to move it and I realize it's one piece and the coating which was practically not cooked had peeled right off. I have a 7 year old granddaughter who does a lot better job at making chicken fried steak.

t3FeBHViOwc1xFrM11HTeg.text: There's Chicken Fried Steak, and then there's Texaz's Chicken Fried Steak.  The menu is small and consists mostly of meat and anything fried. Keep your cardiologist on speed dial if you come here often. The decor is quirky and fun. You could sit at every table in this restaurant and still not see everything they have to offer hanging on the walls.   The only dilemma I have when I come here is whether to order the Chicken Fried Steak or the Chicken Fried Chicken. Both equally delicious.  Both served with a heaping mound of mashed potatoes and gravy... oh the gravy... it is so delicious I could drink it with a straw.   The portion size here is HUGE. Do not try to eat everything they serve you; your stomach will likely implode.

T1GD5fUJ0a6Z8ZS4licZig.text: Still not feeling well after eating at this restaurant. I ordered the ribeye steak. It arrived swimming in grease, having clearly been pan fried, too long. The flavor of the meat tasted like meat that sat in the fridge too long. My husband, typically a hearty eater, didn't even eat a quarter of his meal. It's really too bad, because the staff here seem nice. It isn't a place we would choose again.

O1jGslOXwRudDoA0HyHtzw.text: Down home on the ranch Texas cuisine right here in Arizona. Service is great and the atmosphere is awesome! Great beer and alcohol selection to accompany your stick to the ribs comfort food. Their gravy is the bomb! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!

K-BgKxsKnf6tQKVfpTOcIA.text: Had the highly recommended Chicken Bon Femme , a fried whole chicken no breading and mashed potatoes and gravy, and my husband had the ginormous chicken fried steak , mashed potatoes and amazing gravy!!! Coleslaw was crisp and delish as well! Service is super friendly and welcoming! We will be back!

RvNirYwzUR-YYwn3j8Tslg.text: Craving a Chicken fried steak for brunch? TexAz is definitely the place to satisfy the craving. The Steak is seasoned to perfection and the breading and frying has been perfected with a wonderful crisp and color- a must try!  Served with mashed potatoes, gravy, corn and a nice fresh and flaky biscuit. However, if you are looking for something on the sweeter side to satisfy the sweet tooth, the texas French toast is another absolute find. Make sure to come hungry and wear loose clothing, the meal is so good you will want to eat it all. Make sure to start with the sticky cinnamon buns, I mean at this point the diet is out the window.  Minus 1 star... I blame them for gaining a lb or 2lbs.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Texas French Toast
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side of yummy potatoes
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Texas French toast

G75AI2QcPyczDPtQns4B7Q.text: Wow, a big upgrade since my last visit earning an extra star. My Daughter had the chicken fried steak which was tender and the gravy had a great flavor, definitely better than the last visit. My son had the Fried Catfish which was nicely breaded and fried to perfection, the home fries were the only disappointment as the were undercooked and lacked any flavor. My sister had the Fried Shrimp with mashed Potatoes which the shrimp were large and tasted fantastic, glad we shared making a turf and surf platter for each of us. I ordered the Freidy Filet which was cooked to a perfect med rare with the only flaw a line of gristle through the center, I cut around it making the rest of the steak very tender but should have been removed before cooking or serving.

HdYFjDb_RG63uULbLCktPg.text: Love this place!! Great family environment, amazing food, and service!! This place is a gem!!   We usually get the grilled pork chops, and always take good home.  5 stars!!

Ylx5lm_FZmYi1HT7IBst1g.text: The smoked prime rib is heavenly! I have never tasted anything like it in my life. A typical tourist trap decor, but the food outweighs the oddities. However, I finally tried the chicken-fried steak that everyone was raving about. It was bland. I had to add salt and pepper to choke it down. I thought it was disgusting.

WTtVrrZwxDDdiRtJXAyuZA.text: Reading the reviews I was expecting some good food.  It wasnt even close to what I got. In fact Im not completely sure what I got. I had ordered their ribeye cooked medium. Let me just say for a ribeye I am expecting a tender juicy steak. The ratio between meat and fat was terrible. I had more fat than I did meat and the meat that I did have was chewy like leather. My friend had the brisket sandwhich which was ridiculously bland. Salt and pepper didnt even help. The salads we both got were questionable and had a weird taste that I couldnt put my finger on.  The service was friendly and personable. But when something wasnt correct they did little to nothing to fix it. The server acknowledged  that the salads were not the best but didnt offer to exchange it for anything else. She had also acknowledged that the meat was tough and chewy when she saw me struggling, but still didnt offer to exchange it out. It was very disappointing, especially when you're a steak lover like me. I dont think ill be back sadly.

pKuZlbHMOhMdVBy9GYmWlQ.text: This was a cute Texas looking steakhouse, we were greeted with smiles and hellos! Our waitress was wonderful and humorous. I ordered a CFS(Chicken Fried Steak), which came with mashed potatoes, corn and a biscuit = $10. The CFS was the size of a big plate, definitely worth the $10. The gravy was excellent, and had a butteriness to it. The CFS itself was flavorful and crunchy. The steak was not tough at all, like some CFS can be, just like how I remembered from Texas. Definitely check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7dW4-xBHx3z-Qv2NFVFn9w.text: Great food HUGE portions.  The chicken fried steak is the same size as the plate. Gravy was awesome. I usually hate white gravy because a lot of places make it with a smokey flavor, this does not. It was so good. Pretty sure we had leftovers after half way through. Always try and come when we are visiting family in Phoenix. If I remember correctly parking is limited.

2nDvCYkcX5gEuReCJjxpCw.text: We've been coming here for 20yrs at least and they never disappoint!!! Seen them through the name change etc. This place reminds me of home... Tucumcari, NM to be exact! Thank yall for the outstanding service and delicious food!

K9jBLL7cTVw-LUkrIfH6qQ.text: We are transplanted Texans. We were really missing our favorite foods, until now.  Nancy was our waitress. She was excellent! Very helpful explaining the menu, and gave us samples of their delicious chopped beef and chili.  We decided on chicken fried steak for my hubby, and fried catfish with okra for me. The Cfs was platter sized! Lightly breaded with mashed potatoes and corn. Very tasty. My catfish and okra was excellent. We took home a ton of food. Husband wanted to try dessert. We got a warm piece of pecan pie with a large scoop of blue bell. Everything is made in house. We will be back.

jYS3lHitKR-1wZhkBgQLlw.text: I must start with a disclaimer. I gave them three stars because the type of food they serve does not fit my lifestyle or diet. And that is not necessarily a fair way to judge.  It is a very unique restaurant. Very old-school Phoenix. Much like the old pinnacle Peak patio. There is lots of nostalgia pieces hanging from the walls. Most of the staff has worked there for about 10 years or more. They really do offer fantastic service. It is a great place to bring guests from out of town so they can experience Old Phoenix.  Going back to the food. Lots of what they make is deep fried. Which if you love that kind of food this is your place. I understand the chicken fried steak is bigger than the plate. The pork chops I had I asked for them to be grilled and they were fine but bland. They did want me to put their gravy on it, Which I don't prefer, but I did ask for it on the side so I could taste it. To me it was not remarkable. Their salads are very much plain. They used mainly iceberg restaurant bag type mix. I had the balsamic dressing which they make and it was tasty but it was much too much of it for my taste.   So I do hope you understand, just because this place isn't for me doesn't mean it isn't a lot of fun and a great place to go. Give it a try and draw your own conclusion.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bRW2Iw6X9ZlbU7DbwmMKGw.text: Don't know why I only rated this place 4 stars. Definitely 5 star worthy food and service.

wtw4AymA5JqYoQ_TuvBYSw.text: It's just a whole chicken breast double dipped in batter and flash fried with mashed potatoes and a shit load of buttery country gravy accompanied by a butter biscuit. 9.50$  I'm in heaven. Stomach is full. Glad we came for lunch. Dinner must be huge.  Fritos pie was real good but not worth 5.50$ Friend had pit shaved sandwich with prime rib with shaved onion and horsey sauce. 9.50. He emptied his plate.   Happy hour is half off beer, wine, well drinks. (Nothing spectacular.   But good is the food. Food is real good

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fritos pie
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Specials
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar

HBxA-lb04VPw4ltWAGP5BQ.text: A great local spot since the 85 on the corner Bethany home & 16th TEXAZ is local home cooked comfort food Texas style ! Great Texas Decor reminds me if you were in an old Austin bar. You'd expect to see Willie Nelson here but if there you'd probably hear him. To begin we had biscuits & honey . Next came large cole slaw and nice dinner salad both very good . We shared the mulligan 16 oz smoked prime rib with large portion of mashed potatoes with the skins & homemade gravy. Also shared a huge chicken fried steak smothered in gravy. Lastly had a brisket sandwich with long strips of the bbq pecan smoked brisket on French roll w real Texas potato home fries. Great service from Josephine , food came amazing fast . I m sure will be back I'd like to try the cod fish & chips. Available on an early bird menu 4-6 with other options . They have a good looking Fourth of July menu too. Great food & Tex az western decor ! We'll be back partner !

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a real authentic local place the kind the roadhouse type steak  chains try to duplicate

glUFRO5M3pawah1_b6zuKQ.text: I was craving for country fried steak and drove to this restaurant to fulfill it. As you enter the restaurant you will notice the hats, license plates, nostalgic Texas decoration. It feels like you've been transformed into a Texas country bar. We were immediately greeted by the hostess and sat down inside of a booth. The menu is right side up on the table. Inside the menu are comfort foods to order such as, chicken fried steak, fried okra, steak and burgers. Of course, I ordered the chicken fried steak with the gravy on the side; it was so delicious. Five stars!! It was good enough to feed two people. Additionally, the bread pudding is served warm with whiskey sauce. It was a perfect ending to dinner when you're all fried up!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread pudding with whiskey sauce. Heaven!
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak. The serving size is good for two people.
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried okra

06h9VXK9VLMXvo2TpV83EQ.text: The very best in quality and friendly. The atmosphere is great with lots to read and look at. The country fried steak is amazing with that award winning gravy. They have so many options and none are bad choices. This is a family tradition to come here and feast at least 3 times a year.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The most amazing country fried steak I&#39;ve ever had. Me and my family love coming here.

ly_8QMd5GHZpiBWUekmUyw.text: Usually a gimmick and not that good but this place is an anomaly.   I ordered the chicken fried steak sandwich hopping that it was smaller than the chicken fried steak that I saw someone getting as I walked in. I was wrong about that, it had three complete pieces of chicken fried steak on it. It tasted great, I also had mashed potatoes over the fries which I liked the mashed potatoes a lot.   On the down side.   Parking! The parking lot sucked, it was extremely small, and my car was hit in the parking lot and no one left a note.  Service, it blew. I was sat in the very back near the restrooms, and the waitress would never get to me. The waitress always took care of the three or four people that were near the front. If the food wasn't as good as it was and the memorabilia wasn't nearly as good they would get a one star from me. I was going to say something to the manager on the way back but didn't have the opportunity.   Cheers!

7E_89oSjdO8p2fSjH7f5oA.text: Had the chicken fried chicken with mashed potatoes. Chicken was very good, the mash was good too. Also had their chili, which to me, not good at all. I tried, couldn't finish it. Friendly staff would return to try some other stuff.

Zw1mpF2_a3ge-h32lPec4w.text: One of my favorite places to go for lunch.....never had a bad meal and they are known for their chicken fried steak and chicken fried chicken, truthfully the chicken fried chicken is the best that I've ever had!!  Service is always quick......the portion at lunch is a good size.....dinner is twice as large!

YYJoatLJxSe3Ull_Hp27ig.text: The food was GREAT. The bad review is because our server, Jessie (guy), couldn't SLOW DOWN. He walked off before my husband was finished ordering his meal, rushed us to order dessert, and then didn't even pay Austin to myself OR my husband when he was trying to order HIS desert. Just took my order and ignited him completely.

V2KlCerrVIPODZMpOZMwcA.text: Wasn't crazy about this place. We started with fried okra & beer battered shrimp and for our main course we had the chicken fried steak, chicken fried chicken and brisket sandwich. From the kids menu, we ordered  smoked prime rib. And for dessert we ordered the peach cobbler.  For starters, the biscuits and rolls we got didn't taste fresh, in fact, they tasted like they'd been warmed up in a microwave. Already a terrible start. But it did get better with our apps. The fried okra was very good, the okra was ripe, not at all bitter. The beer battered shrimp was also very good, light batter, fresh shrimp, our meal was looking better.  Then dinner came, the chicken fried chicken was delicious, the chicken was juicy and battered very nicely. My chicken fried steak however, was very bland and there was so much more batter than meat. The gravy was very good and sort of made up for the steak. The brisket sandwich was very dry so we ordered a side of BBQ sauce, without it, it wasn't very appetizing, with it, it was pretty darn good, nothing fancy, just a lot of brisket and bread. The smoked prime rib from the kids menu was OK. It had a lot of fatty parts, I may be biased as I'm not a prime rib fan though. We could definitely taste the smoky flavor. We ordered a side salad with both steak dinners and they both tasted like bagged salad. Nothing great about the dressings either. The mashed potatoes that came with the steaks were pretty good, they had skin pieces which I personally love. No gravy, but I prefer mashed potatoes without so I was happy there.  My favorite dish of the evening was the peach cobbler. The peaches weren't fresh, they were frozen so I was slightly disappointed but the crust part made up for it. The crust, made from their biscuit batter, was slightly sweet and tasted just right with the peaches and vanilla ice cream, (adding ice cream is $1 extra).  Overall, I didn't hate this place but I certainly didn't love it. The portions are massive so go hungry or prepare to take lots of leftovers home.

vqx40vmh2vp8X-8-X_2BJQ.text: This place is known for their chicken fried steak.  And they certainly do it right.  They have a billboard that is a running tally of how many servings of chicken fried steak they have served....now that's confidence in your product!  But if you feel like something else, they have an amazing prime rib (you have to get there early though....they only make a certain amount of prime rib each night and when they run out, they run out).  If you want something a little smaller---and that's not saying much, since their portions are huge, get the brisket sandwich, ask for the bbq sauce on the side, and ask for a side of au ju.  You won't regret it.  It's amazing!!    Don't expect some fancy schmancy steakhouse--but go hungry and you won't regret your decision to go there!

wEG3K8fqMIGTTJIrtt5zsQ.text: Chicken fried steak = winner, catfish = winner, anything else I have tried = winner.  Great spot, good portions, and friendly + quick staff.    Enough said, except a Thank You TEXAZ!

MVGn_bVPkbDYODM6rpc9lQ.text: I love this place.  It's the best chicken fried steak EVER. Ask for Joey, she's the best server there!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. By the entrance. It&#39;s a small place

9j-soKJ-xLxh1Bmd5sOqQA.text: Exceptional service and a fun environment.  Waitress helped make the experience very fun.  Would recommend!

p1Edzv5PEFgkaxy3g5iDkA.text: The only reason I am giving this place a 3 star review is because the service was excellent. The waitress was very friendly and gave us the perfect mix of attention and privacy. We were seated quickly, and had drinks a few minutes later. The food arrived equally fast.  The restaurant itself is your typical roadhouse. Its dark and a bit crowded feeling inside, with lots of stuff on the walls, and feels dirty, even though I'm sure it's clean. Prices were reasonable, especially considering the huge portions of food. I ordered their "famous" Chicken fried steak. I'm not entirely sure what I was expecting, but what I got was not what I was hoping for. the breading on the chicken wasn't very crispy and had very little flavor. The gravy had even less flavor than the batter and only succeeded in making everything soggy. The steak itself was cooked well but fatty, flavorless, and hard to cut. the salads and side dishes were equally mediocre.   Nothing special about TexAZ Grill.

aJZTI7DiLlTSB_WQKNW8qA.text: Place has Texas ambiance in spades.  You leave the cavernous restaurant and you almost expect to step onto a dusty street in the panhandle.  The chicken fried steak is great and when you consider the $8 price tag it becomes downright splendid.

LQ8b0tGmcgbuEM5lXr7lPA.text: Hubby and I went here for lunch today and enjoyed it very much. We ordered a salad and fried okra to go along with the meal   I had the Southern Pork Chop, mashed potatoes, corn, biscuits and gravy( I make better biscuits) and hubby had the Chicken Fry, which he brought half of home with us. The pork chop was tender and juicy and almost fork tender, I ate all of it, left most of  the mashed potatoes and the corn, probably because we ate the salad and the okra first. I like the inside although it is a little dark, very kitchy with all the license plates from all over. I say go, eat, waddle home...it is worth it and it is great comfort food!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southern Pork Chop, Mashed potatoes, corn, biscuits and gravy

DUyJWJn32OwzJOl-6JFicA.text: Very friendly staff, Steve has a great sense of humor. Get the chicken fried steak and you'll be in food-coma lol ... Try smaller portion try eggs bubba still super filling. Prices are just right too. LOVE IT!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Having lunch with my son on a Sunday afternoon. Great place to eat. Thanks Steve for taking our photo. We&#39;ll be back.
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The history on the walls &amp; ceiling say it all!!! Love this place.

ek5BSHPthe3mfX2aHBM4yw.text: The chicken fried steak was really good! They give you free hot biscuits for the table too. Only took a star off because the service was a bit slow, but the food made up for it!

Vqs57mdblgpPzF2U9V-vtw.text: The portions are huge.  The food is delicious. Worth every penny eating here. The sauce on the chicken fried steak is the best i've ever had! The fried okra was sooo yummy!! The staff was super friendly. The decor is very cute and rustic.  We loved every part of this place.  You will definitely not leave here hungry!!!

Xedxoygt4f1xk0cy3B-qug.text: Texas sized portions cooked to perfection, my only regret is I didn't have room for desert. Best chicken fried steak in Phoenix.

k7u1Rx0kCVv1jpIB-2VJ2g.text: You won't find better liver & onions anywhere. Cooked perfect, lots of it. Waitresses are the best. The cook however doesn't know when food is done. I've had 6 meals here and anything fried is going to look picture perfect and be uncooked. I know my catfish and this is almost warm on the inside when the coating is perfect. They pride themselves on the chicken fried steak but can't seem to let the batter finish frying. I've tried it over and over and it's always been underdone. My guess is that since I eat there between 2 and 6pm each time, they have the least experienced kitchen person at the fryer. i like to go to local places and will go back here, but i expect i'm going to bang my head on the wall for doing it.

-kv6P9i9JH3lAz4quE83rA.text: Sign says something like 80,000 chicken fried steaks served here, and that's what you need to order. It's that good and it's only $7.50 at lunch.  Get an ice cold Shiner or Lone Star to go with it and sit at the bar if you can, for the view of the kitsch all over the walls, ceiling, and behind the counter.  Service with a smile and you'll be full when you leave.  Parking is kind of a bitch though.

kqeL2D8R8MnDorpcg6bGbw.text: Fun, friendly, prompt service and tasty food? What's not to like? Portions here are definitely Texas-size so you are not going to go away hungry. They were very accommodating to our large party and our server was excellent.   Parking here is HORRIBLE though. The restaurant is on the corner of 16th St. and Bethany Home in a rundown strip mall. The spots themselves are short and it's difficult to get into and out of the lot. Not sure if there is a special trick to parking here but please keep in mind when you come that parking is sucky.   Now, bear in mind when you come here, there are not many "healthy options" on the menu. And they are not ashamed of this at all. They embrace the Texas size deep fried, heavily battered foods they offer unabashedly. As someone who is careful about what I eat, I did manage to get a salad and felt good about it. All the dishes came out at the proper temperatures and were freshly made and nicely plated.   Looking forward to going back in the near future!

u_DTFLMNk8BGWn_5iSZU0g.text: Best mashed potatoes & gravy I've ever had (sorry, Grandma)! Dive bar atmosphere, great food, great people. The burgers are thick and cooked to perfection. Smaller menu, but it doesn't matter when you taste how well it is executed and you throw in the charm of the atmosphere.

9X3ax-I7a1fgPMJm-MjLwQ.text: I grew up in Texas and love coming here for the brisket and the chicken fried steak. The catfish is also worth getting. Very friendly service. The table is loaded with all sorts of hot sauces and condiments to add some kick to your meal. Parking is poor if not awful and the lighting inside is rather dim. Ask for a seat to the left when you walk in by the lamp and beer signs. Oh Yeah!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Steak - Lunch Portion.
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Texaz Fun!
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Table Condiments.

DNJBSaP57Q2vFCq7HhPRBA.text: This has been on my AZ bucket list for years and decided to drop by tonight for dinner with the family. From chatting it up with some of the regulars, to the "Texas Trivia" with the owner at our table. The food and the vibe here were absolutely wonderful. Will definitely be back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peach cobbler w/Blue Bell ice cream...yummy!

47ACZA4XgFRdKY_jdMQQIA.text: I strongly prefer the chicken fried chicken! It's juicy and flavorful, and is a larger portion (not that you can finish either!!). Love this place!

5407sUjcoWFM6uJnh6Yxug.text: This restaurant is very good if you are looking for a hearty meal with large portions. The chicken fried steak is the bomb - the best in Arizona. The staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is unique. I just wish it was closer to my home in Gilbert. Highly Recommended.

KRe4QhHrGmhso08kDQ_kIA.text: I've wanted to visit Texaz Grill for months, and after showing my husband the Check Please, Arizona episode, he was gung ho to go, too.   The parking is a big pain. We were lucky enough to get a spot in the back after a minute's wait (otherwise it would have been very hard to get out of there). But once we were inside, the food was exactly as promised. We started with a side of fried okra. Yum. Awesome breading, everything fresh and hot.  My husband ordered the lunch version of chicken-fried steak. He was in heaven. I tried a small bite. I'm not usually a fan of chicken fried steak, but it was fabulous.  My options were a little limited because I can't do really heavy fried stuff. I had the Dallas Tacos. They were good. Nothing spectacular but still satisfying. Let's face it--no one is coming here for tacos! Check out the Yelp photo gallery to see my plate.  I usually don't do dessert out, but bread pudding is my Kryptonite. Too many people on Yelp praised this dessert dish, and with reason. My word. The bread pudding was sweet, firm, and delicious. We ordered it with the scoop of ice cream, which ended up being HUGE. Texas-sized. The whiskey sauce on top is luscious.  In the rare event that we're back in this part of Phoenix, we will definitely stop here. For the sake of our waistlines, it's probably a good thing it isn't closer...

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dallas tacos

W9UTVPLLiaQCyFQeKf1CEw.text: The lunch portion was excellent. The food is delicious.  The decor is old Route 66ish. The staff are friendly and obviously like their jobs. Nice old home cooked food. Comfort food that competes with your Grandma's.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch time at Texaz Grill.

B2_UgWkSh0ba3_O7gnGyFQ.text: Always wonderful food, service and vibe. A long standing establishment because it deserves to still be here. Come on over, eat plenty and join the clean plate club for deep savings. Enjoy, we did.
