_YrvTaJ98h9huky6moG_Gw.text: Just had the best fried chicken breast and gravy ever.  Little whole in the wall but great food and great service.

UmWBcGR5edu8fwZtgOUI1A.text: I have been coming here for years, my kids grew up coming here, my Grandkids come here. The Reason? GREAT food, great service. The staff are very accommodating and will absolutely bend over backwards to make you happy! Feels like home.

FeL63caw7KqFtHwrKxPGaw.text: Best chicken fried steak in town. The Tuesday special ham steak is fantastic too. Parking is not good but the food is worth it.

F99_RrhXjW36Ojd-UPJxXw.text: This time Yelp failed us. This place is overrated and overpriced. I don't know what to say, I'm shocked at the quality of food that was served to us. I had the brisket sandwich and was disappointment by how bland it was. The salad was not much better, it had to many olives. I had to send it back. For the price, I expected a whole lot more. What can I say. I won't be back there again.

hUWARibWP-zyJfmG_5wRbg.text: From a couple of ladies born and raised in Texas, this place is as close to Texas perfection as ever!  Juicy steaks, melt in your mouth chicken fried steaks and amazing onion rings! The ambience is sooooooo Austin-ish!  Courteous and attentive staff equals 5 stars and definitely a DO-Again!   We'll be back!

JRZRkhuK0EMjF6s35H0rVA.text: Can only comment on the Chicken Fried Chicken - yum! A portion that 2 can share (unless you're overly hungry). Price is quite fair too. Served breaded and fried, southern style with corn/mashed potatoes. I'ts a smaller place so the closer you come to opening the better. There was a wait of 8 people at the door on a Saturday morning (10 minutes to open).  Super casual restaurant, decked out with nostalgic and Texas memorabilia.

gf8by8xr6cx7l0DNjqtK5w.text: You just can't beat this down home comfort food! Chicken Fried Steak, Chicken Fried Chicken and that cream gravy like Grandma used to make for after church Sunday dinner!

qX2lNFn6uCiAfM7c2S1GYQ.text: I would literally rather eat garbage out of a dumpster than come within fifty yards of this truck stop.. I mean.. "restaurant" again. It would probably be easier to force down. Also, our server looked like she couldn't stand another second living her life there. The 10 cent jalapenos are not worth 1 cent, and they're served in a coffee mug? The French fries are undercooked, chopped potatoes (but don't ask about them or you'll get a slap on the shoulder by the waitress like my brother in law). The olives in the "salad" that they offer, I promise you, looked exactly like someone chewed them up and spit them on some old iceberg lettuce. The best part about this place is that they have beer to wash down the tasteless food. I wish I could get my father in law his $250 back and leave no stars. Pathetic.

o6myz7Ikb8dSqUTOV-qq7g.text: The anti-immigrant bumper sticker about abducting "illegal[s] was enough to ruin a meal.  Sending the steak back that came out raw didn't help.

qCh9Abt4K-_p914Rx6q7Lw.text: Positive: The portion size are huge, especially the chicken fried steak. Service was quick however food was warm. Negative: The establishment has hats and business cards hanging all over the place from the ceiling, thousands of them...all I can think of is 'dust and dirt.' Also, I heard one waitress say "stupid table!" and another one say "dickhead!" behind me at my table. Unsure who they were referring too.  Overall: Food is good, service needs to be more friendlier and establishment needs to look cleaner.

8Sc0TkQx4C7oeq_AbI4q8Q.text: Being Texas-transplants, we'd been wanting to try TEXAZ Grill for some time, (but it's pretty far from the 'Copa). Upon entering, we thought we'd found another treasure like the renowned Babe's Fried Chicken as the decor is really cool, and there is a friendly, upbeat vibe.   Our waitress was super!   Two glasses of Chardonnay were very good, and a bargain for $5 each.   As others have mentioned, the portions are HUGE, and the mashed potatoes, biscuit and corn were excellent!   Unfortunately, the stars of the show, Chicken Fried Steak and Chicken Fried Chicken were just fair. The CFS was the biggest disappointment as it lacked proper seasoning, and was pounded way too thin which causes over-breading. The CHC was better and was perfectly cooked, but a bit over-breaded and needed more seasoning as well (Churches or Popeyes is better).   As any Texan well knows, you can hide a lot of mediocre food under outstanding gravy (sorry Mom) but we found the gravy slightly sweet for our palettes.   We will certainly be back to try the brisket as it smelled great!

U1sh_BMh8bKprKhnRHYqTQ.text: Yummy comfort food!! They have SMOKED PRIME RIB!!! Never had that before and it was amazing!!! Worth the drive for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rA09_Rz430rDaTl1lN4JVw.text: First time here! Recently over in the area and always see this place super pack. Decided to give it a try. Their service is excellent our waitress was really friendly and sweet! I was surprised to see that the owner was there too socializing. He is very down to earth and shows how much he cares about his business! By the way I'm part of the CLEAN PLATE CLUB SCOORREEE! Lol highly recommend this place for some good ol southern food!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy!!

d8EH90gHpPhfrl-9cjJExw.text: I would not recommend going here! My 85 year old mother and I went for dinner tonight and received the worse service and greeting as we walked in the front door. My mother travels with her emotional support dog with all the proper paper work and tonight as she entered the restaurant she was greeted at the front door with not a welcome but a quick comment about if her support dog going to stay it would have to be on the floor under the table!  It was not a nice way to be greeted as we entered the restaurant.   My mother's support animal is less than 5 lbs and sits on the seat next to her with a blanket and is quiet and well behaved as she has been trained. We have been to this restaurant many times and the never had any issues before tonight. The same person who made those  comments tonight had never said anything before on our prior visits and in fact even commented about her dog seated on the seat next to her just how cute her dog was. It was not what he said but how he said it tonight. I have always enjoy this restaurant in the past but after tonight I will not be back again.  I am disappointed in the way entire the situation was handled. We are respectful of others and understand that some might not want to have a dog in the restaurant and if we were asked nicely and respectfully it would be different.  We will not be back there again there  are to many other restaurants that will welcome us to spend our money and time. Disappointed to say the least!!

K9fpCPF0wMpZZYui2mLL1A.text: I really want to give this restaurant a good review for the steaks. I can't. I tried twice. The fist time a went here I had the prime rib. The flavor was perfect but way too much fat. The Texas fries were over cooked. I went beck last night and I ordered the porterhouse along with the Texas fries again. I'm was disappointed. This was not a good steak. I like the severs and the restaurant. I really wanted to enjoy a good steak here but twice it didn't happen.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

y5WaaKd3k8v8peWkQMKHeA.text: Good food and large portions. Ordered the prime rib it was so soft and juicy. Hubby ordered rib eye his was soft and yummy. Has a real Texas road house feel to the restaurant. Excellent food.

TpH9595Lv5ZjKn1BbVDwlw.text: You know that sweet idiom about so-and-so's behind being as large as Texas? Well! They must have had the chicken fried steak. AKA atherosclerosis for your dining pleasure.   Pretty sure those kitschy armadillos plastering the walls are a fire hazard.  I like it!

UWXCuzobyinVfNmCw2jxPw.text: Yeah, I just DONT get it. The service was fine and the prices are very reasonable, but this is in no way a "good" meal. It's inexpensive and the portions are mammoth, but that doesn't make a "good" chicken fried steak. If you are a quantity over quality person than yes... This is probably your place...

DpJupMXFAt3X3JjGhlU_yQ.text: This place has great comfort food, nothing fancy but I don't expect nor want it from a place like this. We have been here twice and both times were excellent. The first time around I ordered the chicken fried steak and it was flavorful not to mention massive. This last time I decided to change things up and get the catfish, and I have to say this was easily the best catfish I've gotten from a restaurant, it is perfectly seasoned and melts in your mouth. Catfish isn't my favorite fish and far too many places can't make it properly, the sweetness of the catfish almost overpowers things. Not here, the flavor of the breading and the work in harmony. I will definitely get catfish again here! Oh yeah, their Texas Potatoes (or whatever they are called) are good as well, basically they are potato chunks that are fried, in fact I am willing to bet they double fry them to give the outerlayer a crispy texture.   The restaurant itself resembles your typical small town restaurant, and that is fine with me since I grew up with restaurants like it. Their walls are covered with pictures, posters, signs and whatever else they can put up on it, it gives it an unique look. If you want a "nice" restaurant then you better look elsewhere, but if you want a hometown family restaurant and bar setting this is your place.  Service is fantastic as well, our server was constantly refilling our drinks and extremely friendly. One nice aspect of this place is that they give you large glasses for your beverage, so you usually only need a refill or two, we had a bit more because we were recovering from the summer heat.  Also for the record they carry Pepsi products, which is a bonus for me, but may not be for others.  In regards to price, they aren't cheap (the chicken fried steak is around 13 and the catfish for two big filets was around 12), but you will have more then enough food so it works out in the long run.   Overall a great small town style restaurant and bar if you are looking for a hearty meal that is made right.

RUDDgSa468_6AG9s0cEHCA.text: No False advertising here.  Just the best damn chicken fried steak I've had in Phoenix (and BBQ beef ribs, see update).  We also got the bbq pork sandwich which was so mouth wateringly good that I wished Texaz would just go ahead and deliver a full line of bbq items...and stop teasing me with just this one tempting tasty bit  Really generous portions. The sides was just typical..but with the mains this good, I couldn't really care.   My plate was overflowing and my jeans needed loosening after the super yummy and yet easy on the wallet lunch.  Update:  We've been on the hunt for BBQ beef ribs which doesn't seem as popular as pork ribs.  It may not be as tender as pork but the flavor is what we're after.  When we heard that our favorite Texan restaurant serves it only on Tuesday nights, we had to make the trip.  We arrived after 9pm but luckily they still had one order left.   $11 for five giant beef back ribs - slow-smoked over hickory and oak, topped with a homemade BBQ sauce and served with their rustic mashed potatoes.   The dry spice-rub had so infused into the meat during the long slow cooking process that we didn't need the sauce.  Eating beef ribs is a carnivorous act - almost caveman like - if it wasn't for the fact that the server thoughtfully brought us a warm wet napkin to wipe our saucy fingers on.  Despite the tastiness of the ribs, there was just so much of it that even with the two of us sharing, we could not finish it.  It made for a tasty lunch the day after.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Steak
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jambalaya (lunch special)

5ga1O5Yu7sRnL3-Ibjqvig.text: The food is delicious and the service is amazing. Helena is one of the best servers I have ever had the privilege of serving us. We will definitely be back!

IXiqVMsKLUwoW8SY0k-nVg.text: So you're with a bunch of people who like chicken fried steak, and they say, hey theres this steak house you should try with us. This should be your first warning. If a steak house is known for its chicken fried steak, something is not right.  Maybe you're different, maybe you think, sure, they like chicken fried steak, and I like fried asshole. Then this is your place!  Now, you go in, and ahh the ambiance, shit on the walls as far as the eye can see, oh and not just the walls, the ceiling as well! Its jam packed, you can't hear the person in front of you, you're thinking, when's the last time they dusted all this crap? How much falls in my food from the lazy ceiling fans.   Its hot and a bit humid to, maybe to recreate that True texas experience?  So you order your tbone, medium rare, side of mashed potatoes and hell, some okra while you're at it. Good okra is hard to find in these parts.  The okra, crispy, soft inside (once its done being molten lava), perfect. Don't bother with the sauce unless your garnish for okra is tartar sauce.  Hey, a side salad come with it! Oh, the tiny diced tomatoes, ice burg lettuce, and what an interesting mix, diced green olives all over the top, in giant piles.  Now your entree comes, but the waitress, if you're lucky, has worked there 4 years! Shes got a blond dye job, too much eye makeup, and a perm. She makes sure to leave every single dish on the table, just in case you missed one delicious crumb. At some point she might drop by one basket of rolls, for a table of 8. The buttermilk ones taste homemade, not bad!  Oh yes, the entree, a tbone, super thin, in what is that? Its pooling everywhere, oh god the grease. You did order your steak with a large slathering of grease right? Well those mashed potatoes, which are thick and standard, are drenched in heavy white gravy, and all the blandness of the gravy helps soak up all that grease!  So you're almost done with your food, omg, your giant glass is empty? Where was that waitress? Oh don't worry, just grab her by the arm and she'll try to remember to refill your drink. And those extra plates, well if they're really bothering you you can ask a bus person to take them, though you might as well be asking them to lick your shoe (or eat what you just did).   Now you're full, you've paid, and because of its "prime" location, you get to cross a busy intersection to get to the car you had to park across the street.   Might as well just wait to get home to pee too, its sweltering in there, more crap on the walls and ceiling, and you pretty much have to stand on the toilet to get the stall door closed.

RnZwj9heEJCGhA0nDGEMtg.text: Let me start this review by saying that I am a huge fan of TEXAZ Grill.  I have been enjoying their CFS since they were Lone Star (over 20 years).    My wife and I stopped in this past Saturday (03/22/2014) for an early lunch.  We were immediately "greeted and seated".  Our server came by for our drink order and I also ordered a cup of the "Sopa de Fidello" (my main reason for this visit).  The soup came and was very, very good.   I normally get a cup of their wonderful chili, but I really wanted to try this soup after reading the description on line.  I wasn't disappointed in the least.  Chunks of ham, vegetables, and the video noodles; all in a spicy, savory broth.  I would love a big bowl of this soup and some wonderful chewy, crusty bread on a cold winters night (yes, I know I'm in Phoenix, but I can dream...).  Both my wife and I had a salad w/ the house dressing and the lunch sized Chicken Fried Steak.  I love the house dressing at TEXAZ.  My wife (a former ranch dressing girl) now orders the house dressing, it's so good. The salad is evenly coated w/ dressing, and there is never a glob of it on the plate when you're done.  What can I say about the CFS, that hasn't been said many times before...it was perfect as usual.  The CFS came w/ mashed potatoes, corn, and a biscuit.  The steaks were hanging over the sides of the plate.  Fresh, hot and perfectly seasoned.  I have tried this dish at other restaurants, only to be disappointed w/ the food.   I didn't get the name of our server, but she was great.  She came and checked on us regularly and was pleasant and quick w/ the tea refills.  Yet another great meal at one of my favorite restaurants...  I think there are many restaurants here in the valley that could learn something from TEXAZ and their longevity here in a place known for "here today and gone tomorrow". Quality and consistency.  Start w/ quality ingredients and quality people; and keep it consistent.

r24QNYGN2qDDEtGgCexOog.text: TexAz is a one of a kind Phoenix gem.   Great food and great service...we had chicken fried steak and chicken fried chicken, and both were deliciously smothered in white gravy. Perfect mashies, a large salad and mound of cole slaw plus biscuits rounded out a great Sunday dinner. Oh, and in honor of Valentine's day, we got a free piece of yummy chocolate sheet cake to split. And if you are not in a chicken fried mood, try the equally magnificent fish fry!!!

QA5PmZfCNUlor8ZCyvl-Rg.text: We had the rib eye and the chicken fried steak. Both entrees were delicious, great flavor, cooked to perfection. You will not be disappointed!

GC_Xau8olmqHp1xtQrnoig.text: Yep -- still my favorite hole-in-the-wall eatery awesomeness. The brisket sandwich with cheddar and slaw and dippin' sauce was to die for. I ate at the bar and just enjoyed my visit.  Can't wait til I can walk here!

LFKxO13y6GaTDSaUMK_Y4A.text: Omg if you want chicken fried steak then look no further! This is the standard for what chicken fried steak is to be! Don't expect foo foo gluten free menu items this is a True OG Texas style roadhouse food! I've been eating here since I was a kid and remember when it was LoneStar before the lame chain made them change the name but it didn't change the food! I recommend the chicken fried steak and if they aren't sold out on prime rib its a winner! Also on Tuesdays I hear the beef ribs are to die for but in all the years I've been eating there they are always sold out! I'll keep yall posted on that!

AmgHpREX_rOvgJidORSzRQ.text: Great chicken fried steak in phoenix but if it was in Texas it would be just good

kJ47ZQTQgEHtb3fTKrXN0Q.text: My first time there. Very disappointed. Chicken fried steak served on an oval plate way too small which prevented any sizable portion of mashed potatoes and corn. Ordered the chili on top of the chicken fried steak. First the biscuit was just a little bigger than a silver dollar. The breading on the chicken fried steak would not stay on the one quarter inch or less thickness of the crushed steak. The steak was way oversized and came dripping with grease from the kitchen dripping on my clothes. I got it with chili on top probably got 3 heaping tablespoons of chili at a price of 2.50. The chicken fried. steak was barely palatable- - - after the breading sluffed off of the steak. Never was asked if i Wanted a refill on my tea. My friends was the same way. Host came by to check did not have the nerve to tell him how repulsive it was- - that was my fault.

K2on_541XPpPjtvrKBG_1Q.text: Wow. One of the worst meals I've had in awhile.  My husband and I came here for some Chicken Fried Steak because he went about 3 years ago and said it was awesome. We showed up and knew that we wanted to order the Chicken Fried Steak right away. They took our order, we waited shortly and our salad came out. Wasn't the best salad. Wasn't really fresh..had a lot of ranch on it, but I can see how somebody might like it. Ate some of it and pushed it to the side.  Soon our steak arrived. I was so excited to try it! I took my first bite and was shocked to find that it was completely bland. I added some salt and ate some more. The meat wasn't the best, which I understand because it's chicken fried steak, however it tasted frozen to me. After the 4th bite, I had to ask my husband if it tasted the same as before. He shook his head no and commented on how disguising it was. Even the mashed potatoes were bland. I agreed and started to feel gross thinking about eating any more of it.    We both pushed out dishes to the side, with lots of food still left on our plate. When our waitress came by about 10 minutes after she dropped the food off, we told her we were done. She asked if we wanted a box, which we declined, but otherwise no questions or concerns - she didn't even seem to notice that we ate almost nothing off of our plates. Didn't feel like bringing it up at the time, so we just paid our $35 for and left. I hate KFC and I would much sooner eat that than eat here again..

r-42Ar7M36nPRpIdBSjX5Q.text: Okay, how can you not like Texaz Grill? Bad mood? Not hungry? Vegan? Bringing a baby carrier? Then you should probably stay home. Yes, it's a dive in an aging strip mall at 16th and Bethany. Yes, there is lots of junk hanging from the ceiling and walls that a few won't appreciate as low-brow Texas ambiance. And yes, the portions tend to be on the "enormous" side so if you're watching your waistline, plan on splitting a meal.   But rest assured the place is a Phoenix icon and will be 'til way after you're gone. It is texas-style comfort food - nice and simple. The steaks are great - they cut and age their own like a real steakhouse. The prime rib, when you arrive early enough, is superb - and shockingly cheap considering the cut. And I doubt you'd find a better, more authentic texas-style chicken fried steak (and chicken fried chicken) anywhere in town. So big you'll want to share - or take 1/2 home. But is is goooood.  If you're a newbie to Texas Grill - it's good to know that probably 90% of the clientele are regulars and are likely close personal friends to the staff of many years. This tip is helpful so that you don't get lynched by the surrounding tables for dissing the busy waitress because your water glass gets low. Come to Texaz in a good mood and ready to eat and you'll be fine. In time the staff may take a cotton to you too - but you'll have to earn it.  There's not a mistake on the menu. One great value is to order the chop steak as a burger (it's not on the menu) and you'll have one of the best burgers in town. If you're a party of one or there's a few open seats - belly up to the bar. Tammy and Cindy are the usual evening bartenders and they serve one of the best margaritas in town - on the rocks (only) and with salt of course. The selection at the bar is simple and basic, but you'll be entertained all night trying to read decades of bumper stickers and fridge magnets. You may even meet a few new friends as the regulars are a friendly bunch (especially after a marg or two).  When visitors come to town, you can bet Texaz is always in the mix. Sure we hit Scottsdale for glam, downtown for urban cool, and Barrio or Richardsons for nuevo mexican - but for a fun evening with friends plus good comfort food, you can't beat Texaz.  Watch for us at the bar!

7hrG7ccwkkUvIqG9LIkFUw.text: Came here with a friend for a dinner meal. The service was fantastic and the portion sizes were large. Got the prime rib. Have had much better but it was not a bad meal at all. Delicious appetizers. Worth the price.

IbzzgGynORY2v15LvuO-Pg.text: Because of the owner's handsome apology and offer of a meal on him I am upgrading the rating to a four. Anyone can make a mistake, but offering to correct it  shows the measure of the person.

8L0gdbH-ZHLndsHxvr-Aaw.text: chicken fried steak!!!! OMG. this is not the place to go if you are on a diet! Fun atmosphere, all kinds of visuals on the wall. The food is great.

xCEa25KoyQm1X9NUDEM-zQ.text: MMMMMMMMM! Grew up in Texas, so this place is such comfort.   The good: DELICIOUS food. Love the mashed potatoes and the STEAK - OH MY! Amazing. Great service - very sweet, patient waitresses. You know, the "what can I get you sweetie?" kind of waitresses. Gotta love em. The interior is phenomenal and cozy - a little crowded but  actually really cozy once you get settled in.   The bad: Like I said, it is very crowded. I suggest not going at dinner time. There always seems to be a wait and...there's really no place to wait. Last time I went was about 7:30 PM and there was a long line and we were forced to wait outside, not even close to the front door. Fortunately, not for long! So kudos for that.   Above all, great atmosphere, great food, great service - HIGHLY recommend if you're in the mood for a lil southern cookin!

Rw5AYUfoYMBuKxZkSJQRPA.text: I had the lunch special, cermitas, it was phenomenal! One of the best bbq sandwiches I've had ever. The prices are great, especially for the amount of food served. Service was speedy & friendly.

KDeNV0DLGK4yRzLJHzGN1Q.text: Looking for a casual restaurant with exceptional food then make your way to TEXAZ Grill. The hardest decision you will have is what to finally order. Everything on this menu is Texas style goodness and is priced right. The chicken fried chicken and chicken fried steak are TEXAZ favorites but you have to try their steaks and if you think you have had great fried shrimp, guess again, this place serves out the best. This may be the only restaurant that I have enjoyed everything on the menu.

y3uGKxhqNYWZAf6p3ioiTw.text: After reading all the reviews on this page I made the decision to have dinner here on Saturday with my husband. We were both very excited, my husband loves chicken fried steak and although money is a little tight we wanted to splurge a little for date night. It was busy but we got seated right away and knew within minutes what we wanted to order. We started off with a bowl of chili to share. The chili was very good, with lots of meat and had great flavor. The side salad that accompanied was fine too. Our server was very friendly and attentive. Now on to the main course, and this is where I have to say we were very disappointed. My husband had the chicken fried steak, and yes it was definitely huge, however there was no flavor to it whatsoever. Even the gravy tasted of flour and not much else. A little seasoning (salt & pepper) would have gone a long way. I had the grilled pork chops and mashed potatoes. The pork chops were a little dry, and again under-seasoned, the mashed potatoes were ok, but I could see what my husband was talking about on the gravy. We so wanted this to be a great experience for us but the food just missed the mark. My husband did want to tell the server about it, but I'm always too self-conscious about making a complaint that I begged him to let it go.

iYs5hDbduXSkmZ8jxV8rHA.text: My stand-by easy night for dinner and a drink spot.  I prefer to sit at the bar with Tammy and have a salad and a burger, or maybe the Chicken or Beef Kabob (Ask for it dry "no butter").  Also love the Chili and the Fried Shrimp.  Ask for extra mushrooms is yummy to me.  Furthermore, the Thursday BBQ special rocks (but split it with someone as it is huge).  The Friday night Fish and Chips is delicious.  Not a fan of Liver and Onions ever so I wouldn't order it.  Sometimes the salads can be pretty heavy on dressing.    Biggest gripe = I used to order my Vodka Tonic, till I found out they use an "Absolute 100" vodka or something similar that is 100 Proof.  In my opinion it is totally wrong to serve somebody  a "100" vodka versus the normal "80".  It is the same as ordering a rum and coke and getting Barcadi 151 rum instead.   A totally different product.  Can you tell this is an issue for me?  Otherwise one of my favorite watering holes for sure.  Nice people too.

7itjspN46jfliNlVJyoI0g.text: I have always driven past this place leaving from school and have always wanted to try it. Finally tonight I did and it was excellent. I went in and loved the atmosphere. Was greeted with a friendly smile by our waitress Nicole, who by the way is an incredible waitress. The service was impeccable, we never had to worry about our drinks being refilled, our food was out quickly, and everything was cooked to perfection. For the price, you can not beat the food. I was definitely pleasantly surprised and will be sure to come back here often. The place is great, the food was great, and Nicole was great. Thank you!

VheIaIUoNTf4PNYqskB9Ng.text: This place is yummy!  The chicken fried steak is the best and the salads and rolls they serve before the meal are also good.

Om0-RbhN96C3DdxA3-faJw.text: This is good-ole, down home cookin'. And yes, the chicken-fried steak is quite possibly the best around.

aRGRUINm2riDaMcEN0jgfA.text: Brazos Burrito and Shiner Bock!  It doesn't get much better than this in Phoenix if you're from Texas.  Chicken fried steak is amazing and the customer service rocks!

Yxjc41oCf3ChV2V_7S8fGw.text: YUM!  A definite thumbs up and will be back !  :) Very friendly and attentive staff! We will definitely be back. Chicken fried steak huge cook well, smashed skins on taters, yum.  A definite recommend.

6oFN5TsE4vAhvu0iP24rng.text: I am always searching for good chicken fried steak. This is the best I have ever had! It's so big it might give you a heart attack. Make room for the peach cobbler! It's soooooo good! I can't wait to go back.

Qg8-ifoGcAhrUJf3Yyhu3w.text: Total dive ..... which is AWESOME!  The chicken fried steak is HUGE, there is no way I could finish it myself.  This place is great in the summer because it's completely blacked out, there are no windows at all.  The walls are plastered with Texas memorabilia from license plates, to shirts, hats, signs, you name it.  The service is quick and friendly.

FOzV8g8cWyYj3fHqw84EHQ.text: Great good great service. We took are 3 young children there tonight. The customer service was top notch.Waitress help led my children there steak while by wife was busy with our 1 old. Manager came over a few times to entertain them. It just made eating out with the kids more enjoyable

lqLWjv3R2U2wp9Qa5t6nNA.text: I have been fortunate enough to live in a lot of different places throughout the US including Texas.  I've traveled to all of it's major cities and to many more of the out of the way places.  To walk into Texaz Grill took me right back to being in Texas, which I only left 2 months ago.  From the first sip of a Shiner beer, to the Blue Bell ice cream sticker on the fridge, from floor to ceiling, this place bleeds Texas pride.  When I walked out, I almost expected to find myself in the humidity and heat of the Lone Star state, Texaz Grill could hold it's own versus any long standing place in Texas.  As for the food, couldn't be better.  The portions are large and leftovers are plenty, but it's so good that you may just want to try and eat it all in one sitting.  The Texas chili is right on the mark with how chili should taste.  Set your expectations accordingly when you go to Texaz Grill, this is a down home place where you can relax and enjoy the comfortable atmosphere as well as great food.  If you want crystal glasses and overly dressed waiters, go somewhere else.  If you're from Texas, well then come get a taste of home, if you're from any where else, come experience a real slice of the Lone Star state.

8Y1DkxRmRABpSqvurm2Mtw.text: I absolutely love this place. They have the best prime rib I've ever tasted and the prices are cheap for the portion size. The waitresses are very friendly and the whole atmosphere is family friendly and enjoyable.

-nUH8dF1C20gbTbb5R_1jg.text: I grew up in Fort Worth and pride myself on being a chicken fried steak connoisseur. It was by far the best I've had in Arizona. Didn't bring back childhood memories of dinner at the greasy spoon, but I would definitely go back for seconds. The wife and kids enjoyed theirs as well.

mODg_ULdiJxDp5GCA7HpsA.text: am a retired chef the stuff i used to trim or throw away is what they served! we are a group of  men on way to airport i think maybe they served us crappy food because we looked like tourists

KJe0Cun19pyGII7HX7HL-A.text: This is simply the best Chicken Fried Steak in phoenix - and the Steaks are good too. Definatly one of my top 10 favorites.  We often visit for lunch which is quite reasonably prices and exceptionally good. So finding a higher price for dinner was supurising untill the waitress informed us that they didnt give you one huge/gigantic chicken fried steak but two. I had to try to eat both but found it impossible - but was good the next day for lunch. I would have tried for breakfast but found myself still too full.  The food is Superb The Service is Superb The Atmosphere is Great  Have eaten the Steaks here as well - as good a most steakhouses The ribs are very good as well - on par with most bbq places The Red Eye gravy - just try it, will suprise you how good it is

0_6NkFTiqR8QzxPabZXYkQ.text: The Chicken Fried Steak is to die for - best ever.  And, chopped green olives in the house salad - so simple, so good.  Come back for the smoked prime rib.

We_6B2ydoqPq4PMDSuju-Q.text: High quality. Good Service. FAST! The menu is limited which makes it a lot easier for the kitchen, I'd imagine. The catfish is just about the best I've ever had. Never disappointed in the service or the food. Highly recommend.

iMQLWWgVq-uj0fqAafRhwA.text: I LOVE chicken fried steak and a family friend told me I HAD to try this place. And I'm so happy I did so.  The chicken fried steak was delicious. The batter was light and crispy, the steak was moist and the country gravy, to die for.  I've had plenty of chewy chicken fried steak in my life with mediocre gravy. This was definitely the BEST chicken fried steak I've ever had. The waitress was super busy as they bus their own tables, but we never felt neglected. I just noticed how busy she was.  So the fact that she was slammed and her service never suffered was huge to me.  The manager or maybe the owner was coming around to all the tables and asking everyone how the food was and chatting with the regulars. I love that type of service. We raved about the food and told him it was our first time in and he gave me and my mother a card for a free dessert on our next visit!!  So what else can I do BUT give this place 5 stars.  Wonderful home cooking and great service.

VEEHmsLaxOi7CBJlJXJ4lg.text: I have been going to this restaurant for years, even before it was Texaz when it used to be known as Lonestar.  They have been in the valley for YEARS and I can understand why.  Their food is simple and DELICIOUS.  Their chicken fried steak is huge and I cannot even begin to describe the flavor.  Their steaks are always perfectly cooked perfection and I always leave feeling full and satisfied.  If you're looking for a casual night out with delicious steak and potatoes I would recommend this place.  It's also fun to see what they've got on their walls as the place is packed with fun trinkets.

5xNmdFvjsd9LAI-VhHIxBw.text: I've heard that everything is bigger in Texas.  I sure know that my waistline would be!  Wow!  Food is amazing.  Portions are gigantic and the atmosphere is wonderful.  I felt like I was in a local bar in San Antonio or something.  The bar looked like a wonderful place to sidle up to and order a long neck bottle of something good and hang out before a HUGE MEAL!    Service was great.  Music wonderful.  While there, I heard Lyle Lovett, Mary Chapin Carpenter as well as a country version or Walk Away Renee and Mr Bojangles.  For me, that was a treat.    Don't go without your appetite.  Each meal comes with 2 sides.  I need to try to smoked prime rib next time.  I WILL be back!!!

juktmlXI84sZ18lbga5RYg.text: Love the atmosphere, the food and the place was hopping. Apparently, the restaurant was sold to new owners and they've vowed to keep it the same way with managers and everything. From what I've heard, so far so good. So why not five stars you ask? Let's expand the diversity! Although the food caters to majority Caucasian descent, especially with Texaz Grill down home cooking, minorities are amiss. However, now that it's minority owned do you think that will that change and if so, how will that effect the current clientele? And if there were any minorities, I didn't see them and sorry, I forgot to look back in the kitchen and I can say that cause I'm Mexican American!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Picture time? Why yes.
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Working with a complainy customer very calm he is!
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The manager, very humble and nice. Took the time to ask if everything was good.

W2FNk9CbrF18rT527nK5DQ.text: I've been going to Tex AZ Grill for over 20 years and I can say without doubt or hesitation, you will not find a better chicken fried steak or chicken fried chicken anywhere in our country. It's the kind a good that makes regular old sweetcorn taste absolutely awesome.  Don't go and test this place out, if you're going for the first time invite everyone that you know because it's a gift and you will not be disappointed.

0b1OdiknzfrEQ6iIJEMpIQ.text: Got the chicken fried steak sandwich to go, and ended up with a quick and easy package while I waited quietly at the bar during off-peak hours.   This is fantastic! Delicious gravy like my Cajun Texan Dad makes from scratch, toasted bun and fresh tomato, onion, pickle, and lettuce. And two perfect full size chicken fried steaks! Fabulous and generous lunch. Fried potatoes nice and well-done like I like 'em!  I will be back with friends to try the hard core stuff. Only wish they had loaded baked potatoes and baked beans.

iCBifYetNEG6afjs4rg25A.text: Local classic.. little did I know on this visit the restaurant was purchased by new buyers so it may be the last time I see a few familiar faces sadly.. Great drink, atmosphere and customers. I love the food and some specials you really can't afford to miss! I will be going back soon because who knows what changes are to come. Looking forward to what they may be if any..

-TAXEMh9jvXoSPVq8ylyxA.text: Oh my it has been a crazy last few months.  Travel, family and so on.  I will cut straight to the review.  We met here for two birthdays.  I had of course the chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes.  It came with a veggie but who cares about that when there is a huge chicken fried steak on the plate.  The chicken fried steak is probably one of the best ones I have ever had.  I like chicken fried steak, but my doctor does not like me eating it.  What a great place to eat.  The service was great and the atmosphere was great too.

5Xf2eGI4fJf8Mr5Bdi8zBg.text: Food is fresh and homemade. Love that the mashed potatoes are real and not instant. VERY LARGE portions of food.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bU7lVGSuGfWA1z6H5k2Gwg.text: IDK what the actual fuck happened to this place BUT it has gone off the rails. This used to be my go to spot for steaks. When l have friends and family come in to town we ALWAYS hit this spot. But the last 2 times it's been a shit show.  I was told the new owners are changing everything and using different ingredients and recipes.  I'm not sure why you would buy a restaurant that has been successful for 30 years and then start changing shit. It saddens me that it is not the same, but l won't be back

qKCTa83K796X_qWawPIpPw.text: This is for chicken fried steak- if you grew up with this meal and need a fix- you will be very pleased.  I have been 2 times. I like to sit at the bar.  Casual and friendly service and BIG servings. Very well priced.  Highly recommend.

bqu4l-pGezTMNqAvy7M2bg.text: Amazing food prices are great Hellen is a great waitress highly recommend.good for kids.

UGhmfwvQLupl-JdppEP91g.text: Three of us went the other evening for the house special, country fried steak. Inside very eclectic Texas. Service was great, portions huge but sorrowfully lacking in taste. Salad or coleslaw to start. I got the coleslaw. Lots of it, just tasted like mayonnaise & cabbage. When the country fried steaks arrived, just huge, we all got the Texas fries too. The steak were so big, almost too big to stay on the plate. Unfortunately the breading lacked any spices. We all tried salt & pepper that helped a little but ketchup is what made it better. Won't be going back. We will continue our hunt for a delicious country fried steak. Rating would have been lower but the service was very good.

BMzHtXGZ7-wCjC2pp-M-Vg.text: Let's say that this is homestyle cooking. The food was ample in portion but needs a little lift. The salad is very basic and bland. Needs a little color and flavour. There was not a lot of excitement from the start.  I was craving a great steak and I had never been here before. The Ribeye (My favorite cut) was lacking in the quality of the beef. It tastes like grocery store Holstein and looked like it when it cooked up too. The meal covered my hunger bit I felt this place could be so much better with just a little tweeking.   The decor I loved and it screams Texas. It was fun to read the articles and see all of the hats hanging from the ceiling. As always, I may have just caught it on an off day. Check it out for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

73aPYYbasMJefmzMg-8D3w.text: It was excellent again! It made my birthday terrific! The chicken fried steak and gravy were delicious! I love the fried okra as well. If you don't like this place you must not be from Texas!

9Mme0m9lQKa8Rp-sakP8DQ.text: Great atmosphere! Friendly staff. Amazing country fried steak. I have been here multiple times and have never been disappointed.

4LMLErAVlknQkk4MkjOfqw.text: The service was great. My drinks were never empty and the hostess and waitress were polite and helpful.   For dinner I had the chicken steak which was pretty and tasty. All I would have added would of been more salt.   Definitely a go to place for dinner.

u5okGxx82tiINzkID04Tzg.text: The staff was friendly but the food was the worst. Poor quality food and over priced. I was so mad for coming here.

X1zEXKAwAQ5N85a7WP1R_w.text: The chicken fried chicken is delicious. The grilled pork loin is delicious. The mashed potatoes are delicious. The chicken fried chicken is very crispy, which I like because the gravy will make it soft. They have good ice tea and I'm picky with ice tea. We get the bread pudding for dessert. It is amazing. I get the sauce on the side because I don't like the taste of the alcohol but my husband likes it. This is good southern home food. The service is always great as well.

eDMWrCEjcPr3gXbVLPxTcA.text: One of my favorite local places to eat. Food is always delicious, generous helpings and super friendly service. Chicken fried steak can't be beat.

1DBalgNOUXETpLDbf2fh5w.text: Great food and friendly staff. The portions are great, staff is fun. Very friendly place. Texas portions, being from Texas it is the best TEXAZ food around...

2kbev3VfUewFlghv4qw0tA.text: Damn yummy!! I recommend the chicken fried chicken. A forever favorite for me and many friends. Was one of my Mom's favorite places and they always treated her as if she were family. I enjoy dining there for the great food, service and the memories of special meals with my Mom.

dT4d86_wSPYg5e_TE-ewfQ.text: I love this place! And have for years. Its one of the very few places where I have never been disappointed! The Chicken Fried Steak is the best on the planet....and I've tried it everywhere... awesome place!!

SERTVWf8dASe8lH-flgA-Q.text: Chicken Fried Steak is amazing.  I'd call it a destination food for TEXAZ.  The larger size does actually have (2) steaks!  If allowed by TEXAZ, enough to share.  Dinner does come with a great salad, bread, and two sides.  Mmmmmm nom.....  I often sit at a table and have a few beers before I eat.  One server in particular seems to put off by a patron have a few brews before dinner.  Outside of the server, I'd give 5 stars.  If you are in town or a local, swing in.

R-_g1LM02IwMBzjBazqogA.text: the food was good here, i had the chicken fired steak, and it was decent. the only issue i had was, it's a little to dark in there for me. But other then that, the meal i had was good. i will go back and try out other options.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place is pretty good,  the chicken fried steak is pretty good

x6PaGFWIeW7z-dffIahroQ.text: After a long hard work week, my girlfriend and I wanted to go out and get some good comfort food.  She wanted to go to Lo Lo's and as you can see based off my previous review of that place, I really wasn't too excited.  I found this place on yelp and convinced my girlfriend to come here.  Oh boy, I'm glad we did.  We heard all the good reviews of the Chicken fried steak and we had to give it a try.  We ordered Fried Okra as a appetizer and I got the large chicken fried steak and she got the smothered pork chop.  Everything was a hit!  The gravy was amazing and the food was great!  The place was pretty packed for a Friday night, the service was great and everything was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak

-vDIS7dTz8dzusovuYAEeg.text: First time here after many recommendations. Tried the Chicken Fried Steak. It did not disappoint! Huge and delicious. The chef came out to check on our meal to make sure it was to our liking. Great service, and great food!

oQhT80U1R2lCaj3JWq_pcg.text: Without a doubt, one of THE BEST comfort food restaurants in AZ!  Go to items?  1) Chicken fried steak with gravy and mashed potatoes. FORGETTABOUDIT!  2) Medium rare prime rib and mashed potatoes.  UNREAL! 3) Biscuits and gravy, again, with mashed potatoes! Lol. DELICIOUS!  They have been in the same spot doing their wonderful comfort food CONSISTENTLY for many years now. The atmosphere is kitchy, which I personally don't care for, but I only go for the awesome food and friendly service. Geez, now I'm craving some prime rib!  Don't hesitate to go here for a casual dinner with some of the best Texas comfort food you'll ever have. Bring clients for lunch if they have never been, they will love it and let their guard down so you can have a productive lunch meeting. They will end up going back, bringing their spouses and thanking you for showing them this spot!

p4M-doIPZS3h0BgBof6ItQ.text: Going to boost them up because the "Eggs Bubba" was spot-on (with some added salt and pepper).  Biscuits (basic), chicken fried steak (super tender), sunny side up eggs, and sausage gravy, all coming together into an indulgent brunch dish.  The large hunks of fried potatoes ("Texas Fries") were cooked through, and had a nice "real" potato flavor to them.  Some salt and pepper plus ketchup finished them nicely.  The pecan pie is very sweet and chewy, and the pecans are candied beautifully.  Not the biggest fan of the crust (it could be more buttery and crumbly) but overall it was very good.  The place looked clean to me, and I appreciate being able to sit at a booth during a time when they weren't super busy.  My water was never empty for too long, and the waitress did a good job.  While I'm not a fan of the decor, I do appreciate how all the flags and caps on the walls and ceiling dampen the noise level.  After being disappointed at the diners around here, I'll be back for their REAL (not frozen and re-heated) chicken fried steak/chicken and their REAL (not instant or canned)!sausage gravy.

RlZHA6ytdBxqiiq3AVELnQ.text: OMG!!  Went in for a quick dinner, they were so friendly and the service was amazing!!  I had the chicken fried steak!!  Beware it is enormous!!  Definitely had plenty for a second meal!!!  Prices are super reasonable!  Next time I'm in Phoenix I will definitely be back!!!

vfpmcVqocOMXbzunERWrQg.text: Coming from California and came across Texaz. Great food and amazing service! Come with an empty stomach cause it's a lot of food! Matt was extremely friendly and welcoming. Definitely recommend it for other newcomers

ZyHWKyTzgGObgNiIfsESow.text: Really nice people.  Very welcoming to kids. Owner came out and ask kids riddles and did Texas Trivia.  Really fun.  The Ribeye I had was average...

3tohXvD7QbgR1LRzruB5sg.text: Had an early dinner with my family today. The food was great; atmosphere was family friendly; service was superb. The floor manager visiting the customers was very customer focused. He did a great job of engaging with our entire table including giving us challenging riddles to solve. We will definitely come here again when we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids catfish and Texaz Fries
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Batter Fried Cod and Coleslaw

q6lmtwjN0SnITy80iog3Gw.text: We went here for lunch today, the food was pretty bad. I ordered the big Texas sandwich or whatever it's called and it was almost inedible. It had the cheap Kraft cheese barley melted on it and weird coleslaw...? Anyways, I originally tried to order chicken tenders and fries and was told by the waitress I wasn't allowed because I wasn't a child. I had a child at the table sitting right next to me?! She said the cooks wouldn't make it for me because it wasn't actually for the child it was for me.... ummm.. okay? So I end up with this crappy sand which instead.  The waitress was a little rude. The only positive was the manager he was super friendly, he seemed like a genuinely good person. I almost feel bad writing this review because he was so nice. But hopefully he will see this and make some changes! Also, the high chairs are super sketchy. It was hanging off the table by two bars, hardly secured on there. The waitress told me they can put a chair under it Incase it falls... yea, nooo thanks! I would just rather my child not fall at all! Lol

Yj3To9bwFyWEuDPxXxxtbQ.text: Had lunch here this week... We had  1 chicken fried chicken and 1 chicken fried steak... Both delicious and served promptly with a smile... This is one of my favorite restaurants and I don't mind the 40 minute drive from the west valley... A real Phoenix Classic !

RSmGZcrpofVC7o4vgF_SFw.text: Coolest restaurant! Neat atmosphere, awesome service. I had the chicken fried chicken and it was really good. Would definitely recommend to others stopping by town or people who live here. I've heard it's best to get there earlier if you want the steaks!

sQ3_cU1xBJ3fDHYZKS2IXw.text: I am a big fan of smoked prime rib.  I've had it at The Stockyards and BobbyQ's and enjoyed their versions very much. I read some reviews that were positive about dining at Texaz Grill and drove from Anthem to try their smoked prime rib.   I arrived about 6:00 p.m. on a Sunday evening and was seated immediately. I placed my order and was served my iceberg lettuce with rhe house mustard  dressing and warm rolls & butter. So far, so good. About 15 minutes later I was served my entree. The large cut of smoked prime rib was accompanied by mashed potatoes and gravy and a dollop of horseradish sauce on rhe side. The potatoes were tasty but the prime rib ordered medium rare was inedible.  I could barely cut into it as the meat was as tough as shoe leather. I chewed and chewed and it had a subtle smoked flavor but there was so much fat and gristle that I chose to take it home.  The next day I tried to have it for lunch but threw most of it away as it was too tough to chew and swallow.  I spent $30. some dollars for a cut of smoked prime rib that was lousy.  I should have sent it back but I have to say I would not recommend the smoked prime rib and will not be coming to the Texaz Grill again.

pA-2ecR97KeyOcvbbJLPTw.text: Wow. I have been bragging to my husband about how great this place was for chicken fried steak. I used to go there with coworkers several years ago for lunch. Had such fond memories of the best chicken fried steak I have ever had.   What happened?  The place was only half full as opposed to having to wait quite awhile for a seat awhile back. We both ordered the CFS and waited anxiously for it to arrive (short wait). What a disappointment. The breading was soggy and somewhat tasteless. The steak overflowed the plate and the gravy was lacking flavor.  Disappointed.

f407fWdo_bvFbi_yviXmNg.text: GOOD FOOD AND GREAT SERVICE. I'm from Texas and I miss the good ole home cooked food; this is the place to get a great piece of Texas.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. YUM. I&#39;m originally from Amarillo, Texas and let me tell you.... I miss the good ole food. Great food and great service!!

658b7Rpmq02sCNRMlcFOoA.text: I always pass by this place on my way to the gym and I finally decided to stop on in and check it out. At first when walking in I saw nothing but Texas stuff posted on the walls all sorts of arrangements so I obviously thought things were gonna be super delicious and I was eager to order. I order chicken fried steak as most reviews here are explaining the incredible taste of it.   Upon receiving my order I was kinda disappointed it was a huge portion which was great but I did not find much of a flavor to it. Overall I think this place is ok I personally would not go out of my way to eat here and after all don't take my word for it go out and try it.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak was Ok.
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Steak was huge but the flavor was not all there.

hLnZpHNhVEyIZ9VXimtuQg.text: Like a trip down memory lane. Still as good as I remember it from the late '80's.  The chicken fried chicken is my favorite with tender fried chicken breasts and skin-on mashed potatoes smothered in gravy.  Comfort food at its finest!

PzoRQViAJPfQ9A70nHqHwA.text: We wandered in on a Wednesday night, not knowing quite what to expect - but we are glad we did.  Lots of quirky character inside, with just about every square inch of wall and ceiling covered with license plates, ball caps, and plenty of Texas tavern memorabilia.  Fair selection of bottled beers, though none on tap.  They tend to sell out of the prime rib, but I hope to give that a try next go around.  Steak and mashed potatoes were both decent, but my oh my - the breaded pork chop was out of this world tender and juicy!  I ordered a side of cole slaw which wasn't bad, but it definitely has onions in it, which was new to me.  The service was very attentive, and the restaurant had a nice homey feel to it - not what you'd expect to find in a strip mall, but that kinda adds to the charm.

kWnztPF1Ekud_9Z2BLb3tQ.text: The food is delicious.  I love this place.  It reminds me of so many BBQ places in Texas.  I feel so at home at this place.  I really enjoy all the memorabilia on the walls and ceiling.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and friendly service.

lrtQIxGyJLvvvoOQUXX9_w.text: I'll be short, and just get to the point on this one:  The only reason I managed to give this place 2 stars was because they definitely gave you good sized portions for the price.  However, a large portion of nasty, is still just nasty, regardless of how much they give you.  The Chicken Fried Steak (their pride and joy) was bland and the only flavor was grease.  I don't mean the typical "its a fried dish" grease flavor, no i mean it tasted like after they pulled it out of the fryer they dipped it in the oil vat.  The gravy was nondescript and flavorless.    Side options were nothing special, they seem to rave about the cole slaw, but it is not my cup of tea, so I passed.  This place seems like the type of establishment that if you are a regular then you get stellar service, if you are not, then oh well to you.  Funny, because how do people get to be a new regular if you aren't giving decent service to the new guest.  To sum it up, people swear by this place. I however, have sworn off this place.  I don't get it, I left feeling ripped off and revolted that I even ate that junk (now don't get me wrong, I enjoy a good chicken fried steak, this just was not it for sure!)

L731z9gbhTLC-869m034vQ.text: Great tasting prime rib!! The rib eye was just as good! The bread pudding with ice cream was excellent!!

COooTLm0NfiKHInU4iAYJw.text: There's a reason this place has sold over 700,000 chicken fried steaks!  We went here last night and that's exactly what I ordered.  I couldn't believe the amount of food I got once it was there.  The hot gravy on top of it, along with a side of mashed potatoes.  Amazing.    Before dinner though, they bring out fresh biscuits, which I quickly buttered up and coated with honey.    This review was based on my own dinner.  The four stars was for the chicken friend steak.  Im being generous because on the downside, the salads we got seem wilted and old.  Our waitress at times was too busy talking to people than checking to see if we were ready to order or go. My girlfriend got shish kabobs and wasn't too much of a fan.. especially after she tried my CFS.  haha.. My friend got the pork chops and it seemed too much fried food. Weird?   Overall it was good, but there was room for improvement.

9lMdCm_Wfr06MRfiGLjA2A.text: I like this place very unique decorum staff is really great checked on us throughout our meal. Had the catfish it was good I'd recommend this place

bZ99Zx_S44WGJSMnqwsa1A.text: I ate the chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes and gravy.  It was delicious and the chicken is as big as a plate and you get two.  My boyfriend received a steak sandwich and we were both unimpressed.  It was dry meat strips on bread with a tiny bit of sauce.  He had to ask for a side of BBQ sauce and it came as a warm pourable liquid so putting it on the sandwich made the bread soggy.  The decor is cool if you like truck stops and what you "think" Arizona is supposed to be and lots of elderly people.  We will not be back.

p9snGNz0Z36cdoGstwuZlA.text: Is their infamous Chicken Fried Everything enough to blow me up into a giant hot air balloon until I go to 'Awesome-Portion-Heaven?' Yes. Is this something I'm gonna regret when I finally drag my body to the gym? Yes, BUT, I argue that you only live once and you should try one of the finest Chicken Fried Steaks around. The only bad thing I will say though is that their gravy is a little bland just by itself. I like mah gravy to taste like it could be an entree of it's own like it should, not as just a topping, but that's just the fatty inside me talking. Also, they get ya by asking if you want some more sauce or more of this, then when the bill comes they tack on extra money without warning me and I can't do anything but a major facepalm.

QnuUgnogsGv7lu4ya-CpPQ.text: There's probably not a lot that can be said about TexAz Grill that hasn't been said, but  I feel the need to put in a good word for their catfish. It's great - perfectly battered, flaky, great flavor and the two massive fillets are enough to share with a friend, making it a fairly inexpensive, reasonably healthful dinner for two.

qXYLJo1Kdd557plLSLu0vg.text: Years ago, this place had some great food! Now, not so much. Chicken Fried Steak is bland, the Salad has very little "greens" to it, and the apitizer bread they serve is cold. They used to have the best CFS around, but in the last few years or so, its beaten out by a Denny's dinner.

3shwUi1Aaa7yrVTBwYoyxA.text: My boyfriend has the winning review for tonight:  "I'd slit my wrists, but you'd never get the grease out of the upholstery."  Texaz is neither a steakhouse nor a diner.   It is a little piece of nostalgia for those who miss their mother's (mediocre) dinners. Portions are ridiculously over-sized, the cow is proudly "unseasoned," and grease takes the place of, well... everything. It should all add up to ultimate comfort, but we left feeling full-up on drippings without any flavor to show for it. It's a McDonald's feeling. If that's your guilty pleasure, go for it. But do it on your own hung-over time. I wouldn't bring friends here.  I loved the restaurant itself. Everyone who worked there was beyond amazing. Just really good people who clearly loved the place and who wanted their guests to love it too. The kitsch was fun, the energy was upbeat and comfortable, and I appreciate any place that has such a dedicated following of regulars.  The flagship chicken fried steak had a lot going for it. It was big enough to feed a family of four, tender enough to be cut with a fork (really!), and it held up its light crispiness under the white gravy. That's a super-human feat, and it amazed me all night. On the down side, the cutlet lacked flavor, which is the whole point of a round steak. Ultimately, it was comforting, but only because it was totally expected and not notably bad.  The steak list is cut in-house (except the t-bone, I think). The menu boasts that the steaks are free of seasoning and tenderizer, so we expected the rib-eye to be full of flavor and fat. Instead, it was presented swimming in oil (shortening? flavorless drippings?) and wasn't good for anything except as a sponge for Worcestershire sauce. We sent most of it back.  Both mashed and fried potatoes were good, and the slaw was refreshing.   I know these are minor, but:  -Why does the bread basket have a single dinner roll and a single biscuit in it? -Why don't they have sweet tea? -Why is their Shiner Bock served in a 7oz glass?

6lPhssd1cc39qOStJFIIfg.text: The food is good, that's already been expressed. The service is amazing!!!! From the greeting, to bringing constant refills, to pleasing the children (nephew).  It's like going to a Deep South restaurant where the staff goes out of their way to make sure you're comfortable. It sounds cheesy, but I'll admit I was hesitant to go in this restaurant because it doesn't look friendly from the outside. So I guess my vibe reader was wrong. Oh- and great lemonade!

PVWNihshr97koSndKQn1EQ.text: We came out to Phoenix for a little spring training action and a good friend of mine was twisting my arm to give this place a shot.  We finally made it on our way to the airport on our last day and I'm pumped we did.  We started with margaritas, which are out of control.  They are the perfect combination of sweet and citrus.  Truly some of the best margaritas I've had at any restaurant or bar.  For dinner we got the Chicken Fried Steak with fries and the Prime Rib with mashed potatoes.  The steak was good, it didn't have a ton of flavor but the gravy that I slathered on top did.  The Prime Rib was awesome, thick, red, and juicy.  They even brought us out some sour cream because they didn't have horseradish sauce.  Good stuff, I really liked their gravy.

6auDtEaZnMYd4LYyHjm4oA.text: So it has been a little over a year since I was here last. The place still holds a 5 star review from me.   I tried the CFS and it WAS good. I never really cares for CFS but figured if I was going to like it I should get it from the best.   It is a 7inch plus slab of tender beef, lightly battered in a airy type of batter. Think of soda water infused batter. They then slather the middle with a creamy and yummy white gravy. They serve it with mashed and corn with a biscuit on the side.   The corn was cold, the mashed were OK and the biscuit was just OK.   The price for lunch was $7.99 of something really reasonable.   The Chef salad with chicken looked killer.

v5m70LW34jsX_-k0jzirEg.text: Best chicken fried steak bar none in Phoenix.  I come here only for that but the fresh lemonade rocks here too.  The atmosphere is VERY casual and VERY country.  I cant stand country music but its worth it for this place.  It is also a pretty inexpensive place for a good steak if you are looking.  Service is always good, parking is what really sucks here but if you go when there is not a big rush you will be okay.

xJYr9PGaGup0BJHEKVzFXg.text: Thank you TexAZ for introducing me to the Steak Lin Su Saturday special!  It's a fantastic steak topped with bernaise sauce, artichokes, and mmmmm shrimp.  YUM!    Also, thanks for suggesting Tito's Vodka.  Surprisingly smooth and tasty.  I liked it so much, I went & found it at Total Wine & More.    Fast, friendly service with good food.  Always busy, but you never feel like you wait for too long.  I'll return regularly.

TLVGNv2AFu2XAO65OtQjZg.text: went today for national fried chicken day absolutely amazing.  the largest chicken wings ever Kathy and I shared as a appetizer we only ate two because we also had lunch. briskets sandwich great ,rib eye mashed taters with gravy and corn superb. hope you keep the wings as a weekend thing thanks for a great experience always the best food and service

vY7ECsGkW1gW7SrFnvryQA.text: Chicken-fried steak and a Shiner bock doesn't get much more Texas then this. Chicken-fried steaks are huge and you get two of them and some of the best southern bread pudding around. Take some time look around at all the Texas flair on the walls and say hi to the armadillo that greets you at the door.

mcer5jdRMhE4nTBY58DKWQ.text: The food is so good that I wish I could eat there every day. I love their lunch time specials.  Tuesday is a must for ham steak  Wednesday is a must for liver and onions .  Thursdays for ribs or prime rib (almost a half pound).  Friday is the best fish in town. Nancy, the werver is simply great!

4_Ua7nBEC35jbrkjNO7Dvg.text: Sometimes a girl gets a wicked hankerin' for some chicken fried steak, mashed taters, and white gravy.  You know that what she does?  She goes to Texaz Grill.  For a ridiculously satisfying and heart clogging meal, you can't beat it.  It's got a casual and fun atmosphere, and it's extremely reasonably priced.  And best of all, the bar has a total honky tonk feel that makes me want to run home and play Urban Cowboy with the mister.

WqwXRIuWwENfNkS-VESPJQ.text: Eh, this place is alright.  We wanted to try something new this weekend and we happened to drive by so we gave Texaz Grill a shot.  I of course yelped it first to decide what I was going to eat, and the response was overwhelmingly to get the Chicken Fried Steak.  Okay then.    Inside, this place is literally covered in crap.  There are business cards along the door frame and all over the ceiling.  Baseball caps literally line the entire perimeter of the room and then some.  There really isn't an inch of space that hasn't been covered with some form of Texas style memorabilia.    I got the chicken fried steak, obviously, and it came with mashed potatoes, corn, and a biscuit.  The potatoes were okay, nothin special, the corn was okay but a little peppery, the biscuit was very bland and the bottom was a bit hard, and the chicken fried steak was just ok.  I've had a few chicken fried steaks in my life, and this one did not stand out.  It was really crisp and crunchy on the outside, which I like, but flavor-wise, there was just something missing.  It was just okay.  Service was quick and efficient.  We had our meal in under 30 minutes, so that was nice I guess.  I probably won't be back, but at least I tried.

6XYttOwC41e2W6ltB4s3LA.text: BEST PRIME RIB..  but the side dishes lack.  You wont leave hungry however.  The biscuits with honey are the bomb!!!    Other great items are the Ribeye steak and of course the chicken fried steak.......

YDMj8pcRPulwnc8_Y4fTeQ.text: I heart (attack) Texaz Grill. My tummy (arteries) were filled with good ole, down home cooking. My NY strip was perfection and dripping with flavor (cholesterol). Rickie's a Texas boy so he knows his chicken fried anythings, and his chicken fried chicken was smothered in love (gravy) and he nibbled every bite (inhaled like there's no tomorrow). I chased my taters, sauteed shrooms and steak down with a cold Dos XX and a Patron shot. All this with attentive and friendly service. The room reminded me of the shack Steve Martin lived in, in the beginning of The Jerk. And for this place, the license plates, posters and bric a brac that cover every corner, including the ceiling above the urinal, yes, guys get this...when you have to pee so badly, you arch your  head back with an eye rolling groan...that's how I saw the posters on the ceiling. But all the kitchy crap everywhere works for Texaz Grill. The menu has all kinds of steaks and wonderful sides. The only thing missing is a defibrillator.

s_lxbD-F9xK44u1ZvRI_lA.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. It's so delish! Also I'm a college student and I'm always looking for a place to get a lot of food for a great price.  I take my friends here all the time and they agree for  the best food at a great price the Texaz grill is where you wanna go.

pZEloNxNmrin3_G_fApGCg.text: I think A lot of people get the wrong impression of this place before they even come in, like it's supposed to be some elegant steakhouse or perfect dinner spot. The service was fantastic, We had a party of seven and the wait was not bad. We had plenty of food / bread / salad before our meal. The chicken friend steak was some of the best I've ever had, and the mashed potatoes and gravy all over was excellent. This is not a hit or miss place, the steak was tasty and large. Yes it did need some steak sauce but nothing was incredibly overpriced. I don't see how people payed 25 a person ordering soda, when th fried steak was maybe 13? and the ribeye was maybe 16? Thats a expensive soda for those peeps. I would say it was worth every penny, and also it made great leftovers the next day. This place is genuine, and a good spot to hit up every other month or so. This place (contrary to others beliefs) Is a Diner, and you will notice this on the way in. I suggest you try it yourself, if your not a high roller with perfect expectations on everything, I think you will like this place.

WgpxGYBr4QS5o3ck5-SGUQ.text: I am a Texan.  This place would not be in business in Texas for more than a few months.  The batter for the fried stuff is not crispy enough.  There's also no flavor at all in the batter.  The steaks look absolutely beautiful sitting there, raw, on the shelf.  They just don't put ANY seasoning on them so it's just a big, bland, piece of steak.  The cobbler is not made right either, it has a cake like batter instead of the crispy layer of dough it should have. Oddly enough though, I do and will continue to go back to this place every now and then.

VeBCu1ftmuzgI3QRUQahGA.text: surprising when you walk in and have no idea what to expect.   very kitschy old and probably not too clean. rustic, dark, woody. waitresses probably been there 30 years.  all very nice and warm and friendly. definitely not up to code on service, as she took our drink cups back for refills on a tray with someone else's dirty plates.  also put them on someone's else's table while dropping their check.  Ewww!! lots of noise. plenty of seniors. very busy, sometimes a lineup. not cheap for what it is. HUGE portions. simple home cooking. simple menu. very limited. salad or cole slaw with meal.  neither is particularly good.  2 dressing choices.  take it or leave it. i had the chicken fried steak.  their specialty item.  it was huge and hanging off the plate.  creamy gravy not too bad, tho it is not something i am used to eating.  meat itself was average in my opinion.  side of mashed potatoes and my daughter's home fries were also quite average and bland.   definitely worth 1 visit, something to see and experience, tho unsure you would return for the food alone.  that would be a personal decision, obviously many do.

2EamIJeK_-s6qYpyFnO_-g.text: Loooooove this place.  Has the dive feel with really friendly service and patrons and AMAZING food.  We had the chicken friend steak which I would rate the best of my life.  Also had the special mac n cheese of the day with ham and broccoli which was ridiculous!  And sooo reasonably priced. We can't wait to go back but be prepared for some serious caloric consumption!

OExXPR1l80L4Tto6ujZhYw.text: Went and checked out the place last Saturday. The ambiance is rustic I think. Parking was tricky and definitely not friendly unless you have a compact. The hostess was very friendly. Since the place supposedly has great chicken fried steak, that's what I ordered. To say the portion is ginormous is an understatement. You get two of them that the size as big as your head. The breading's texture is great with a nice crunch. The steak is very tender and not dry. My only complaint would be that the food is BLAND! The breading definitely could've used some flavor or spice and so did the gravy. Odd that the steak is such huge portion but the gravy is very much skimped on. I liked it, but it definitely could use some major seasoning. Maybe they can steal it from Chili's. Even though Chili's is a chain, they have one of the best chicken fried steak I've had. Texaz grilled would've definitely got 4 stars if they seasoned the CFS.

tnxlMhfXzJn2emGrVuX4_Q.text: this place was awful service was bad and steaks were tough and tatseless and the waitress sharon did not even offer us dessert

zuyHX9C_Ov6ZbkF701JrBw.text: Been coming to TexAz since 1985, back in the "Lonestar Steak" days. Never had a bad meal, had bad service just once in all that time, and 23 years later the prices aren't that much higher either. If I'm ever convicted of murder and sentenced to death my final meal has to be the Mulligan prime rib medium rare with mashed potatoes and that to-die-for cream gravy. I take friends here and buy them dinner just to see that look on their face when they see their plate for the first time. I've had everything on the menu except the catfish and all of it is great! I'd write more but I'm hungry now. See you there...

K1BMu4fYR0ZJf_XOrMiitQ.text: Maybe I should have got the chicken fried steak.  Because that steak I had was something else.  There was so much grease piled on top of my t-bone that I'm pretty sure I'm a likely candidate for the world's youngest triple bypass patient.  I'll admit, sometimes grease makes for good grubbin'.  But not this time.  I went on a Saturday night and there was a little bit of a wait. But our server was plenty kind.  She completely forgot our order of fried okra, but I wasn't feeling too upset about it.

l34NcPvW_icFxRpCNTSwRg.text: Excellent food and very friendly service. Had a prime rib sandwhich that was very tasty and was a large portion. Fun atmosphere as well. I'll be in again... Soon!

gZ1S9HI9LgbhkAkzA--ZNA.text: Great service, great price!!! I love this place!! Hidden treasure!! The prime rib sandwich was the best I ever had!!! The biscuits and gravy was the best and greatest taste!! I love the fun, friendly atmosphere!!!

OwhF8hLZhV3MpRSbDN7oiQ.text: Had one chicken fried steak in my life before this place. Was in Phoenix for two days and came here twice in that time. Amazing Chicken Fried Steak. Delicious Chili. Perfect peach cobbler. If I'm ever within 100 miles of this place, I will definitely come back.

ak1eNCklDWF7sGJYIhyVIA.text: I came to this location months ago and I still remember how delicious our food was! I got the pork ribs and my husband got the chicken fried steak, which is about the size of a horse, and smothered in gravy. The food was delectable, myself being a Texas native was more than pleased with the quality of the food and service! Great place, great food and great environment!

NZkrhL_tkYIhv36JGkJrIg.text: This was a great restaurant.  The steaks are not what they once were.  Less tender.  The chicken fried steak is still great, shrimp excellent.  Of course the drinks are cold and great

k4a-S6vdj5CvKDGhFgavNg.text: My husband and I ate lunch here a couple of weeks ago...I literally think about the chicken fried steak everyday.  First of all, it's HUGE...we're talking hanging off the plate huge.  Second of all, the mashed and gravy--'nuff said!  Third of all, the pecan pie.  My husband ordered it (as much as I wanted to try the peach cobbler, I felt like Violet Beauregarde from Willy Wonka when she ate the gum)...I took one bite (delicious, I might add), and he literally knocked the spoon out of my hand.  I thought he was going to lick the plate clean.  Anyone that gave this place bad reviews obviously is missing some taste buds, and probably thinks the food at TGIFridays is good...I wouldn't take their reviews seriously.  I love this place...not only is the food delicious, but it has a great atmosphere!  Old hats, brochures, business cards, license plates, etc. decorate the place.  Great food, great atmosphere!

1mhYVrFwRc2ePQa1eRfPSA.text: This is a terrific "local" place. The menu isn't expansive and that's part of the charm. The food is about is very good and I've never been disappointed (been there dozens of times), it's clean and service is quick. They are friendly, even going around to the "children" tables and challenging them to "Texas Trivia". I take my out of town friends there.  This is a best reason for overnight guests! The catfish is the best.... really... the best.

G8caUbsg1gfHXOSJFqzgiw.text: I knew it wasn't going to go well when I asked the guy at the front about my reservation and he pointed to the booth.  Didn't even offer to seat the party or anything.  We had 8 in the party and the server was Sharon.  She definitely came in with an attitude that she did not want to be there.  Totally gruff and unpleasant.  I asked here to go to the other end to take the rest of the orders after our side because they probably couldn't hear her over there.  She seemed to take offense to that and we all agreed that she was just plain rude.  Suffice it to say the service was mediocre at best and not deserving a tip but we left one anyway.  Sad thing is should could of made $25 more if she had just been nicer.  Now about the food, I really hoped for better but the over breaded chicken fried steak was bland and totally lacking any flavor.  The gravy was okay, nothing to write home about They serve it on this small plate which makes cutting it difficult.  The wrapped button was stuff under the roll on top of the mash potatoes which I found odd.  To top the meal off the waitress didn't even ask the mothers at the table if they wanted the free apple pie.  Will not be returning or recommending this place to anyone.

SmgOb7_fGWGuMV65YVFBoQ.text: I have been here 2 times in the last two months with my family for lunch. The atmosphere in the restaurant is awesome. I love the decor and overall feel of the business. Parking is an issue with larger vehicles but I will do what I have to do so I can get the famous chicken fried steak. As good as advertised. In my two trips to this location I have had to leave food on my plate  because I was stuffed ( this is rare). This is becoming one of my favorite stops.

IzngtGKgLZ0wAOQDM23TRQ.text: Love the food. You must save your appetite though because the portions are huge! Chicken fried steak is the bomb! Especially with their jalapeno!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aBOtz3ulwElrQ4e4T0a9nw.text: Old, eclectic, very original! BBQ was great and the prices are very reasonable. It's like going back in time to a place you'd see on the back roads of old America only in Phoenix. The staff is friendly and warm, I will go back again.
