Ms71xZEcZuY_HzT__k8zIw.text: After all our friends had told us to try out Texaz, we finally did. We both ordered, and it wasn't bad! What they forgot to mention to us was that they all had the chicken fried steaks and LOVED them. Guess we'll have to get that next time. Very friendly staff.

SV6EKV3JSXMGG7BMhcLeDA.text: WOW, if you are hungry this is the place to come, excellent service as well as food, the chicken fried steak dinner will feed two very easily... Everything is texas size !!!

ZC8asSJ1k8IUh2jfv1t2Rw.text: If you like humongous portions amazing food, eat here. The CF Steak, CF Chicken, and (especially) CF Pork are amazing! The Prime Rib and Ribeye are also fantastic.

4cINTGVn1z4HNWjWOF__hQ.text: Soo good! The atmosphere and the service was great. The chicken fried steak is amazing!  Puts me to sleep every time. A must try.

_-QTT5DlBEhqC3tTjRc70w.text: I've been to TEXAZ grill for dinner in the past but this is the first time for brunch. Once again they didn't disappoint. There were 6 in our group we ordered:  3) Chicken Fried Goodness - House specialty - choice of tenderized beef steak, boneless chicken breast or boneless pork loin chop, double dipped, fried, and covered with cream gravy. Served with award winning mashed potatoes and gravy, corn and a buttermilk biscuit.  We tried all 3 meat types all the plates were great.  2) Biscuits and Gravy - Two buttermilk biscuits covered in sausage gravy. Great taste, fresh biscuits and plenty of sausage in the gravy.  1) Bacon or Sausage & Eggs - Bacon or hot country sausage patty with 2 eggs cooked to order & a biscuit.  Eggs cooked perfectly, great tasted sausage and fresh biscuit.

sUkZccasrffRxvZ6Tv9gNg.text: Great BBQ.  I have had the lunch pulled brisket twice.  It's served with an addicting sauce that is smokey and delicious.  You will be looking for more condiment vehicles once your tasty homefries have been snarfed.  The waitstaff is mostly female and fun.  Think saucy middle aged ladies that could probably make you blush with a dirty joke if provoked.  Let's get this straight, I did not hear a dirty joke (wanted to), so your kids are safe here.  The young humans will probably love the multitude of nick-nacks, chotchkies and regalia on the walls.  Lunch was less than $10 with H2O.

DFMVjsxBBdPcuJtBLiJR8w.text: Simply the best chicken fried steak I've ever had. Awesome for a good price.

2iDDsrhHc6PV9We0SZjArw.text: First time experience was utterly fantastic! On a friday night we were seated quickly, server was on top of her game, fried okra appetizer served promptly, warm bread with real butter, salad was refreshing (loved the minced green olives on top), T-bone steak was cooked to perfection. We were stuffed but had to try the peach cobbler pie and sundae, so glad we did! Added bonus, the owner came to our table to greet us and ask how everything was. We will be frequenting this establishment. Thanks for the delicious food and great service!

ymBdZRilRxqa4qTLEnZmzw.text: The service was great the plate sizes gets you full plate presentation was very well I  recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eSrA3kPBB7knXrWWu9RYAw.text: The so called famous chicken fried steak was too bland and mostly batter. They also ran out of BBQ ribs on a Saturday night which is apparently due to lack of planning I suppose. Price is too expensive for the quality of food.

Z3uzSyA4eR5HwVe3kBGz8A.text: This place was horrible. We are a large Hispanic family and the way we were treated, it felt as though we were in the 1960s and the civil rights movement had just ended. The waitress who took our order was rude, every little thing we asked for seemed like the biggest problem.  But the real issue was when the second waitress came and asked my husband to scoot in closer to the table because the lady behind him couldn't sit comfortable enough - mind you, said lady stopped her and told her she was fine - but the waitress insisted that he need to move to an uncomfortable position so that the other person would be better (HE WAS ALREADY SITTING WITH HIS BODY TOCHING THE TABLE)! Absolutely rude, uncalled for, and unnecessary - as clients our needs were, clearly, of less importance - which left us wondering why? From the moment we walked in, we received nothing but attitude, especially in comparison to everyone else enjoying their meals.  The food wasn't good and even if it had any goodness in it, we didn't taste it because we were beyond upset. It was incredible that there is such an atmosphere that still exist this way - we were in shock.   The most aggravating part? We were only in Phoenix for the day - we live in TEXAS! This restaurant is the most abominable example of Texas food and hospitality, if you really want something from the Texas menu then please come and eat here, in Texas - we really are a friendly state! This restaurant, in the very least, should change their name because it was nowhere close to the Texas environment - I found it an embarrassment as a born & raised TEXAN!

eDz5wS3a1SraoY0Z2s8hnA.text: Love the staff, love the atmosphere, love the coleslaw, love the biscuits, love the chicken fried steak, grilled cod (not on the menu), love this place. Parking sucks!

Tt1h1dJpbGZEtFbXcM7o5g.text: Our new favorite restaurant! The food was amazing, the staff was incredible, and there just arent enough good things to say about TexAZ Grill! My only regret is that I we hadn't  tried it sooner. Please put a location in the West Valley!!

QrDszY6VzQirnxFQygkpMg.text: Wasn't that great the steak was not seasoned the shrimp cocktail was not good either I will kit recommend this restaurant to anyone

FgPRoGRY0Injy7ZHY_Yylg.text: I have been eating at TEXAZ Grill for over 10 years and I will keep coming back. Great food, great prices, great service, great everything. The lunch specials are incredibly inexpensive. They have a kids menu, a full bar, and a hands on owner. I love to support local family owned businesses and that's what you get with TEXAZ. A great steakhouse that won't break the bank!  The only thing not great about TEXAZ is the lack of parking which can be rather tight. If you have a large truck or SUV, you don't want to park facing 16th Street, it's too tight and backing out is difficult. Park on the side of the building facing Bethany Home Rd., or in the back where large vehicles can get in and out with ease.

qpyeO3LzAaD0bA7hNLLjbg.text: Oh my Goodness! This place is a treat.  An old-school, neighborhood place to hang out.  A rustic and cozy feel where you can get the best country fried steak you will ever eat.  Order the shrimp cocktail and be blown away by the size!

Wkf18ZtakHvnR_WB1jVbQw.text: Stopped in for early dinner. Great special, service and food.  Got the bear battered cod, yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TXog3zkba-mDoLpGOIWLaQ.text: We were at Texaz Grill last night for dinner.  My friend wanted the prime rib but it was out, so he got a rib eye which he did not like, (probably because he's not really a steak eater, he said). The owner came to check on us and when he heard that, he suggested we exchange it for a 'small' CFS. I guess 'small' in Texaz means HUGE! It covered the plate and came with some delicious gravy. I'd say that was the best ever CFS. My dinner was the filet which was excellent, big and cooked perfectly.  We also had the shrimp cocktail which was wonderful too. We split the peach cobbler ala mode, which was the perfect end to my friend's birthday dinner. Prices were fair and our server was Great!  Whenever I am in the Phoenix area I will be sure to come back to Texaz Grill. I wish we had a place like this near Chicago.

vSxBB4FPJVY2cbxINtNWAg.text: This place has the best smoked prime rib! But the whole mashed potatoes and their gravy topped everything for me. It's not much to look at but the food is fantastic. The staff is great too...

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AhE_aJBh3tp0KY9nLLWnzw.text: We were staying in the Phoenix area for two months, and we came here on the recommendation of a neighbor. We waited until our very last night in the area to try Texaz, and boy, are we glad we didn't miss it. There were four of us, and we all ordered the chicken fried steak. Being a native Texan, I had to compare it to the unofficial state dish of Texas. It was hands-down the BEST I've ever eaten, and even the "small" portion was huge! The waitstaff is very friendly, and the super nice owner, Steve, came out of the kitchen to visit with us. It was a very enjoyable evening, and we will definitely go again when we're back in Phoenix.

9i02OTw9FILNEC4P1858UA.text: Not my favorite anything. Unfortunately this being our 1st time to this place we were kind of ignored. You could visually identify all the regulars by who the servers were talking to and checking on. Our drinks were not checked the entire time even when our food was served. The bathrooms are so small you have to keep the door open to bend down and grab your pants to pull them up. Literally the walls were touching my shoulders. Not a place I will be suggesting any time soon

h4o78yncrKPO9vtlWz4q9g.text: The best chicken fried steak  and my husband had the best brisket ever. It was all so so so tender and savory. It was heaven in my mouth. Last but not least, I had the pecan pie.. I had to have a second slice. I have never had better pie in my life, and I have had a lot of different pies from places knows for pie.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best chicken fried steak. So tender and easy to cut into. The mash potatoes were mind blowing, perfect texture and consistency.

9rgxTS74VKQXUmgPa-qtEw.text: My aunt recommend this place to me so my boyfriend and I went for dinner. Let me say the portions are HUGE. I barely even made a dent... Then again my boyfriend finished all his food. He got the ribeye and I had the early dinner fish. My boyfriend loved his steak and thought it was better than much more expensive steaks he has had. My fish was crispy and moist. Very yummy! Definitely come with an appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Early fish dinner
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribeye steak with mashed potatoes

_-xT7-NVuKnAYPbAzmr_yg.text: Perfect.  Authentic. Delicious. What more can you say. If you are familiar with Texas food, this joint is great.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

c-uqY5HKM7sDl5p4AM3lNA.text: They were out of prime rib so I opted for the ribeye and it was AMAZING! Come here before you drop $$$ at a fancy steakhouse!!!

A92TVm8eJNl-LeZVL_Opcg.text: Great gravy! Let's just start with that. The chicken fried chicken and the chicken fried steak are great. The cobbler is a fine finish if you have the room.

zi0FfCEraGpAlLW-6UvGNw.text: Great food and service. Went in for lunch and got the $6 dollar burger special which was delicious and a total steal. My girlfriend got the taco salad which she said was one of the best she has had.

mYxtu5Zyd-JPMsm1-AlLEA.text: TEXAZ is my local steakhouse and I finally got to try it! My brother and I arrived about 7:30p and opted to sit at the bar. The interior is awesome. Just a fun old Texas steakhouse right here in the heart of Uptown Phoenix. All kinds of crazy crap on the walls, great service, and awesome grub.  I get that parking in there is a pain but there are plenty of open spaces across Bethany on the SE corner of the intersection. When you consider how far people walk when they have to park, for example, downtown or at the Biltmore -- TEXAZ is probably actually a shorter walk from your vehicle. Just a point is all.  Anyways, the bartender (whose name I can't recall - shucks) was great. I told her it was my first time and she walked me through the menu and highlighted the chicken fried steak (their specialty) and the prime rib. I ordered the large prime rib and it was excellent. I have also tried the chicken fried steak and, while rich, it's also very good. Just all around, nothing but good things to say about TEXAZ Grill.  Plus you get little glasses for your beer. What a novelty.

RCCdUjk48ybZ6XEn2IJOAw.text: It was a great experience like always. The staff is great they treat you like family they are still serving huge portions at a great price. The birthday club gives you a free meal on your actual birthday.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Way to much food for  one person awesome  pork chop dinner big portions good food great prices

lTS2HHlYz7VPbpkveE8c9Q.text: Wanting to try something new the family and I came here one night. walking in I really had high hopes just from the decor how friendly the staff was the owner everybody kept talking to us it was great on that part just the food was not so wonderful. Heavy deep fried huge portions. As the other reviews they are known for the chicken fried steak.. it's huge deep fried and actually I wasn't that impressed it was chewy and tuff to eat.  I think my sides were just a basic iceberg lettuce salad mashed potatoes and something else I honestly don't remember. My husband had The prime rib and it was super greasy tasteless. Our son had typical corndogs.. I like food with flavor colorful not call plan one color greasy food.

tj3o_-izS__PPCrAqkWGhQ.text: What a pleasant surprise! My boyfriend and I were in the mood for fried chicken but did not want KFC or Church's Chicken so we looked up restaurants that served fried chicken. We ordered the chicken fried chicken and the chicken fried steak and they were delicious. Portions are huge and prices fit accordingly. We got take out but will definitely be back to eat in. The inside was cute and wuain

b2goi1dRU1CvliANty0eIQ.text: Omg this place is Awesome! The food was delicious. I would definitely come back. I'm from Texas and this place taste just like Texas but in Arizona. The Smoked Prime Rib was the best I have ever had. So tender and juicy. My husband said it's like butter it melts in your mouth. The Chicken Fried Steak was also delicious my husband loved it. Home cooking everything was great!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pecan Smoked made a huge difference
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That&#39;s 2 pieces of Chicken Fried Steak! Gonezoe .. had no chance

jvbe8_B74lKFqPdBB1U57w.text: First time in since the owners have changed. Very disappointed in the food - coleslaw was watery and bland, only 1 1/2 chicken fried steaks instead of 2 on the dinner.  When did that change happen??? Asked for no sides bread or salad with the $27 filet, wanted green beans and onions instead - no problem for an additional charge of $7.00 - without being told that that's what they were going to do. Onions and green beans instead potatoes and salad - really need to charge for that? So so disappointed- will not be back.

uPKxz-KTj-rTqnRMGYgwjA.text: Super disappointed,  this is my first time back since it changed owners TexAZ grill, coleslaw was watery, plates did not fit the food( I figure so it looks like more) but it was less....no butter with the potato's... no vegetable, and would not change onions for  the salad on a $27.00 filet .. Onions !!!! When asked the waitress said she assumed that we knew what we wanted. Which are in a salad.. the only thing they  would do is give us the salad and mashed potatoes that were suppose to come with it. Don't want it then, why would we want it now... No Military Discount, yet they say they support them.

FYeDbZa4dJmJMzR8dI_63g.text: My husband and I went here about 3 weeks ago after a doctors appointment and it was really good. We of course tried the chicken fried steak. It was thin and breaded and melted in my mouth. The corn, potatoes and rolls were good also. What was really nice was our waitress who was working the restaurant all by herself that afternoon treated us like we were her only customers. We will definitely be back

0HI_5VM5xfU_KruEo4xMXg.text: BASICALLY A DIVE BAR... I went there hoping for BBQ ribs but they don't have them every night and apparently they often run out if you don't come early. So I had the brisket sandwich. I don't usually care for brisket and this reminded me why, pretty much like eating to thickly sliced smoked rubber on dried out roll that had become soggy from the meat. There is little or no sauce on it and when I asked for it they literally brought me a coffee cup half full of very runny nearly tasteless red liquid. I also had a salad that I was told had olives on it but it was actually smothered in chopped green olives and I though wow if I had asked for no olives it would have been nothing but a plate of lettuce. So If you want to go to a seedy dive bar and some times I do then this is the place for you. But I don't imagine you'll see me there.

0sy7baBJIx9ZMnC8yxY4Bw.text: Decent place with plenty of seating. Menu has great options. I had a salad, prime rib and fries. Very good and fresh. Waitress was efficient and friendly.

g2t69JvYyGGPHRX9prnHvw.text: I just ordered the Salisbury Steak. I was so excited to see that on the menu. I got an undercooked burger patty with a mushroom gravy that tasted overwhelmingly like red wine. It was disgusting and I only ate 2 or 3 bites. The bartender had zero compassion that I came in starving, paid $15 with an extra salad, and left starving without eating. Didn't even ask if I liked it. It was so surprising from this place. I haven't been here un a while, and now I wil likely never come back. You guys owe me an apology, unbelievable bad food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The place I used to love..

vZwtGRa8agGqBqo88FDraw.text: My husband and I went to dinner here. It was our 1st time here. I had a steak with coleslaw and mashed potatoes and he had chicken fried steak with a salad and mashed potatoes. We loved the food and the service was great. We will definitely be back

62EAo8AnYOA4oAfkxbFfsw.text: Celebrated my birthday tonight with my wife... she had the chicken fried chicken and I had the smothered pork chop, we both had the mashed potatoes with white gravy, I had the salad and she had the coleslaw and we both had bread.... and OMG Texaz Grill never disappoints... all Texas with Old style country music playing... u are transported back in time with Huge ass portions of delicious food....

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fsV7T3T1caekE2ovzLLzDg.text: I wanted to LOVE this place based off reviews I've seen. But we went in maybe hour &half before closing but our server gave off an attitude that she was annoyed she RARELY ever checked on us but proceeds to check on the other tables that came in after us. We sat there with empty drinks through most of our dinner time even though we asked multiple times.  And I had the smoked prime rib that taste like fire work smoke  didn't taste right.  The service is what I was more upset about. First & last time. But it is a shame I wanted to LOVE this place.

MtVE2tSpuRwvhGJGExMtJQ.text: I have been looking forward to trying this place for awhile, and boy did it let down. My cheeseburger smelled like a wet dog. I kept thinking maybe my breathe was rancid from being outside in the heat, but I finally sniffed the burger, and it was the meat itself. I could not finish the meal.   I also did not like how they give you 4 chunks of potatoes instead of French fries. I rather have the fries. If there was another option, it was not shared with me.   Service was A OK. Friendly and quick.   Would not return, and hoping I do not get sick.

V-89T6FSIRQIn-Zm-LexlQ.text: They have a small menu but what ever is on there is done to perfection!  From the Texas sized country fried steak to the filet mignon everything is absolutely delicious.  Accoutrements include Texas sized homemade French fries, mash taters n white gravy, yummy corn, small salads, biscuits with butter and honey.  Add to it PEACH COBBLER and a LONE STAR BEER and you have one heck of a hearty and satisfying lunch or dinner!! Service is always friendly by a staff that has rarely changed. THAT SPEAKS VOLUMES!!! Thank you TEXAZ Grill :) You can trust me, I'm in the business ;D

56uxY8Gbmig_mLwyjisxgg.text: This place just feels good.  The menu is small, our waitress had worked there for 15+ years, and their history of relationships is all over the walls.  Now to the food: with the menu being small you know that the food is going to be good.  On the menu they also have smaller versions of each of the dinners which I think is unique as sometimes Texas style steakhouses can have huge portions.  They have good specials and a great drink selection as well!

v_GRyBrnpKYX789lzvAaGw.text: I spoke to two managers and the owner about making a reservation for Father's Day and was declined. My dad is at the Veteran's Home and requested a steak for Father's Day. Looking at available options and reviews, I chose TEXAZ based on reviews, proximity and the fact it was locally owned.   Because my Dad is in a wheelchair and my mother's vehicle will not accommodate a wheelchair, we must make transportation arrangements days in advance. It is not possible to do anything "on the fly" under his current circumstances, therefore a reservation is paramount. This was explained in detail to the manager and the owner.   I was told by the manager (Derek) that reservations were only for parties of six or more and that they couldn't take up a table (which would be needed for a man in a wheelchair) on the busiest day of their year.   The owner, passed me to the manager to explain the situation saying he was sure it would be ok.   That this situation (Dad in a wheelchair - hopefully, temporarily) would result in being declined a reservation for "taking up too much space at a table" on Father's Day floors me. We have been fortunate not to need to take up "too much space" historically, I had no idea that businesses would be so unaccommodating to a 82 year old Purple Heart veteran in a wheelchair. Neither Texas nor Arizona (TexAZ) have a reputation for treating those who have served so poorly.

D76-gSsnFaSZgLEj4IDDRw.text: ICEBURG LETTUCE SALAD...come on, Romaine has been back quite awhile.  ZER0 out of 1 -10 here.  Getting cheap.

MD8qSjD7uLVby8c3_RKfQg.text: What a wonderful experience we had coming to TEXAZ Grill today for the first time. The food was outstanding and the service did not disappoint either. Our waitress Helena was an absolute gem. So sweet and polite and very attentive as we never needed refills or anything else. We will certainly be back! parking is a bit challenging but don't let that discourage you from paying this place a visit!

4Ql5PW6tyj8juuArCGVPNg.text: Food was great! The waitress we had was probably one of the best I've had in Arizona. You just don't find that good of service anymore. The interesting thing about the food is it doesn't looks that colorful or fancy as the new and up coming places, but the taste is great. It's simple and simple works for this place. If it isn't broken, then don't fix it. I heard that the place got a new owner recently, but it doesn't look like he changed anything. I would say anybody in Arizona has to try this place at least once. I lived here my whole life and I just tried it for the first time and I regret that I didn't try it sooner.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Steak

7hrqGM2DvRgRrp5UhjcFgw.text: TexAZ Grill does one thing & does it well: STEAK. (Actually, they'll cook yours to order, not just well.)   You'll get a reasonably priced, delectably tender portion of your favorite cut of meat. Their mashed & baked potatoes are good, so is the coleslaw. Salads are lackluster, mostly iceberg lettuce, cardboard-like tomatoes, served as a vehicle for the dressing. But you don't go to TexAZ for rabbit food, you go for meat. And Texas beer.   Best steak within 20 miles.   Used to be the best deal around, too, but as of mid-2008, prices have been raised - plan on $20+ per person if you want a meal and a beer, $14-17 per person if you just drink water.

9KT87J_Vnssv8s2Fjf52rw.text: took my parents there last nite  for dinner  and its the first time they experienced a MULLIGAN cut   prime rib   they could not beleive the size of the cut of meat   cooked perfect smoked lightley and the sides and deserts were  excellent  will always bring out of towners  here    service is the best

tdobxbybcOz6zoMKFC496w.text: Five stars?  Eek.    I dont wanna get all highbrow here, but prospective diners probably shouldnt harbor illusions about a place charging $7 for a couple of chicken fried "steaks" big enough to flop over the edge of the plate.    Neither of us finished our cow patties and we both felt a little sick afterwards. Not violently ill or anything, just that bloated, greasy feeling culminating in a concise bout of diarrhea.    The service is ok and it's cheap, but in terms of food quality, there are half a dozen better restaurants within a hundred yards of this place - seven if you count Taco Bell.

1N5HZSR2-3301LUPZH4pLw.text: Great place, great food.  There are some slight drawbacks.  The parking spots here during lunch and dinner time are a bit hard to find.  The lighting inside is too dark at times.  The staff and service are exceptional though.

DMusaSXRxNyxL6BQ5JLDJw.text: Best ribeye in the valley.  Nice and greasy.  Just the way I like it.  The mashed potatoes and country gravy are incredible.  I could drink the gravy it is so good.  The pre-meal biscuit is good too.  I have been coming here for over ten years and the servers are the same.  They are very nice and get your food out quick.  This is my favorite place to go in Phoenix.

HGInsBWus83gbKFF2ERsvg.text: A great neighborhood restaurant and bar, the staff knows its regulars and the service is very good.    Known for its chicken fried steak, the portions are enormous.  The mashed potatoes and gravy are amazing, great comfort food.  I have yet to have a bad meal there.

kBjdzRGDhvlf890Pj5_NUg.text: You will be hard-pressed to find better value in a steakhouse than this place.  We had the smoked prime rib, and it was outstanding - smoky but not overpowering, tender, juicy, and HUGE.  We also had their famous chicken fried steak, and it was tender, flavorful, and the gravy was perfect.  And it was also huge.  People complaining about the price need to get out more, because you will not find better prices than these for anywhere near the quality or quantity.  Go early if you want the prime rib; we got there before 5:30 on a Thursday and they were nearly out.  They have happy hour on weeknights with half-price drinks, I had 2 glasses of  Mondavi red wine for a grand total of 4 measly bucks to wash down the prime rib with.  A real treat; we lived in Texas for years and this place could easily compete with the better steakhouses there.

K_NfSMxCyV-arHoHndUbFg.text: This is one of those places I've had on my list for a long time. Finally, today a co-worker and I headed up there for lunch.   The parking at lunch is a little nightmarish. I finally squeezed into a space though and we went inside.  The decor has already been described by other reviewers--it's someone's idea of what a Texas themed restaurant should look like, with all sorts of license plates and other crap hung up on the walls. The inside is much smaller than I imagined it would be, but we were seated quickly by a friendly hostess so I can't complain about that.   We both had the chicken fried steak, which we had heard so much about. I thought it was okay. Not great, certainly not bad, but not really living up to the hype either. I loved the potatoes and gravy, though I have rarely met a mashed potato I didn't like. The corn was okay, and the biscuit was nothing great. That said, the price was good--$7.00 I think, and the portions were big. The service was friendly and fast.   If I worked closer to this place I would go for lunch from time to time. As it is now, I'll probably try it again to see how the barbecue rates, but that's about it. I wanted to like it better, and it was okay, but nothing special.

mKaqQmN4_dBZPebhjnvA9Q.text: Love this place.  Everything on the menu is great.   BUT,  they keep it too cold and windy in there.   The ceiling fans are set for winter instead of summer and you have to dine with cold air blowing on you and your meal.  Not good trying to enjoy the food while being made uncomfortable.

MXAF8d8HJpleMisJqzvNkQ.text: i was recommended to this place by a friend of mine who said he hadn't been here in awhile but thought it was great last time he was there. i really wish i didn't listen to him.  when my girlfriend i entered the building the first sign of this place sucking was probably the empty dining room, but it was around 8:30 so that i can understand. what i cannot understand and what was such a disappointment, was the food.   I ordered the rib-eye which on the menu said it was "Jim's special", which wasn't so special at all but ill get into that in a minute, my girlfriend ordered the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and  the brisket sand which as her entree. now, for 6 bucks i expect more than 4 tiny shrimp, but it was good so that still gets my OK.   what doesn't get my OK was the steak. my rib-eye, which was like 18 bucks, a reasonable price for a reasonable sized steak, was probably smaller than a hamburger patty and was well done when i ordered it medium. the mashed potatoes as my side i ordered double of which i wish i didn't, because it was more like double gravy, single mashed potatoes. the gravy itself tasted like it was pure lard, and i was unable to even eat it because it was just so heavy. I'm a bigger guy, i like fattening food, but that was just gross to me. my girlfriends food wasn't that much better.   when the bill came around, it was 48 bucks, which is what i left with no tip because the service was equally terrible, she was rude and acted like she wanted us gone. i have NEVER not left a tip.   i know this place has a great reputation, and that's what got me in there, but when i left i was honestly impressed by how bad that was. i almost want to call my friend that suggested this place to me and tell him he owes me 50 bucks.   not worth it, never coming back here again.

IflYeuELfTX9SDEwxpOSfQ.text: Texaz Grill is amazing! I've been dinning there since I was a child. There's no place like it in the city. The decor is very unique and not like something you have seen before if raised in phoenix. The place is always packed I've never seen it not busy. Very welcoming staff as well. They serve the best home style cooked delicious food. I usually always get their specialty the chicken fried steak. It's defiantly my favorite and the main reason I keep coming back. It's a huge helping, almost falling off the plate because it's so big and you get 2 pieces with 2 sides! They also have great BBQ, fried foods, deserts, a great wine and beer list, and so much more. If you haven't tried texaz grill you must go!

gaaXXpCKtpHLRCdt3Ht1sw.text: Hmmmm.... Think I Would Rather Suck Down Your Colonoscopy Bag?  If you are truly looking for a unique dining experience accompanied with old world business cards and lifeless animals, then you will need to try out Texaz Grill all for yourself. If you are looking for good food, solid service, and a nice atmosphere, then you probably want to avoid this strip mall hangout at all costs. If you love low-quality food, poor service, and a revolting atmosphere, then you need to steer your lifted F350 right on over to Texaz Grill.  Wow, from the moment we walked in I knew we were in for trouble ... I just didn't think it could be as bad as it actually was. This is one establishment that will leave you wondering whether the city of Phoenix mandates any sort of cleanliness or health standards. This place is dirty, vile, unkempt, and this is way before we even met our server or received our food.  Just 7:30 PM on a Thursday night, but you would have thought this place was closing up shop for the night or permanently (which wouldn't be a bad thing). Guests are sparse and the few who do remain look like they have chain smoked all of taste buds right out of their mouths. The servers give you the impression they are NOT working for tips and really make no attempt at ensuring a pleasant guest experience. The inside will remind you of a cross between a real, small town BBQ joint and a TGIFridays minus the corporate cleanliness standards. The booths are ancient, uncomfortable, and anything but clean. The walls are littered with business cards, dead animals, used hats, and license plate frames. You will want to write off all the dirt and disaster on the wall as good old Texas charm, but you will quickly realize your appetite fades as each minute passes you by.  So we arrive at our booth and are quickly greeted by our degenerate server who you would have thought was being paid by number of tables she turned over per night. She doesn't look like she wants to be there, and, frankly, neither do we. Our drinks are brought out in a timely fashion, and then she did the best she could to get us to order a quickly as possible. And, we're off....  Orders are put in for a Chicken Fried Steak and the Thursday night BBQ sampler. Our server had to check that there were any of the BBQ samplers left which should tell you that this combination was probably made yesterday and has been hanging around all day. The salad came quick - too quick. Within two minutes of ordering, I had the misfortune of choking down a brown, bland, and boring salad. Of course, nobody goes to a BBQ joint for a salad, but I think most prefer green lettuce and more than two dressing choices.  Not even ten minutes later and our entrees had arrived, and we suddenly had enough food to feed an entire homeless shelter but I have my doubts of them even touching this piss poor attempt at Texas BBQ.  Chicken Fried Steak - imagine about 1oz of beef shankle meat breaded in a pound of breading and smothered in some alien gravy. The meat was bland, veiny, chewy, and not even good enough for my neighbor's dog. You get two of them and each one will be bigger than your head, but I'm not really sure what you are supposed to do with them because they are anything but edible.  BBQ Sampler - I would have rather have sampled what was soaked up in the dirty bar rag or growing out of the rug. The ribs were too fatty and smothered in the generic BBQ sauce that made this place famous. The brisket was boring and overcooked. The Texas fries were not fries, nor were they good. The sausage was edible, but more so in a comparative way. Even the bread was terrible.   The food can be summed up as atrocious, inedible, poor quality, and even hard to look at. Truly some of the worst food I have ever eaten or looked at in my entire life. The highlight of the night was easily when our server seemed astonished we refused the to-go box. Sorry, but you should have been shaking our hands for even trying to make a meal out of those make-me-want-to-go-vegetarian plates of meat.   It is worth mentioning that Texas Grill does two things and two things only correctly. You will be seated quickly to ensure that the dead animals or the plethora of 1970s business cards stapled to the walls don't scare you away and the plastic soft drink mugs are gigantic, but I'm sure this was implemented to minimize server interaction with the tables.  Go grab a McRib or two before you throw away any money at this place...or be ready to pop some serious laxatives. Outside of some rough drinking nights, I have never felt the urge to vomit all over the place 15 hours after a meal. Good luck to you if you choose this place. If you do decide to go, don't forget to bring your business card - it might be old enough to go up on the wall in 2032 - that is, assuming this place is around much longer.

nFkf4t0OlV3IhSKsAOzgrg.text: This food is amazing! It's heavy but so delicious! I love chicken fried anything from here. The brisket is also so good. The Gravy is awesome. Most white gravy doesn't have a super strong taste but its definitely not bland like others have said. The best part are the lunch prices! $8 for a huge piece of chicken fried steak, mashed potatoes , corn and a biscuit! They even have lunch prices on Saturday. Yes it's cluttered but I don't rate based on decor unless its dirty which is a different story. It doesn't bother me but like I said I'm not the type of person who lets decor decide if I will return or not. The service varies, sometimes its awesome sometimes it's so so. I've never had bad service here. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was there ribeye because they dot use tenderizers or seasoning which I love but other than that it wasn't bad, I just prefer my steak seasoned and tenderized.

z3OOXeY1N7x_YsBOepCk9g.text: Got a chance to check out Texaz grill finally. Wifey has been beggin me to go here forever and I finally caved. Not sure why, I friggin love chicken fried steak. I perused the menu, but already knew I was going for the go-to dish. we also started with an order of the fried okra. Wifey got the special, which was chicken and dumplings. Little man ordered a cheeseburger. The okra was awesome! tender, perfectly seasoned and just the way fried okra should be. My chicken fried steak was HUGE, like the size of my face. Now bigger isn't always better. The steak was just okay. Somehow with all the gravy, it ws pretty bland. The steak part tasted more like liver and the breading was a bit doughy. I wasn't blown away by my meal but it doesn't matter, it was still a good experience. the service was great, prices cheap and we didn't have to drive very far. Will I go back? probably not, but definitely glad we finally checked it out.

_E6ihpX09f2Z4v-3H_gPVQ.text: Oh how I love this place. The food is fantastic and you diffently get plenty of it! This is the only place to go in Arizona for chicken fried steak. My girlfriend had the rib-eye lastnight and it was pretty good, but like I said this place is best known for the chicken fried steak and mashed potatos.

Xns7klJmRWRwTZvNfjHw4Q.text: If you have a Texas sized appetite, this is the place for you. Friendly service and eclectic decorations make it a fun family outing. The chicken fried steak and the chicken fried chicken are each enough to feed an army. They are both delicious though, especially with mashed potatoes. The okra is also great to start with. Their chicken kabobs are moist and tender, an alternative to fried food. With texaz, Sharing is caring. Not for dieters!

jyiVoR53IGSu0dH3KxWK1A.text: Although I'm new to Yelp I'm a Veteran at TexAz grill.  When I'm craving a CFS this is the only place to go in the Valley.  Heck the last time I even had Chicken and Dumplings and it was great as well.

pXJDKOab0wOs4BDCDKJ23Q.text: Great food and service here but parking is a bit of a pain. Hubby got the chicken fried steak, he said it was quit possibly the best he ever had. I got the chili, it was delicious even though no beans are added. I also got their coleslaw, that was delicious too. It was a bit noisy here not sure if it always is this way but the food was worth it. Our waitress Helen was the bomb! She has it going on, I would highly recommend sitting in her section!!

qyfcYT7KnH2Jq1K3DY1e8g.text: Huge portions (always a plus) and pretty good food.  Definitely worth the trip considering the lack of 3+ star restaurants in the Valley.

OQ2t8iF7UiwXRc07rmjPlw.text: Ok..I've been here 2 or 3 times and what I like the best is their atmosphere. My home is Dallas and so much of Texas is in this joint. The owner has lots of ties to Texas and it's a joy to speak with him especially the stories behind the pictures. I have always ordered the same dish, chicken fried chicken which is delicious except for some reason the gravy tastes a bit off, can't explain it.  So, what keeps me coming back, the atmosphere...next time I must try another dish and report on it.

b4mFpqnvVQeo6XokfHnEZg.text: Love Texaz Grill. Comfort food. Tonight they have frog legs! Sitting at the bar with Tammy is a hoot!  .

Dol5khnz91Q7xxn46FmK_A.text: The chicken Fried steak is out of this world. Absolutely delicious a nice place to get together with friends, enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RyJkZPvFfbJYAIQe2gHrmg.text: A great grill with incredible food at very reasonable prices. The Pablo battered shrimp are great! The smoked prime rib is incredible. Would recommend anyone passing through Phoenix be sure and stop here!

AB4qdYvirRxOvfLn1m9eWA.text: Very good food good service big servings.  Had the hamburger best burger in town!  Chicken fried steak is amazing!

tr4b4ISnSB-SXhNspTG7IA.text: Pros:  I think the food is great. It is a very meat and potatoes type spot.  Service is always good to great.    Cons:  Parking is challenging - There just isn't enough of it.  And the design of that parking lot I will say causes issues. Decor is old style Texas bbq house type thing. I think it is a bit dated.  But I come to a restaurant to eat and the food is great.    Come try it - doubt you'll be disappointed.

9rl7Yr74GwbS_Nl4Q0iO2A.text: We had the chicken fried steak. We have enough leftovers for at least one meal maybe two. Service was excellence. We Will probably come back one more time while we are visiting.

N4nElCLbH6wvjRLyOB2T3A.text: What a great find.  I now know what chopped steak should taste like. I did have to embrace that it was ok to be a little greasy. Once I did, there was no holding me back!  I added sauteed mushrooms to it.  Yum! The mashed potatoes were also delightful.  Great flavor.  Our service was fantastic.  Everyone was very friendly and personable. Thank you Texaz Grill!

fTjbY1ZBdQ0X38Zd95e5uQ.text: Living in New York city for so many years I would chuckle over tourists. Just standing abruptly in utter fascination, usually in the middle of the sidewalk, blocking commutes in Times Square. In the office we would chalk it up to visual overload.   So when I walked into TEXAZ Grill and behaved similarly I laughed at myself. Opening the doors to this restaurant was unbelievable. Memorabilia from the Great State of Texas. Covers. Every. Square. Inch.    Neon lights greeted me.  "Texas!" (Also neon shapes of Texas were everywhere.) An old school juke box. Beer signs galore. Guitars hanging. A giant gull head. Horns. John Wayne behind the bar. "Happy Birthday Texas!" The best collection of inappropriate stickers *ever*. License plates of every state covered the bar. The collection has been cultivated over 28 years by the the owner and patrons. (Tip: When you go, feel free to bring stuff in!)  Anyhoo, stuff. My eyeballs were full. Finally I made it to the bar and met Tammy. (A hoot who has worked here 18 years!) After inquiring where I was from, a peppy response, "Well, welcome to Texas!" (And so I fell in love with this place. Before food even factored into the equation.)  ENTREES So the food... A tad concerned there wouldn't be a healthy option to consume I was incredibly wrong. (Plenty of non-fried options!) The ribeye steak was to die for. (Perhaps the mashed potatoes with gravy were necessary to consume. But I just had to try them!)   The meat was prepared to the exact pinkness level requested. I can't even describe the level of food happiness that transpired that night. The meat was just so tender. I had made the mistake of noshing on the spicy hot peanuts available on the bar, as well as eating my way thru the delightfully prepared coleslaw that accompanied the meal.  Amateur hour. Yes, definitely eat the coleslaw. It was flavorful and not too heavy in mayo. (Or try the salad with the blue cheese. Wonderful chunks of cheese.) But leave space for your meal!  As I wasn't dining solo I had the opportunity to sample a burger. Holy bejeebers. This isn't a frou frou burger. This is a simply prepared burger, sans grease, on a beautiful bun with high quality meat.   DESSERT We earned a bread pudding! One second and I'll explain how. Tough decision as to what to pick but we went with the french bread in an egg custard with toasted pecans & raisins. Why? It was topped with a bourbon sauce! Dense and delicious. Served as described. Warm. Mmm mmm mmm! Biggest scoop of ice cream too!  CLEAN PLATE CLUB Clean you plate at lunch and get one punch. Two punches for dinner. EIGHT punches equals ONE dessert! How sweet is that? :)  HH Mon-Thur 3-6pm 1/2 bottled beer Wine by the glass All well drinks  As they say there "It doesn't get any better kids!"  We loved sitting at the bar for dinner! Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar!
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coleslaw!
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribeye!

mRO9aw9soyZrenI3gUmyjw.text: Best chicken fried steak, I have ever had! My family and I all had steak and it was amazing. Definitely will be back!

EhfHDLnOOzThFSpbajYqlg.text: Quite simply the best god damn chicken fried steak west of the Mississippi Rover.  Side note the ice cold beer mugs make me feel like I have hands the size of Andre the Giant.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Andre the Giant is here

ACjy6Sy7yuPbnsVwjTQs2w.text: Boyfriend and I were in the hunt for the perfect steak as I am a carnivore, and this place has it! Since finding this gem we have gone back every Friday with no fail! To the point that we made a very special friend named Susan. She is hands down the best server. She knows our orders like the back of her hand which makes our dining experience extra special and convenient. She's very attentive and friendly. We always ask for her!   As for that steak I was mentioning.. it is to no surprise that it's their smoked prime rib. I've been to plenty and I mean PLENTY of restaurants and none of them can compare to the flavor, the size for the price and the tenderness! The sides are also amazing like their mashed potatoes and the new mac and cheese. Yum!  The boyfriend have always enjoyed their battered cod and Texas fries.   All in all this restaurant has a nice and friendly vibe from the decors to the servers and of course the superb food. Two thumbs up!

nLpif75uU0WNFzCTAwZwPA.text: Very good food! The decor is very busy with a cluttered distracting allure. Kind of a dive bar type ambiance.

yJCO7ODscRrXUaSlZTEvgg.text: I seriously cannot think of a reason to deduct a star from Texaz. It's about as authentic as you can get without going back in time.  The food is consistent and delicious. I'm a purist so I used to order the chicken fried steak but have since broadened my horizons and have started ordering the chicken fried chicken which is, in my opinion, better. I also really appreciate the fact that they started offering half orders because their regular portion sizes are ginormous (though the leftovers are also delicious).   This is probably one of my more boring reviews because I don't have anything to snark about with Texaz.  I actually joined their email list just because they seem like nice people and I'd like to hear from them more often.  Their food also cures all hangovers and it is the absolute perfect place to go on Sunday night after a long weekend of liver damage in Vegas (learned this last weekend). Five Stars.

MONk7VoVVKmEbdKC2TXHjA.text: It's like you stepped out of Arizona and right into Texas. This spot has been in the valley for 30 years and has not wavered. Best chicken fried steak ANYWHERE. And if you want a steak cooked to perfection without an inflated price, look no further. And a cold bottle of Shiner Bock? Yes please.   There were 6 of us and we sampled the bread pudding, hot fudge sundae, and peach cobbler. Yummy - don't overlook the desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Step off the sidewalk into Texas

CPl-DlSa6KPMiMrLeo9ngQ.text: Great comfort food. Highly recommend the chicken fried steak and pecan crusted catfish. Don't miss trying their unique bread pudding. It is the best you will ever eat!

iiFlnXJIpTJcZLly9Pu66Q.text: 1st timer about a couple weeks ago. Went with a party of 7, which included some real "Texans." :) Had the chef's special, steak and shrimp with artichoke. Great portions! Will take the mashed potatoes over their country potatoes (or Texan potatoes). Great server, great atmosphere. No wait whatsoever on a Friday afternoon. I loved it, can't wait to go back.

kGAlUOZ5EZHcWmqrm9yDog.text: Great food and great service every time! Excellent specials huge and fantastic Chicken Fried Steak! I also love their fried okra! Yum!

K7VQHpYj6d_vNNTnXTKTqw.text: This place is spot on!  Great service, salad and the chicken fried steak is out of this world!  We are here from Texas and have certainly had our fair share of excellent chicken fried steak, this place does it right!  Huge servings and incredible flavor!  Give this one a try!  You won't be disappointed!

jDvHWC4FX6nqs8-Y5Mr2tQ.text: If you are a person like me who likes a lot of variety this is NOT the place for you.. 3 different items I wanted they ran out of and what they did have was not that great.  I ordered the prime rib sandwich which was more more that 4 strips of prime rib placed on top of a French roll which tasted like onion because they put a giant thicker slice of onion under it. The mashed potatoes were okay nothing g special. We also ordered the frito pie. It was nothing more the a tiny bag of Fritos with a small amount t of chili dumped inside. Will never go back

hzywc5GxiA4vrfZ-ncwiVQ.text: Easily one of the best Chicken Fried Steaks in the Southwest.  Save yourself a trip to Texas and go to TEXAZ.

iZbJNODUYi8e44AD63wTWQ.text: If you want the sweetest waitress in the entire world, just ask for Helena!   I stopped in tonight for the first time since the restaurant changed ownership about a year ago, and I can confirm that the food is still just as delicious as ever. The recipes have not changed. I'm so glad - no need to mess with a good thing. My only problem was not enough room for the Clean Plate Club!

-wGs1JCek94kYIlmdc5W1g.text: Probably the 6th time I've come here, TEXAZ grill offers consistently good food, service and a fun ambiance.  Every time I visit, we always see something we didn't notice before and strikes up some unique conversation.  I always (and probably forever) order the Chicken Fried Steak!  It tastes homemade, savory and satisfying.  Imagine a huge portion and then double it - that's TEXAZ for ya.  You're lucky to eat half of the dinner portion, but the price can't be beat.  A great stop for a casual lunch or dinner.  The wait staff here is sweet as pie!  Bonus is they always offer you some extra gravy for your leftovers!!!

AkHjD8v4ByBp_hDpA_zj0g.text: I used to really love this place. But, after not having been here in years, I was really disappointed with the food. Maybe it's just my taste buds that have changed, or maybe it's because it's under new ownership which probably means new cooks and new standards.  Judging from a few of the other reviews, perhaps I'm not alone in my lack of enthusiasm.   Everything was cooked well and nothing was burnt, but I was expecting more of a kick from the dishes, I guess. My wife actually loved her pork chops, finding them juicy and nicely done. But, she did admit that the southern fried pork chops she makes have a zestier batter with more black and cayenne pepper. My catfish was rather plain, however, and I wasn't a fan of the potatoes. I was expecting fries and out came these weird potato hunks with no flavor.   Oh, and the salads, the salads were these pale dishes of ice-berg lettuce. I love salad, but I couldn't finish it.   As with other visitors at this place, we also hated the parking, but I was not surprised at that.   In the words of Marvin Martian: Where's the Kaboom? There's supposed to be an Earth Shattering Kaboom!  The must have put it where they hid the pepper shakers.

Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Catfish and Potatoes

75rHsuAAo6txfB8sWuEVyQ.text: Friendly atmosphere and Cindy was great with recommendations. Had the chicken fried steak, which was perfect. The lunch portion is all I needed. Washed it down with bread pudding and ice cream. Happy camper.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Steak....OMG.... good..... the mash potatoes, seasoning, buttery corn, and biscuit were amazing. A must have.

2Xf5nn9-X0LEaBydMRu4EA.text: Today was my free birthday lunch. I had an extremely rare rib eye and Julie had the massive chicken fried steak. It was pretty quiet the day after Thanksgiving. Service is excellent. Limited beer menu. Great desserts We live on the west side so only come over for special events. Great decor. Its too bad they took the vintage fishing lures of the mirror in the mens room. Guess they got stolen. It was pretty unique

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rib eye
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak

FNTk4qk71eg6K-a4B07WZA.text: I was introduced to this place years ago by two good friends that are regulars. I have not been back until two relatives from the Midwest were craving a down low place for a good steak *boom it clicked. From the outside to the inside you are in dive city but inside it is one of those places with everything stuck to the wall, every square inch and it's kind of cute. Service was good can't complain and when we were ordering I decided to go big or go home (chicken fried steak) when our server asked if I wanted a full order or a half order I was like "pssssh I'm a grown man give me a full!" OMG when it came out it was an unassuming huge piece of CFS with delicious gravy and flavorful potatoes and I wasn't paying attention until my friend looked over and said "there is another huge piece under that one" upon inspection I had an entire meal under my meal = full order. Half of it was just as delicious reheated the next day. Huge portions, unpretentious and a delicious ultimate splurge! Friends liked the steak, next time I want to try the chicken fried chicken or fried shrimp.....we will see if I am man enough again for a full order!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak !
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmmm!

8RjqS-aqrZNQ57quThYbmQ.text: We thought we'd try this place again after hearing the restaurant is under new ownership. The majority of us ordered our usual chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes and corn topped with a biscuit. My son opted for a cheese burger and fries, talk about playing it safe.   The chicken fried steaks, while heavy on the breading, did not disappoint. A slight crackle was present when cutting the steak with my fork. The potatoes I thoroughly enjoyed. Skin on mashed are my fav. Slightly chunky provided enough proof they were actual potatoes and not some powdered imposter. The corn, well, it was corn.   I blinked twice and my sons burger was gone. So no complaints there I guess. All in all, the quality remains the same while noticing a slight increase in prices in some items.   One drawback was we noticed the complimentary pre meal donut thingies were no longer.  That might have pushed this review over the top.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xTKHUPU4ghMbQbJ-NadV4g.text: I think this is our third time here.  We know a few people who always rave about this place, and we keep thinking maybe it will get better.  Maybe we were there on an off night.  But I must conclude after this visit that this isn't really the case.  Some folks clearly do love it, but I am totally underwhelmed.  Our table this time ordered the southern pork chop, chicken fried steak, chicken fried chicken, and smoked prime rib.  Some of this we had previously, some was new.   First the chicken-fried steak.  I believe I commented last time that it was mostly breading, and not very flavorful.  That is still the case.  Without the gravy it has no flavor at all.  I would expect some from the breading, but it just wasn't there.  Denny's makes a better one.  I am not kidding.  The southern pork chop is basically a chicken-fried pork chop.  This one was pretty good because there was more meat than breading, and so I could taste the pork.  The breading and gravy worked well with it, but it was still lacking any real flavor to distinguish it from other restaurants.  The chicken-fried chicken was similar to the pork.  More meat, and you could taste the meat, but the "chicken-fried" aspect is totally lacking.  The smoked prime rib was easily the best dish we ordered.  The au jus was a bit salty, but it was a very smoky and flavorful hunk of meat.  Portions are reasonably large, though for some reason they have reduced the size of their plates.  We compared to our old photos and it was obvious.  Seems silly to me to cram the same amount of food onto a smaller plate.  The "fries" were actually large chunks of potato that were not seasoned in any way.  The outer bit was fried, but the rest was like a baked potato.  The mashed potatoes were just mashed.  No garlic or anything.  The cajun seasoning on the table helps.  And the salads were not very popular among those who ordered them.   So all in all a very expensive, and very disappointing dining experience.  We have their punch cards, and they're half full.  But we have no plan to return and so will likely just toss the cards in the trash.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southern pork chop

HQcWIQeCWMuyUhSlLgLRAg.text: Haven't been back since the new ownership and I am happy to report still as good as always  they now have early dinner specials all for $9.99 I had the Salsbury steak nice thick 8 oz patty topped with mushrooms gravy yum.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salisbury steak
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Early dinner specials

aIvzKElFE2AJOgY9RZD3Lw.text: What a great find!    I was in the area visiting friends and we talked about getting a chicken fried steak.   This place appears to have been around a long time. I started with a house salad...nothing special but was a nice serving. The lettuce was crisp and it had ample tomatoes. Next was the chicken fried steak that was breaded perfect and a very large portion. It was served with real mashed potatoes and everything was covered in white cream gravy.   I felt like I was in my hometown enjoying a lifetime favorite meal!    I'll definitely be back if ever in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PcUtIJ78kNvJUIMLCLFTNA.text: Always a great experience here. Great service and the food is beyond expectation. Had few items off menu and all were perfect to my taste buds:)

_D6J8zg9yhPwL6I8DwPrGA.text: Yummy yummy good home cooking.. Huge portions.. so satisfying..When you crave that home cooked style dinner this is the Place to come and Feast...I really enjoy coming here and filling my belly up with love.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac Longhorn Cheese
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House Specialty Chicken Fried Steak

ytF_NiiDssSQnMxUzZn_og.text: Found this little gem on Yelp. I LOVE a good country fried steak, so I had to try it. Came in with my family and were promptly greeted and were seated within 5 mins. Loved the fun decor. Our server Devin was very friendly and explained the menu to us when I mentioned it was our first time here.  Our drinks came out promptly followed by our salads and BISCUITS! It was love at first bite BEST buttermilk biscuits hands down!  Pros: Friendly & prompt service (always important)  Delicious biscuits w/real butter AND let's not forget the star of the show... BEST Country Fried Steak I've ever had.   OH and the portions were huge!!!   Cons: I couldn't bring my left overs because we're staying at a hotel  We will definitely come back on our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Country Fried Steak Plate - HUGE portion &amp; Delicious
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buttermilk Biscuits w/real butter

uqOeqvHgyru6_kWsK7vcXQ.text: FOOD: I always get the chicken fried chicken and it's the best I've ever had! The dinner portion is twice the size and is fairly reasonably priced! The side salad is also really good, it's very basic but delicious. The biscuits that come with the meal are also quite tasty!   AMBIANCE: very old timey Texas feeling! Nothing fancy!  SERVICE: service is also good, people are very friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jzMxSDE_n-EhsVGwkCloCA.text: The place is a classic. The chicken fried steak is larger then the plate and mashed potatoes are terrific. A fun place to eat with so much fun stuff on every wall.  You won't go away hungry and you can even wash it down with a bottle of the classic Texas Shiner beer!

v25E7bXlkQEF4pHo5w1e6w.text: We have been back twice now and have not been disappointed. Chix Fried Steak is fantastic but, our new favorite is the Pecan Smoked Prime Rib! The strong smoky flavor is crazy good and the cook is perfect! Now, that smoke flavor is strong and may not be for every one but, it hits the spot for our crew. The Ribeye is a great alternative to the prime rib. A good sear and nice marbling makes this steak juicy and delicious as well.  Service was fast and friendly everytime too.  This is now a regular stop for us, especially when out of town guests want to hit some place local.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6Q0byj-xF0kE0-p8JSe4gw.text: The good: The ambiance is crazy.  I love the signage and just overt nuttiness of the decor.  They are cool with wee ones and accommodated nicely.  Huge drink portions for both alcoholic and ice teas.    The average:  The steaks and prime rib are on par with sizzler.  No worse no better.   If I need steak sauce it's never better than average.    The rib eye I had was a thin cut, which is hard to cook medium so I had to return it because it was cooked well.  No big deal they handled beautifully.   The biscuit and wheat bun were standard fair and neither were warm. I do like it when a place drops free bread on your table regardless.   The bad:  The salad.    Awful.  Wilted lettuce is the worst.   Also it was drowned in dressing.  I couldn't eat it  So here's the scoop.  I would eat here again, for a hamburger and fries.  The atmosphere and wait staff were great. We had Mary and she was on point with refills and checking in.  Plus we had a two year old and she was great.

Lo-tngYvh8Ho7RMXAWZdQg.text: This is not the place to drive to in your truck.  The parking in the front is very congested.  The sign says there's parking in the back but I don't know if it is any better.  Ordered the chicken fried steak.  It comes with mashed potatoes, corn and gravy.  The chicken fried steak was pounded thin and the breading wasn't overly thick.  The gravy is ok but then I'm not particularly fond of white gravy.  Potatoes were potatoes and corn was corn.

npJNJv4M5t9VX76dkaz6hw.text: Everyone I talk to knows Texaz, and everyone loves something different on the menu. For me, it is the chicken fried steak and mashed potatoes. Crispy batter on a HUGE portion of beef and peppery gravy on the perfectly lumpy mashed potatoes makes me feel so good.

dtCjCqlZ4FKqlOChcYc00A.text: Unfriendly management and mediocre food.  Don't bother with this place. Plenty of places have the same food served better and cheaper. Fred P, Certainly didnt mean anything personal dear. My exchange with the manager was unpleasant to say the least. Just voicing my opinion, do you find all criticisms suspect and suspicious?

JHTfGbY4toeM8axnjm8JCw.text: This is my favorite !    I mean it.  I always bring out of towners here.  Go for lunch, which is served until 4pm.  It's hard to beat the price for lunch.  And, you may have a tough time eating it all.  If you happen to stop by between 3pm and 6pm, it's happy hour.   The servers are nice and friendly.    I'm glad I do not live close to this place... .. .. .. .. .. OOOooooooooo it's so good.

yKDDx3tynL_N-isHqeqQIg.text: Um......I've been coming here since i was a child. I still love coming to this amazing establishment.  If its not business cards or trucker hats hanging from the ceiling that get your attention. Then its the amazing Chicken Fried Steak you can get there!!!!! If you have friends from Texas visiting Az. Definetly take them there......They will love it!!! hahha...

-2q40vOLW_GwNbGqvSCUyQ.text: I was in town for one night and stumbled upon The Texaz Grill online.  The planets must have been aligned just right because I had a great meal.  I ordered the Rib eye with mashed potatoes and a salad.  Everything was very tasty and filling.  I highly recommend this place.  The staff was friendly and efficient.

nBn7cTyXLUViksgFDyF43A.text: This place is consistently good. I don't think I have ever had a bad meal here. The chicken fried everything is pretty tasty along with the club that has brisket on it. I try to go here at least a few times a month for lunch.

xhwwxhY9cPUiA9OR9oQZhw.text: My first time here. We went for Father's Day. The food was good and plentiful, none of us could  finish our meal! But this place gets 2 stars for the service and experience. I was there for 5 minutes and our server spilled a huge cup of water all over my dress. I was soaked, embarrassed, and cold. An accident, yes, but she's (and I) lucky it was just water. Even more so, lucky I had just put my phone and away and moved my dad's present. My dress would've been ruined. When we told the manager at the end of our meal, she just said "oh, I'm sorry." Really? Just sorry? No compensation? I sat here soaking with wet underwear until I dried and you're sorry? LOL. A GOOD manager would've immediately offered something - anything! On top of that, I think our server was deaf. Seemed to ignore us half the time. Again, food was decent but the manager's reaction sealed the deal on my choice to return. You suck, lady.

7eeVzaIlPhANliPDA1iw2w.text: Let's start with, cutting a potato into eight parts, does not french fries make.  I'm not sure about all the hype for this place.  Last night I went and we both had the "special."  It was a New York strip, two Gulf shrimp, artichoke hearts, "fries", and rubber sauce.  (can't remember what they called it)...but the whole way home we kept saying, how do we get this taste out of our mouths?  Not exactly my idea of a good way to leave a restaurant.

bBBVljMPrwCvus-EIBR0aw.text: I was looking forward to trying this place for a long time.  The reviews on Yelp were good and I was told by a fellow steak lover that if I wanted a great (not the best) cut of steak at a reasonable price, then Texaz is the place to go.  I went on a Thursday evening and the place was pretty busy.  I was seated right away by a very friendly hostess.  You could tell from the looks of the place that it had been around a while.  I could have sworn my booth was going to fall apart, but it was ok.  The decor is a bit eccentric with anything and everything having to do with Texas all over the walls.  All the patrons seemed to be having a good time and enjoying their meals.  There were also plenty of wait staff bustling around.  While everything on the menu sounded delicious (but NOT diet friendly), I opted for the filet.  Next time I am going to order the prime rib or the chicken friend steak because I hear those are excellent.  My salad came quickly and was very good.  However, it was a bit odd because it contained diced green olives (which I normally don't like), but I said what the heck and ate it all anyway.  I was pleasantly surprised.  When the steak arrived I was surprised again at the size.  I was expecting it to be much smaller but it was a pretty big cut.  I'm guessing around 8-10oz.  I love it when steaks are cooked in plenty of butter (gross to some people...I know) and I guess this place knew that because there was plenty of the hot, melty goodness all over the steak and plate!  It was soooo good but soooo unhealthy.  It was cooked perfectly and I ate every bite.  The potatoes were just ok but I ate them anyway.  Nothing a bunch of salt and ketchup couldn't fix.  For dessert I ordered the homemade pecan pie and it was probably among the best I have ever had.  If you are looking for an upscale steak/bbq joint then this is NOT the place for you.  If you are looking for place with some good meat with good prices and excellent service, then this is the place for you.

SbfKm66AfCt1xuflnS4j-Q.text: To start with, I'm a Texan, born and raised. I've done my share of traveling and I've lived in other places. Being new to the Phoenix area, naturally I'm always looking for comforts that remind me of Texas. I'll often be seen wearing my Longhorns or Astros caps.  I love food! I love Tex-Mex, BBQ and southern style cookin'. So I passed the Texaz Grill several times before I had an opportunity to stop in. The first time I ever stumbled upon it, I got so excited because of the name and the neon signs adorning the windows, Shiner Baby!  When I did stop in, I was in awe, not because it felt like home but because of all the things hanging on the ceiling and the walls and because of the neons inside. Everything in this place has something to do with Texas. Sweet! And they sell Shiner Bock beer!  I knocked off a couple stars because of pricing, variety and the service we got. We were seated promptly but it was pretty much downhill after that. I looked over the menu, which took about a half minute, and was shocked that they didn't even have a hamburger on it. I'd say don't go here unless you're supa dupa hungry because you're going to have to order a steak of some sort or fish or maybe pork chops (I don't remember). I wasn't starving, that's my point. And I'm not even a fan of chicken fried steak but I know a good one when I eat one and it's definitely a True test of a "Texas" style restaurant. So I order the chicken fried steak. It was very good, just what you would find at your favorite down home restaurant anywhere in Texas. It came with what they call steak fries, but they were really just big cubes of potatoes. I thought they were kinda weird and bland. You get a large portion of food, very large actually. But it seemed a bit steep, maybe I'm just cheap. Either way, I did enjoy a bottle of Shiner and the place was decent and novel enough that I will go back, if for no other reason than to sit at the bar and have a beverage. Maybe I'll run into some fellow Texans and I can share with them my wonderful experiences in this great city of Phoenix.

P3j4MWvoF6H3QB0FMnBPdw.text: My husband has been hunting for a place where he could get chicken that he liked for years. He is crazy about the Chicken Fried Chicken here.  The gravy is wonderful, not pasty and paired with your choice of mashed potatoes or their own version of fries.  He loves the mashed potatoes.  I don't care for the fries. They're good tasting chunks of potato but don't resemble fries AT ALL.  Their burger is decent but the I don't like their club sandwiches.  They used good ingredients but instead of the traditional bread in layers its all just on a french roll bun.  Last time I got the Chicken Fried Chicken sandwich and enjoyed it.  Again the burger bun its on is sufficient but for a great piece of chicken like that better buns would help.  I loved the Bread Pudding in Whiskey Sauce for dessert.  We've always gotten the same waitress and have loved her.  She's pleasant, helpful and has a great attitude.

TrkVJDzgAbRULc-1MRuQiw.text: I love this place.  My husband, daughter and I can all share one order of the chicken fried steak and still have leftovers.  Makes for a cheap dinner out.  The staff is wonderful and very good to our 3 year old.  They also have Shiner Bock Amber.  It doesn't get better than that.

ZFDXwhKjtJ8x02Dd2WFrcQ.text: I've been going to TexAZ Grill for the best part of 20 years. I really used to enjoy it - had not been there for many years and just went back last week. Most everyone at the table wasn't that happy with the food - the ribs that someone had were particularly lackluster. I ordered one of the early bird specials, a small NY with a cheese enchilada and thought it was pretty good - but at $9.50 my expectations were not real high. The service was just OK _ I had to get up to ask someone for bread plates, as we didn't have any. The biscuits (which used to be awesome) were kind of cold and hard. I'd go back one more time for sure, because my favorite is their Chicken Fried Chicken, but as I didn't order that, I would have to try it one more time before I crossed this place off of my list...it really did used to be great food with great service, but this last time, it really was just decent food with acceptable service.

OkrQ78eNTeV5tO40hc8f2Q.text: Texaz Grill was recomended to me by a friend and I was not dissappointed!  The atmosphere is that of the late 70's and it looks like nothing has been done to it since.  You get the feeling that you're eating in a roadhouse bar.  The steaks are cooked to order and you won't pay more than $20 for one either.  The portions are so generous I wasn't able to finish my meal.

lEQqxdHjkfy59gpnJR6lPg.text: This is the ONLY place to get Chicken Fried Steak! The portions are HUGE so bring your appetite. The pulled pork is good too! Just took some visiting friends this last week and it was delicious as always. They loved it. These guys are very consistent and the service is excellent! The have a cool little bar too. Not really for families... this is for the grown-ups!

7GgEhNGjE2oY4J1e2wZTbw.text: Have to agree with Timmy... located just off the 51, it does have a Roadhouse feel to it...  Haven't been there for dinner, but the combination Texas/Arizona (hence the name) cuisine is pretty good fare...

e3BNU5T9vbXZoXLPBgXHCA.text: Atmosphere - great. Service - terrific. Food - blah.  I had the chicken fried steak, it was bland as hell and horrifically greasy. My wife had the chicken kebab - it was at once overdone and yet smothered in butter, apparently to moisten it back up.  If you are at all health-conscious, try another restaurant. If you are from Texas or just like bland, fried food with good beer, this is your place.

qnEKQR-rUTLh0RLDGmcYKw.text: We  had read some very positive reviews about this place in Yahoo Travel.  What a great place to visit!  The chicken fried steak was huge and delicious! Outrageous portions!  A perfect place to hit after a day of Spring Training baseball.

J__jUNGw9WahnI9WkGbgaQ.text: being a carnivore, this is my kind of place...  had the combination plate of ribs and brisket, bbq'd... more food than I should of had at that time of nite.. had to eat it all.... my bad..  will return again and again as long as it doesn't change..

EnokLtJYNafKJROf1rlXVw.text: I went here tonight after hearing good things about the place. I was very disappointed. The food servings were large but the food itself was not very good. The Chicken Fried Steak had no real taste at all. It was just bland. The pork chops were good but not great. Salad just a salad and the bread was cold. I do not think I will be going back after spending $46 dollars for so-so food. Very disappointing.

kWcAiMpIB2oZ3O_hwwyGxA.text: Parking here can be a pain but once you get inside you can have the best Chicken Fried Steak you will ever have. I have driven by this place for years and everyone I have talk to said its great. Not sure why it took me so long to eat here but I will go here every time I'm in the mood for chicken fried steak. The place has a small menu other then that its your average bar. Dart boards, bar, tables, restrooms, but they have freakin UNREAL CHICKEN FRIED STEAK. My girlfriend got the chicken friend chicken and it was good, and it was a huge portion as well but its not as good as the steak. Either one of these dishes can feed two people easily. There was nothing else on the menu I would go back for which is kind of good cause when I go here I already know what I'm getting. They have thousand of business cards that customers have placed all over the walls and celling. Looks cool, but this place could use a dusting! 3 stars but they get a 4th for that Chicken Fried Steak!

w3cek_B6HdazPTgvmOKJKw.text: Having lived in Texas for years, we tried this last night now that we live in AZ, and I'm pregnant and wanted smoked red meat. Got the smoked brisket sandwich with texaz fries and hubs got chicken fried steak & fries, kids got chicken fingers & grilled cheese. We finished off with the bread pudding. The brisket had a good flavor, wish it had more smoke ring and more sauce, but that's just a preference. Hubs chicken fried steak was amazing. We both tried our daughters mashed potatoes & wished we got those! The texaz fries were also great, but the mashed were amazing. And the chicken tenders were real chicken, hand dipped & fried. Definitely good breeding a and biscuits, totally homemade. For anyone wanting Texas comfort food, I would recommend it. The service was wonderful also. Wish the hats weren't dusty, Rhys my only gripe. Dusty hats hanging over my food doesn't say yum. But, sit in the middle of the restaurant and it won't bother you.

6Sco34nm1Gj7L3JVO1ZKig.text: mmmmm ... steak.  Not just steak ... reasonably priced steak, all set in a hillbilly/Texas setting.

ftNkXWWuKvWl2FLPNWAJjw.text: Went back recently, and it was just as good, if not better than I remembered.  I was too long in Las Vegas.  Price, portions and service are all excellent.  I just wish I lived closer.

VCj6L8fWyf7Lo69MBpsA6Q.text: My Dad and my brothers are big steak eaters. Me? Not so much. So when we came here a few weeks back I hoped the reviews lived up to their hype. Not at all. First, it was a Saturday night at 7 p.m and the place was nearly empty.  My New York strip steak was bland. The fried potatoes are huge, plain and flavorless - no seasoning whatsoever. Everyone else thought their prime rib and steaks were boring and average. The martinis? Microscopic. Hanny's style. I couldn't decide which were smaller. Hanny's or Texaz?  I think the three stars I'm giving is really generous, but the atmosphere here rocks (you find something new on the wall every time) and our server had an awesome attitude and handled our 7 person party professionally. I may or may not be back.

seX90s4kmEXBNwY7Px7ahw.text: My old man always said if you wanted to get rich you'd buy a Texan for what he was worth and sell him for what he thought he was worth. That about summarizes my feelings about TexAZ Grill. This is the most overrated place I've been to in a while.   I'd never been to TexAZ before today because I always seem to crave chicken fried steak for breakfast, and the place doesn't open until 11:00 a.m. Well, today I was craving chicken fried steak for lunch, so I thought I'd try out TexAZ out.
