Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qYy_Q6e8aQzZ2qDzQGKeWQ.text: Came here on the spur of the moment while deciding what to eat on a weekend night. It is a very cluttered looking restaurant. There were so many road signs and posters on the wall, I'm really not sure what color the walls were.   The service was excellent which is why this review is getting 3 stars instead of 2. Our waitress was friendly and quick.  I had high expectations about this place and unfortunately it just did not live up to it. I just found everything to be very bland. Maybe I've been watching too much Chopped but I just expected the food to be better seasoned. Both my wife and I were using a lot of salt to add some flavor to the meals. Not sure I would go again unless someone tells me the food has improved.

Wu5NYNSFTw2CYNSfZ_iNTA.text: Came here with the family not too long ago. The food is pretty good, probably not enough to pick coming here over bobby Q's unless we dont want to make the drive but its good. Service was very friendly and made you feel like you're home which is nice.

XKL9yIAutMrQc0jJ76E-ZQ.text: Nope, nope, nope.  I came here on the recommendation of other fellow Yelpers and I am so disappointed.  Firstly, parking is a mess.  Next, I came with my husband and two year old daughter and the hostess told me that they don't have a high chair that can accommodate a two year old so she had to use a booster seat.  The problem is that she's at that middle age where she's almost done with high chairs and still too immature for a booster seat.  What a mess trying to keep her in her booster seat and contained.  She wasn't noisy or badly behaved, per se, she just wanted to stand up in the booth and look around and fidget with all the condiment bottles on the table.  Also, can I mention that the booths have a weird half wall that obscures the other diners from the chest up, but is open from the chest level down, so someone in the other booth could easily reach underneath the wall and dig around in your purse if they wanted to, or your two year old can peek underneath the booth wall to play peek-a-boo with the diners on the other side?  It's pretty weird.  So the waitress came over took our drink orders with a minimum of small talk (or overall friendliness).  We perused the menus.  My husband chose a beef brisket sandwich.  I wanted a t-bone steak, I had been craving one and I was looking forward to it.  We ordered our dinners and it's worth mentioning that at NO point did the waitress acknowledge that presence of our daughter.  She never asked us what she wanted to eat or if she needed anything to drink either, apparently she was invisible.  Seeing as how there weren't any kids meals on the menu, I just assumed we'd feed her from our own plates, but interestingly the waitress just assumed that too because she didn't even ask if she'd be having a side order of something as her meal,  She just looked right past her.  If I sound pissed it's because I was.  I don't need the waitress to pinch her cheeks and make baby talk with her, but to merely acknowledge the fact that there were three human beings sitting at the booth that night would have been covered in 'Basic Manners 101'.  So my steak was very flavorful and tender but BADLY undercooked, terribly fatty and a sickly color gray.  (It didn't have a nice sear or a good caramel color to it.)  I ordered it medium rare, but instead I got bloody, almost blue meat.  And there was so much fat that I only got about half meat, the rest was all scrap fat and the bone.  My sides were non-descript.  I think my mashed potatoes were probably decent, I honestly can't even remember that's how non-descript they were.  The roll and bread 'basket' that came with my food (one little roll and one little cold biscuit) were hard and tasted store bought.  And my hungry toddler didn't even want them.  My husband's beef brisket sandwich was a pathetic, dried out, flavorless waste of good money.  We didn't even bother with desserts.  I had a margarita; it was very good, but beguilingly strong for how petite the rock glass is that it was served in.  After I finished it the waitress came around and asked me if I wanted another and I declined, but my husband (a non-drinker) immediately piped up and said "Yes, she'll have another!" and shot me a playful look, and rather than looking to me so see if I *really* wanted another $7 margarita or not she simply walked away and had the bartender make me another one!  WTF?  So within a couple of minutes I had yet another very, very strong margarita sitting in front of me.  Now I'm no cheapskate but I don't like to waste money so I choked down that second margarita and it was the proverbial 'straw that broke the camel's back'.  I may have finished it, but it definitely finished ME.  I spent the rest of the night stumbling and mumbling to myself about someone slipping me a mickey.  I've never, ever had a margarita that strong and I am a very well seasoned drinker.   What of Earth did they put in them??  So to sum it up I spent over $60 (includes the tip) for 2 small Molotov cocktails disguised as margaritas, an undercooked, fatty, t-bone steak, an inedible, dry beef brisket sandwich and a big serving of NOTHING for my child.    Never again.  The two stars are for the flavor and tenderness of the otherwise failure of a steak and the extreme value for your money on the alcohol.  THAT'S IT.

9_YbcT1Woil6LOcVHj0gOw.text: Great chicken fried steak! Friendly prompt service with a smile. I recommend this Texas style eatery very highly!!

h95DjVqXFNIePfdpm3P9wQ.text: Let me start by saying this wasn't our first choice. We were on our way over to The Vig (which was RIGHT next door) but had to rethink our choice considering we had our in-laws who can eat like hippos. The bro-in-law wanted meat. "Meat. I need MEAT!" was all he said when I asked him what he wanted. Fine, i'll find meat...So enters this restaurant. Really cute, dive-ish restaurant with an awfully small parking lot and equally small interior space. It's the type of joint that you would find in a cute, cozy small town where regulars flock to.   We were seated immediately and was greeted by our sweet and friendly waitress. She was attentive and quick, even though she was servicing quite a few other tables.   The food was good; very comforting and filling but nothing special. Mr and I shared the Rib Eye and the in-laws got the NY steak, each. We added their cup of chili, side of mashed potatoes with house gravy, salad, and potato wedges. They also have whole jalepenos for $.10, which we got 5 of. All in all, it was a good meal but definitely not a Mastro's or Fleming's. If you want a nice, normal dinner with no frou-frou, this is the place!

SoL4V0IeFT0E0yjqjohuxA.text: As a Native Texan, it doesn't get any better than this for Chicken Fried Steak or CF Chicken.  Portions are huge, food excellent, and Shiner Bock is the house brew.  Best of all, it's walking distance from the house.   My wife does miss the pulled pork sammiches.

xXlTwJlUcRorKUE1gNPpXw.text: This is my go to place for Chicken Fried Steak.  If you're a fan of it, you'll never go anywhere else after you've tried theirs.  IF there is a complaint, there's always too much of it.  LOL  Like that could be a complaint.  Lunch tomorrow!!  Room mate had some fried fish dish (probably cod.  I was too busy with my steak.)  He was raving about that too.  And from what I've heard (I don't like but one of my friends is a connoisseur of it) their liver and onions is out of this world too.  There is a wait time usually if you go during peak hours and peak days but well worth it.  The wait staff is very friendly and personable....and always busy.  They'll always stop by to make sure that you're happy and check if you need a refill.  That's always very much appreciated.   As far as the restaurant goes:  5 of 5.  Now comes the "lost star".  Location, location, location.  No parking.  It's in a strip mall with very little parking and there's also a bar in this strip mall and a bunch of other stores.  Anyhow, I'm usually frustrated by the time I get to the front door because it's a struggle to park.  Other than that, you need to go here!!  Great food, great staff!!!!

1nbKBD7caGtADEcwFWS4xw.text: Their chicken fried steak and gravy is worth 5 stars alone. Owner came by to greet us personally nice guy friendly staff and very attentive

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak

r5UFyiaatMguNJVyxqBuQw.text: I wanted to grab something to eat on my way home from work . I stopped by TEXAZ grill . I was slobs so I sat at the bar . I had the rib eye. It was cooked to perfection . The taste was amazing . Very tender and juicy. My mashed potatoes and gravy were yummy !  So creamy and the gravy was thick and had lots of flavor . Tammy at the car is always so nice and attentive .   Can't wait to go back

x_RkBmI3258wVNhns8yIpg.text: This place is all around good , good atmosphere , good service and good food ! Huge portions !! The chicken fried steak is bigger than the plate and then there was a hidden smaller one under it !!! We also had the Big nasty ..mmm mmm good ! Come hungry !! For a little while you feel like your back home in good o'l Texas ...

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak

xRFOtcl6PRYM7e65mz6oTg.text: I'm sorry but this place probably has the worst turkey club i have ever had. thick sliced lunchable meat with regular american cheese, bacon, lettuce tomato. on a hot toasty bun... didn't quite sit right, i probably ordered the worst thing on the menu. but i wasn't to crazy about the potato chunk fried fries either..... but what do i know! the chicken fried steak is probably awesome, but i needed something light and quick at the time!   the place was really dirty above your head no telling whats getting on the food that you are about to eat. and all the walls were super cluttered with decor, and dusty hats hanging everywhere, kind of gross.  service was awesome, and the people were cool. but not enough to come back to.

FIX-dePHmysFvpKmByXvGw.text: This is a divey looking place, but it it is a steakhouse and it was pretty darned good.  Prime Rib was awesome.  I thought the gravy on the mashed left a little bit to be desired.  Service was great.  I'd go back.

4X1r3Xj-2v5zSjtE-oly2A.text: In town on vacation liked the menu and good reviews. Small hometown place not big but homey. If I lived here I would e a regular. The waitress was one of my best ever. She always let you know what she was doing, the food out of this world. Smoked prime was the best ever and I love prime rib. My wife had chicken fried chicken and it was big and something you rarely see in this area. Great food, great service. I saw a complaint about sides etc. next time look at the menu. Great place for out of town or locals.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside great vibe

s-hwR9OdrTr1NgOwB3nnzQ.text: I remember when this location was the original Carlos O'Brien's and then moved to it's new location.  Lone Star Steaks moved in and for several years it was a terrific steak house run by Texans.  They served up a great chicken fried steak and other Texas favorites and developed a good local following.  Then the corporations came in and made them cease and desist using the name Lone Star (beer and steak corps) which really was a shame.  They came back with the name TexAZ Grill.  The menu stayed the same as did the local following of patrons.  They have great pork chops, steaks and the BEST chicken fried steak in the city!  The whiskey bread pudding is one of the Hubby's favorites and I do indeed enjoy the pecan pie a la mode so sweet your teeth ache.  Staff is outstanding!

4lXzFy7mAXY8uOrYgqAldw.text: Wow!  Please read the entire review. I'm concerned about what's going on at TexAz.  My wife and I have been eating at this restaurant for many years. We no longer live in Phoenix and always make a point to stop and get our fix of great food when we come to town.   I hope the meal they served us was just a fluke, but if not, Houston we have a problem........!!! We notice immediately once our meals arrived that the Chicken Fried Chicken and the Chicken Fried Pork Chop were definitely thinner.  The Pork Chop had no salt and the breading was oily and fell off the both meat entrees.  The biscuits were not the same fluff and size and the Okra didn't make the cut, not fresh, seeds were too larger due to older in the field. It seemed FROZEN.   The reason why the breading falls off are as follows: 1. Brined too long 2. Meat is not dried prior to coating with seasoned flower  3. Oil temp not hot enough when dropped in the fryer My wife is from the south and we know something about frying, that's why this place was so awesome.  They never cut corners! Service was excellent!   We will give it one more try, but if the new owner continues to tinker with a once outstanding products we fear TexAz will go the way of Dodo Bird sad to say.  Why someone would buy a business that works and think changes won't be noticed.  Trust the people who got you to the promised land.  Your reputation is on the line!

CUAkI68kPT8jfY8xiCziag.text: Good go to standard chain food but good. Great drinks. Great people Tuesday best day. I only give 3 cause it's a chain but hood people I can't sat for every restaurant.

GHm2pjv3SAoVE3X4aUuP7w.text: Such great food!!!! The smoked brisket tacos were amazing!! Our server, Helena, was the best!

2AErPk6g2Dvqf01JivVv5Q.text: A group of 5 of us arrived for dinner at 6:00. The rude hostess refused to sit us at one of the vacant larger tables and instead crowded us into a 4 top. Needless to say, this was not a good start to the meal.   We were offered a choice of salad or cole slaw to start with. Unfortunately, 3 of us opted for the cole slaw, which while nice and creamy was loaded with onion and perhaps some garlic. None of us could finish the cole slaw because the onion was so strong. We tried the biscuits, which were undercooked and pastey. One bite was all that anyone could tolerate.  Next we ordered main courses. Two people ordered the Saturday Special steak Lin Sue. A  N.Y. strip steak topped with artichoke hearts, jumbo shrimp and then covered in bearnaise sauce. I don't know who thought this combination up, but neither of the people who ordered it finished it. One of the comments was that the shrimp were well overcooked.  Companion ordered the "famous" chicken fried steak because there was no prime rib available. It came smothered in a very thick, heavy gravy that could only be compared to wallpaper paste. They may have served hundreds of thousands of chicken fried steaks, but if they were like this plate I feel sorry for all those who tried to eat it.   I ordered the pork chops with gravy and mashed potatoes. I was lucky in that the pork chops were nicely cooked - however they were covered in the same "gravy glop" that everything else was hidden under.   Most of our party asked for take home boxes with the idea of feeding the leftovers either to 2 legged or 4 legged members of their household.  Next we ordered dessert. Once again, I picked the winner - peach cobbler topped with vanilla ice cream. Served warm, it was flavorful though the crust was not well cooked. The ice cream was nice.  Another of our party ordered the bread pudding with whisky sauce. The bread pudding was very dense and did not look like any other bread pudding I have ever seen. As we passed it around the table, one of our party got a bite that had raw whisky in it and couldn't stop coughing.   Another item which was passed around was the "Old New Orleans Calas" which were supposed to be sweet rice balls, deep fried and dusted with sugar. Whoever made them forgot to put the sugar on them and totally overcooked them to the point that the rice was crunchy and inedible. They were not deemed to be something that anyone would take home.  On the positive side, our waitress was excellent and a total hoot. She was lots of fun and our tips reflected her good nature.  The restaurant is decorated with all sorts of kitsch, which prevented us from ascertaining the cleanliness or lack thereof of the restaurant.  Our party has requested of me that we not return there again. 2 stars

dCKhY1-vEc3jRWvhx1d7Jw.text: Besides the great food and service, I love the decor of this corner gem. I'm never disappointed! And I mean, NEVER. I took our youngest, for lunch, and he was mesmerized by all the memorabilia, on the wall and ceiling. It was entertaining, to see the look, on his face. I love it, when I get to surprise, our kids. Even though the youngest, just turned 30. Can't remember what he had, but he devoured, every last bite. I got the country fried steak, and it was enough, for 3 meals.  This is another place, that has never been a disappointment. If you go, just make sure you go after the rush hour, or you'll have to wait in line. Not that it isn't worth the wait! I just lothe, lines. Go, go, go, and try this place out. Not only, is the food great, I never go, where I don't meet someone, interesting. Reminds me of my Mom & Grandma's restaurant, in Central Illinois,  back in the 50's & 60's. ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xi0VLM_NO7H5nxoQgeImAg.text: Sorry. This has been my favorite "don't worry about the calories" place for the night because it's worth the splurge....BUT... Menu prices increased, plates and portions got smaller, recipes changed for the worse and I was served catfish that was SO undercooked that it was disgustingly raw. Yes, they took it off my bill. No, I did not drive my family there for the disappointment. Oh Texaz...go back to the classic restaurant that you were and tell the person that convinced you that smaller portions, higher prices and "cutbacks" were to your advantage...that's NOT what made you famous. I don't want to see a Classic become extinct...but...right now you're headed down the same road as the dinosaur...

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. cornmeal batter and undercooked soggy....

CkIY4kBbxkSNrtvrdgW-ng.text: Had the chicken fried steak with corn, mashed potatoes, and the gravy -outstanding (especially with extra gravy). Wife had the excellent BBQ sandwich. Still one of the "old time"  great places to eat in Phoenix!! Waitress was attentive, efficient, but not overbearing. Well done TEXAZ Grill.

JTh3sm8YM1jLlPh7PbdUGA.text: My first visit, for lunch several months ago, was so positive I couldn't wait to return. From the moment I walked in, and caught a whiff of bbq smoke,and felt the Texas vibe, I was sure I would love this place. My only True Texas steak house experience had been at Big Vern's in Shamrock (delicious) and The Big Texan Steak Ranch in Amarillo (more hype than flavor), so I was anxious to try this AZ outpost. My lunch of the beef ribs was so tasty and tender, I counted the days until I could return to satisfy my carnivorous urges. I managed a return last Friday for an early dinner, and had such a horrible experience that even those wonderful beef ribs might not be enough to lure me back. Our party of three was quickly seated, and then ignored, despite the moderate crowd. Two of us had the misfortune of ordering the Salisbury steak, and my wife had the liver and onions. Although my companion had ordered his steak cooked medium, and I, medium well, both arrived extremely undercooked. We sent them back, and had them returned to us, assured by our waitress that they were new steaks. Suffice it to say that they both tasted like canned dog food smothered in a hideous version of 'mushroom gravy'. They were so bad that we considered returning them again, but as they were 'early dinner specials', didn't. We really should have. My wife's liver proved just as bad. We left thinking that they must intentionally make the specials inedible to dissuade folks from ever again straying from the higher priced regular menu. The problem is, our dinners were so bad, we'll probably not return to test our theory. It's a damn shame, cuz those ribs were so good.

THWtq_eQf6Aq4kPPv9vgsQ.text: Great roadhouse. Real people, and really good food. Had a honest Ribeye steak. Big flavor, tender and juicy. The price fits the place, food and service, making it great value.

Tq0wheNzasR0HmOxs_4XtA.text: On    4/9/2019 at around 6:30pm we went to Texaz Grill for dinner for the first time. Place was nice however the crew were not very friendly or welcoming as you would expect from a place that use Texas in their name which was very disappointing since we have been stationed and lived in Texas before. Anyway, our hostess/waitress, Cynthia came and took our orders. Place was not busy but seems like it took awhile to get our food. I ordered chix fried goodness and my husband ordered beef kabob. Mine was not so bad but my husband's kabab was 3 square of meat and veggies. For $20.00 a plate, it was kind of expensive. You could have spent the same amount at Black Angus and get great service and good food. Anyway, we asked for our ticket since we were in a hurry to go to an appointment and Cynthia brought it. My husband, a 20 yrs Career Retired Navy Veteran is proud to have served for his country and whenever we go places and we are asked to pay with credit/debit card or asked for id, we automatically pull out our military ids as it is an important part of our life that we have been accustom to. Cynthia came back and she thought at first that we were doing spit pay so she ask and my husband said no that is just my credit card and id. We were in shocked when Cynthia said, WE DO NOT DO MILITARY. WOW, WOW. She walked away and we were in shocked starring at each other in disbelieve of what she has just said. To be in a restaurant that is named after the Great State of Texas and to have a hostess/waitress who was probably at least 55 yrs of age or older waited on you and to hear that, we thought to ourselves, that you can go to Chick-Fil-A  and get an excellent customer service, better food and pay a lot less. We are not the ones who always provide feedback on restaurants or other places but OMGoodness, to be in America and have an American tell you, "WE DO NO DO MILITARY" was shocking. I think as old as she was, maybe there were better words to be used.

aHehijCRnKrO8ILJQsOVXg.text: A great experience from the moment we arrived. Our waitress was phenomenal. The generous helping of fried Cod was fluffy and delicious.  My only regret was that I had no room for dessert.

6jixN9JqFCTra4nBSCWrOQ.text: Country fried steak is life!  Ask for extra gravy.  Then bathe in it.  Grab some Lonestars - a Texas delicacy - and watch your troubles disappear.  Also shoutout to the service team - always super friendly.

fFmJOxFBr1-JMxfQVwubUg.text: Known in our extended circle of Texans as The Mothership, this place rocks. From the time you enter u til the time you leave, you'll be treated like favorite cousins. Don't let the funky parking fool you--plenty room in the back. The food is simply the best. No better to be had, even in my Aunt Myrtle's kitchen in Chico, Tx. The service is fast, friendly and just a tiny bit sassy. You don't want your own side of okra?  That boy beside you looks like he might not play fair on this sharing situation. And PS she was right. Next time?  Gettin my own okra.

VpiVZipB8K6l80EkCa5-Ug.text: The bomb.com chicken fried steak. Never had it better than here! Love this place and the old school decor.

QqB_ygrIxKIvw9lf8ANZvA.text: My wife and I decided to give this place a try one afternoon after seeing this place for years. One of the major issues we have with places that serve chicken fried steak is that the gravy is usually not very flavorful nor is the steak itself. I'm very pleased to say this place surprised us both.   It is very obvious that this place puts a lot of hard work and passion into their food. The batter covering the steak was delicious and the meat inside was seasoned up proper and tender. And that gravy covering it? I am licking my lips thinking about it as it had just the right amount of pepper and not overbearing in salt at all! The waitress was super friendly, even gave us a sample of their Texas style chili so we could see what the difference was.   And the mashed potatoes....were just like the ones my mother would serve on Thanksgiving day; skin on, so you know they're real and lumpy with a delicious butter and pepper taste to them. I'm willing to wager they probably use milk in them just to make them extra fluffy.   I got the chicken fried steak and my wife got their barbeque sampler. Ribs were a smidge salty but I'm still giving these guys a five star review because it felt so nice eating at a no frills, down home place. I'll make sure next time we go in to save room for their dessert as I do love bread pudding.

STJTYkf-JJwA_1PWtOhD0A.text: We drove a little out of our way to visit Texaz Grill, but it was more than worth it. We both had the pecan smoked prime rib, which was heavenly.  Perfect rosy center, almost fork-tender, and the flavor--the best prime rib we ever had. Would like to sample other menu items when we return, but it'll be hard to resist the pr. We would like to have seen a cooked veggie on the plate. The mashed taters were great; the salad was OK. Our waitress was super nice and helpful. When my husband asked the best way to heat up his copious leftover meat, she suggested warming it is some of the au jus--then went to the kitchen and brought back  a little container of it. What a doll! I agree with others that you almost have to helicopter into the the parking lot. Next time we might look elsewhere and walk a little. Notwithstanding, I won't budge on my five stars for the food.

Vx4nQkaSS40iUpgp42GV9w.text: I like such places. This is a place for locals and families. The food was good and quickly came out. They are famous for their chicken fried steak. The serving size is very generous.

uMN5UX9im9ne_t1UjvxxTQ.text: This place is a really good slice of Texan food. Been here three times and each time the main course has been delicious.  First time I had the smoked prime rib, better than most expensive steakhouses. Second time was a Monday (check there Website for each days special) and fried chicken was half a bird...extra crispy goodness. Today the special was bbq beef back ribs. Five Flintstone sized ribs on the plate. Waitresses are all super helpful and know how to serve. My only downside is the potato choices. Not a big potato fan the Texas fries are big chunks and the mashed are really dense. Good country gravy though. Might try potato salad next time. Have my eyes on the big bubby enchilada next.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef rib special

QTNKl6IiThdPLknOzGwXLg.text: Everything I had was on the bland side of mediocre.  I might be too picky, but the Midwestern crowd seems to be in love with everything.  Maybe it was an 'Off Night' for the place.  Waiter was adequate in service and came through like a champ when I asked to have the Chicken Fried Steak removed from my bill.  The beef was tender. The batter was fried perfectly.  IF they woulda thrown some Salt/Pepper/Garlic/Lee & Perrins/etc./etc. in the hamburger and in batter, well, I tell you what, I would've eaten a whole lot more of that big CFS!  But lack of any flavour made me stop at maybe 20%.  I'm certain that the MN IA WI IL ND SD etc. natives will love it.  I will not be back.

ozqLHrQzn0KSseZg5Evi7g.text: We were visiting from LA , this has been on our to try list. The service is just like being in Texas. We lived there for a few years. Service is friendly and attentive. Tall glass of ice tea, Texas style Had the bbq beef sandwich, very tasty. The ff were good,  they were not the Texas ff I use to get. These are thick and cubed.  The gentleman who I presume is the owner was very nice and stops by to ask if all is well. Nice throwback feel of a small town eatery..

ESi5KalwLwa34nWrJlxJjQ.text: "Incredible"  "Magnificent"  "The best chicken fried steak on this side of the world"  -Me, after my first, second, and third bite at this heavenly restaurant.   First, you walk in and there is not an inch of paint you can see on the walls -- they are completely covered with miscellaneous items such as license plates and deer heads. Awesome, simply the perfect atmosphere to get in the mood to eat fried food.   We were greeted by two very friendly people who sat us quickly. They were extremely attentive and quick to get our orders in. Obviously, I ordered the chicken fried steak, and obviously, you will also order the chicken fried steak.   We were served coleslaw and a biscuit while we waited in anticipation for what was to come. I took small bites of both, trying to save room for my feast, but couldn't help but gobble down the biscuit which was a flakey and buttery. I'm not a fan of coleslaw, so I can't really comment on that, but it looked very creamy, if that's how coleslaw is supposed to look.   The chicken fried steak. wow. First, you get not one, but TWO giant pieces of meat covered in gravy with a side of potatoes (I chose mashed). It was absolutely fantastic. Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, and the gravy was topped perfectly. The mashed potatoes were great, but I pushed them aside so I could shove my face in the steak.  They packaged our chicken fried steak for us to go with an extra side of gravy at no charge (bless them), as there was no way we were going to finish it all.   One of the wonderful people who worked there (who I believe was the manager) overheard it was my birthday and did not let me leave without giving me a scoop of ice cream and announcing to the restaurant it was my birthday. Seriously, they are too friendly.  TLDR: eat here if you want to experience what heaven is like.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Decor
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THERE IS ANOTHER PIECE OF CHICKEN FRIED STEAK UNDER THIS ONE

IT0yyEDM26PL_dma_Fd4Yg.text: This is the number one place for comfort food. Even the surroundings and interior provide comfort icing on the cake along with your amazing meal. In addition the servers like JILL, Nancy, Cherrill & the others make you feel right at home. It's always great. It's always consistent. It never lets you down. TEXAZ Grill is a must for your weekly lunch or dinner routine.

vvXovRxX0on9_PCpJWoUzQ.text: So I'm a az transplant here in 1996 from Texas and I love it here but I'm still a Texan at heart... born and raised Houston Texas.   I had a hankering for a real chicken fried steak and lo and behold here I am. I am impressed by a menu that's not too large with multiple items. The menu is smaller but it has all the staples you're want.   I got the CFS and it was huge and tasteful. I had the coleslaw which wasn't too wet and I had the steak fries otstead of mashed...wow o didn't want to leave. Good food!   Parking through leaves a lot to be desired... you have to do a three point turn about 6 times to fit it in a spot... small lot and small spots. You can try to come in off 7th street but that parking is directional so you need to be driving west. I parked off the Bethany home entrance.  However the place ambiance is definitely pretty intense on the decor. :-)  Ok so it's now 2018 and OMG the place is awesome still... always something new and amazing on the menu especially the daily features. I wish I didn't move so far away... however I still make it a time to visit and eat and enjoy... I think it's an amazing place to eat and relax without anyone pushing you out the door to get table and they do have both tables and booth and a bar to sit at and yes the have a nice hidden parking area lol anyway I upgrade to 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wow it&#39;s a big plate and this ain&#39;t no thin steak

cfqTDKg7L7PRDvMplBvU8w.text: Hey folks, I don't eat meat and have no opinion about the chicken fried steak which is the "claim to fame" of this fun, funky, character-rich joint, but I do come here regularly for FRIED CATFISH, which is awesome!  The dinner portion is two generous pieces of lightly battered, crispy on the outside, moist and tender on the inside catfish served with delicious tartar sauce on the side, while the lunch or optional smaller portion is one piece of fish.  A dinner salad, biscuits, and Someone on Yelp complained about the simple, chopped lettuce salad which they felt was served with too much dressing.  That is easily remedied by simply asking for dressing on the side, which my husband always does because he only likes a little and prefers to put it on to his liking ... simple!  The mashed potatoes with country gravy are rustic ON PURPOSE, hello!  If that's not your thing, there are other choices you can substitute, just ask!  Sometimes I'm more conscious of watching carbs and choose sliced tomatoes instead, and you can, too, just ask your waitress for suggestions!  All in all, this is a fun place to enjoy traditional comfort food, the hustle and bustle, the busy but friendly staff, the funky Western decor, and the wide variety of folks who enjoy the same.  If you want "fine dining," get out the big bucks and go somewhere else, but if you want simple, down-home food in a unique environment, try TEXAZ!

x4DOffr71C1wB4dZ7bCH1w.text: Loved the food, the service, and the atmosphere. My husband is from Texas and feels somewhat at home there. We ended up going two weekends in a row for brunch. They serve a perfect mimosa, hand you the little bottle of champagne and a orange juice shooter so you can mix to your preference. The chalas were tasty and the fried steak was huge and coated perfectly. I had the benny, which was a perfect size with very good gravy. Peach cobbler was fantastic. Only problem--we needed a nap afterwards because we ate too much delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3vxLoJ_fq_GDqggHYfBzmA.text: The food was awesome I had the chicken fried steak and would not believe the size of the steak but was more surprise that there was another one same size under that one great taste great margaritas highly recommend this location great food excellent service and awesome attention by the person that was in charge as well

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gB8h3HT3OURz8bl1VZ2r3w.text: I feel like since the previous owner sold the business the food is on the decline.   The new owner/manager is trying to work the line with no kitchen experience.  Its a shame I have always loved this place and my only previous complaint is that the server staff had tendency to be rude

19Ishv8NCSTHUC3dnkn0hg.text: We go here quite often.  The food is out of this world!  Chicken Fried Steak is phenomenal!  Everything about this place, from the cards and things stapled to the walls to the cleanliness says class.  But, if you go you HAVE to try and get in the waitress's area by the name of Helena!  She's so sweet, attentive, and just about the best waitress ever!  She is amazing.

Cv4b5rlOW-qjqJYtBa3eow.text: It pains me to write this. I am a Texan, a Houstonian. I was raised on chicken fried steak and moved to Phoenix two decades ago with cream gravy in my veins. I know full well what a good cat fish dinner taste like and no one can tell me that Blue Bell is "ok". I first found Texaz Grill when it was Texas Grill - before they were forced to change the name. That said, I have been eating here for a very long time and they are - had been - the next best thing to the real thing when it comes to chicken fried steak. That hot plate of the golden mother-load was satisfying and warming to a home-sick soul. I think I may have cried the day I came in, sat at a booth and saw the placard on the table that simply read, "We now carry Blue Bell Ice Cream". That's been some time now.   I moved away a few years ago but for whatever reason I have to return to Phoenix, Texaz Grill is a no-brainer. About a year ago I ordered the usual CFS and we were a little surprised to find the meat was tough. Before, all you needed was a fork and maybe a knife for good manners. We wrote it off as a fluke but then the next time, a few short months later, another order in town and it was ... weird ... chewy. What happened to the melt-in-your-mouth CFS this place has been warmly bringing out for ages? I began to wonder if there has been a change of suppliers for their meat, a new cook overdid it - denial and love for some Texas home cooking kept me silent and I went back again. The catfish had always been a winner, my S.O. ordered that and it turned out to be the better meal. Wow. I was so sad.   A few months passed, enough for us to forget, so here we were this week after anxiously watching family and friends go through Hurricane Harvey, I wanted nothing more than a Texaz Grill CFS & gravy to hug my soul.   ...sigh... I cannot recall having to fight so hard to get a piece of meat to tear away so I can swallow it without fear of choking on the tendon strings.  Me with a knife: cut, cut, cut, cut, CCUT, CUTT,,, CUT. Then literally grabbing one end with my teeth, the other ripping it with my hand to get it to split so it is safe to chew. And chew, and chew, and chew, and chew... . We didn't finish it. This is *NOT* a ~Texas~ chicken fried steak. It was like Denny's wishing it was. But the catfish, as always, was good.   I am so, so, disappointed. This is the forth time, so this is no longer a fluke. I do not know what has happened over there but Texaz Grill, you need to know that whoever is supplying your meat these days, I would take it under serious consideration to look into them a little deeper. Maybe it's the prep that has changed - I don't know but something changed with the CFS and not for the good. Again, I am from Texas and we know meat. This stuff is bad. Really bad. After nearly choking on tendon-like strings (on two different occasions) that wouldn't tear, also the very thought of so many tendon-like strings in my mouth really grosses me out, I'm wondering what exactly is this 'meat' that I'm eating???  Honestly, I'm sorry, but after several overlooks and tries I have to resign myself to the truth: I am an old-school customer and a Texan so I know what this place used to cook when it came to chicken fried steak and I know how it *should* be cooked. But the truth is, it's terrible and I no longer feel safe eating it. Anyone who is new to this place and not well versed in a properly cooked, tender Texas Chicken Fried steak will be in 'awe' of the plateful and love it and maybe those are your new customers who don't know any better. But for folks like me who miss our mama's home cooking and greasy hole-in-the-wall local restaurants serving it up as it's meant to be and sometimes just need a "I hate you Hurricane Harvey" hug, I'll have to wait until i get back home again cuz i give up.   Good luck.

G05ZkYpGq1vzs8-AB20SIQ.text: Big, BIG portions.  During my visit in Phoenix, my girlfriend and I had our last dinner at TEXAZ Grill. We saw the great reviews and were in the mood for some meat, so this was the choice. Parking is pretty difficult so I'd suggest parking in the big plaza across the street and just walking.  Upon entering, the place is littered with cool memorabilia everywhere. This seems like the spot to go to cause it was packed that night. We were seated pretty fast and ordered the chicken fried steak, fried okra and a NY strip topped w/artichoke and jumbo shrimp.  First off, the portions here are HUGE. You start off with a choice of coleslaw or salad, then came the good stuff. The steak was delicious and the jumbo shrimps topped with some magical sauce were amazing. I'm a pretty big fan of country fried steak, but I was expecting a bit more. Yes, it was about 3/4ths of the plate and had another one underneath, but without it being smothered in gravy, I actually felt like it was pretty bland to eat on its own.  Worth a visit!

jVtEAY3NpJJUxjP-RNJ-qw.text: Stopped in with a friend who absolutely loves TEXAS Grill and was only in town for a few days. He ordered the chicken fried steak, I ordered the half portion, and my husband ordered the bbq sampler being featured that night. The portions were huge, I mean HUGE. The half portion was enough for two people to easily share and all entrees were served with either a house salad or cole slaw and a basket of biscuits and rolls to share. The chicken fried steak is served with mashed potatoes and gravy, all a bit under seasoned for me but still enjoyable. My husband's sampler had brisket, ribs, and a sausage. He didn't really care for the brisket or ribs but enjoyed the sausage. The crowd here is on the older side, the decor is a bit over the top, the restaurant itself seems a bit aged but you can tell that there are a lot of regulars that really enjoy coming here. Worth a shot if you are in the mood for some comfort food, and a lot of it!

-nALB4uXntM2sq8KeijLVw.text: We simply love Texaz Grill, the food is amazing and the service is great! Being a native Texan, I truly appreciate a little touch of home and Texaz Grill always delivers.  Last night I had the fried gulf shrimp and they were yummy! Keep up the great work guys!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4ATNBFsnUunRgWyF0LhhBA.text: Had dinner here the other night. What a cool concept - with all the decor, I truly felt I was in the heart of Texas!  We ordered the smoked prime rib meal, which included biscuit and roll, salad, mashed potatoes/gravy and prime rib. The prime rib was done perfectly, and had a great smoky flavor. Big big portions too. My only complaint would be that my prime rib was just a tad cool (temperature) - should have been a little warmer. But at least it wasn't overcooked!  Great atmosphere, and fun place.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smoked prime rib

D8lrQQbBKlGbbSSeQ9QTpg.text: Legendary chicken fried steak and awesome mashed potatoes and gravy. Whatever distance you may be from this little piece of heaven, get in the car and go. I would recommend training for the moment for at least a couple weeks because your food capacity limits will be tested. Best I've had in a VERY long time. Could not recommend more highly.

9TGiBu8v8o-SUle0MILIkg.text: For the very best food, service and atmosphere Texaz Grill nails it every time. They perfected the chicken fried steak,  and anything else that can be chicken fried including chicken.  Last night Helena was our server and what a sweetheart she is! Very personable, attentive and warm lady who earned a nice tip for her effort. We live in the east valley and it is worth the drive. On the occasion that you have to wait for a table......do it! It is so well worth the wait.

U5stDNYlhn9IDuusTy07Tg.text: Can't believe I never reviewed Texaz. Texaz is a Family favorite since the 90's. Every meal is delicious. Smothered pork chops, chicken fried chicken, chicken fried steak. Even the burger is good. I have never tried their desserts because i'm always full! Also staff is friendly and on the Ice tea refills!

kWSa0sLj2u98o4hpNejDmQ.text: This place came with raving reviews. While visiting with friends we decided to try this place based on photos and yelp reviews. The chicken fried steak was huge, but that was the only think good about it. It lacked flavor and seasoning. The gravy was strange, a cross between white and brown gravy. The mashed potatoes were ok but covered with the gravy. The prime rib was ok but the smoke taste was overwhelming. The parking was a sign but we decided to try it. A restaurant without windows is quite depressing even with the eclectic decor.  The people and service was good. This place was not for us.

Cgip40ywcZtR1oPl0DhuHg.text: Great food, sweet staff, great times!   Came here on a Monday night, tired and in search of a good meal. Delivered.  Ordered their speciality, chicken fried steak and it met plus exceeded the hype. Huge portion and extremely flavorful! Add a dose of southern hospitality and you have the perfect weeknight meal.  Highly recommend this place, you will not be disappointed.

nQAbYf2lCk0L8rV20wSjjA.text: Service was great. The amount of food given is totally enough to share. Best peach cobbler I've ever had. Will definitely be back.

QRsoukft2NbAk7H3IUlepg.text: After completing a major work project this week, I was in the mood for some steak and decided to give this place a try.  Located at the corner of E Bethany Home Road & N 16th St. The first noticeable issue with the location is the lack of parking (-1).  The parking lot is extremely small and shared with other popular businesses.  Thankfully I got there a bit late and someone was pulling out. Even maneuvering within the parking lot is extremely difficult.  The signage for the restaurant could do with a sprucing up but was still somewhat noticeable from across the street.  Staff were friendly but weren't overly friendly (-0.5).  They were attentive to our needs, like checking up on our meals, and even taking our orders in a timely fashion.  The place is small inside but it has age and character.  Lots of memorabilia on the walls and ceilings.  Some booths aren't completely cordoned off so you can see fellow patrons beneath the partitions.  Drinks were served timely but food took some time to come.  Menus were simple, short, and not too in depth.  Food tasted good - their ribeye was cooked to perfection and was soft, juicy, tender, and not overly seasoned; and the dish comes with fries or mashed potatoes with gravy, bread, a biscuit, coleslaw or salad.  The coleslaw was served on its own and fresh and too runny.  The bread and biscuit was warm.  The mashed potatoes were perfect - not dripping off your fork kinda mashed but semisolid enough, and the gravy complemented it really well.  I'd love to come back and try their country fried steak which, I heard is good, but I'm reluctant to based on the abysmal parking situation.

UkLQgbizE49WpkSPAGG2BQ.text: Beefsteak Mexia - so now we have a version of the CFS which is topped with red sauce and longhorn cheese.  And the steak is almost the same size as the plate.  So delicious it can't be put into words.  Now I find myself in a real dilemma . . . which one takes first place as the "fave" chicken-fried-object???  Every time I think they've topped themselves here . . . they come up with something new.  Guess I'll just have to keep on coming back!  Thanks to all for continuing the top-notch food and service!!!  PS:  the Pecan Pie slice is now 1/6th of the pie, rather than the 1/8th it was before.  Dear God in Heaven what a delicious dessert!!!  And more of it!!!  Back to the gym I go . . . . :)

Q_ORnTG6mgAr9-F_zOQU4Q.text: We really wanted to love this place! But the service was so slow and the waitress was slightly preoccupied. Our good wasn't good-order the chili and it was terrible, they did remove it from the bill. The ribs were good though limited side options.   Seems like a good spot for regulars and tebar looked the bar looked relaxing.

qrW7nNiLJtAL9Nkyu3hUJA.text: Awful service. We went in with a party of 7 on Friday night. The hostess laughed at us saying, "you expect to be seated on a Friday, for 7? With no reservation? Ha! You're looking at an hour and a half wait." Then he chuckled to himself! We didn't even get to eat, we left immediately. It was rude to just assume we knew how busy they would be and that we should've just known ahead of time to make a reservation. Never going back. I am appalled.

hv3QZWzPC-pH4fstx5hBZQ.text: Texas is more known for its sliced brisket, but I was there at lunch and they only had the chopped brisket sandwich available for $6.99 with a side of twice baked potato wedges. Those wedges were crispy and above average, but the brisket was just average in the chopped form. Not sure why Texas places cannot replicate Southern chopped brisket, but it is never as good as down south or southern style places. It wasn't horrible, but the BBQ sauce was watery and did not add much and the bottom bun was soaked through, so no way was this going to be eaten sandwich style. The place was decorated with animal heads and other crazyiness and the parking lot is a very tight squeeze if your there at the wrong time. The waitress was very nice though and it's worth another visit to try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped brisket..lunch

8wkufoSA7x8TnQtCDCrg-g.text: My co-worker took me to eat here let's just say I ordered the Chicken Fried Chicken and inhaled it....damn it was good!! Listen you're  are not coming here to order the salad and watch your calories so get over it and throw down on some good food! Plus it's easy on the pockets and you will for sure need a nap afterwards. Look forward to coming back to try more stuff off the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chicken Fried Chicken!!

JcK5HQb08_PgRmHVr5WU4w.text: We came here after seeing this resturant on check please.  They did not have the rice balls which you only get on Sunday my wife and I thought that this was an ok restaurant here everything looked really good on Check Please but after we got there most of the things were really without a lot of flavor. The chicken fried steak and chicken fried chicken was very crispy but they didn't have much flavor. Our dinner mates felt the same way about the chicken and sides. Lots of food, but the flavor was lacking.

-pL2RzMSdJBgJjeVg0KfeQ.text: What a great, unique place!  Smoked prime rib is fantastic - juicy, well seasoned, so tasty. Potato wedges are the perfect pairing. Very cold beer completes the Texas experience. Parking is a challenge but worth the trouble.

_hkPK2xd4h5tzvMfNiuXpA.text: Third time's a charm... Got in just as they were about to close and was served the biggest chicken fried steak north of the equator. I'm thinking now I want to move here permanently. There's nothing like a nice home cooked meal right after a long flight. Management and staff deserve all the credit.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak from heaven.... Mmmmm
Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. If this was heaven then I&#39;d be a saint. OMG. Again does not disappoint.

N9fopSY9CB4j52DaQx1sGQ.text: OMG I had the Brisket sandwich for lunch and it was huge and fantastic, it's a pretty finely chopped brisket and I loved it! You also get a side of potatoes! My friend had the chicken fried steak but refused to share, it looked delicious though!!

uGWLk3meY5OpTdRXxR-YEA.text: We went here last Saturday.  Good decor, pretty good service, food needs some work.  We were greeted when we arrived and told how long the wait was.  Then, after the expected wait were shown to our table.  So far so good.  We ordered our dinners, two of which included Salad.  The greens for the salad looked they came out of a bag and definitely were not fresh.  Kind of that slimy one week old feeling ... We both had the house dressing.  Didn't like it.  My wife had the chicken, I had the Lin Su (a steak with two shrimp on top, and our son had the BBQ.  My son liked the BBQ.  My wife and I didn't care for ours.  Perhaps we were so turned off by the salad that it colored our perception of the meal.  I'm not sure.  We might try it again.  Hopefully the salad is an anomaly.

HdQYwocOzqnTheCKe7WrSA.text: Used to be one of our favs but has gone south very fast. Last two times we have been there the food was not edible. Something is very wrong.

JrGKxAqbeCatDX1PoYiizw.text: I am from Texas and I do love the regional food. My husband had been craving a good chicken fried steak, so we decided to try TEXAZ Grill.  The parking can be a pain. If you pull into the spots right in front of the building, they're for compact cars, and there's no valet. There is a lot behind the building with ample sized spots, so look for the turn in off Bethany Home.  The decor is a little tacky and over the top, but I guess that adds to the restaurant's charm. The staff is friendly and helpful.  Chicken fried steak - awesome. The portion is huge, and it's cooked just like it should be. Accompanying mashed potatoes are quite good. I was surprised that the brisket sandwich was so good. The meat is really tender, flavorful, and thick cut. I like that they top it with BBQ sauce and then provide extra on the side. Portion was also big, although the chicken fried steak is hard to beat in terms of quality, quantity, and price. My husband and I could have split it and still had leftovers.  We had plenty of leftovers and couldn't try any dessert (unfortunately) because we were so full. I really want to go back and try the other menu items, like the chili, one of their many steaks, and the chicken fried chicken. If you like Texas staples, give TEXAZ Grill a try.

b4flYthbTKfjfddcdjV8Ig.text: Came here with family for dinner. Had smoke prime rib!! It was amazing I can't wait to go back !!! Everyone in the family had something different so we all tried a bite or two of different plates   Yum !!!!

C0ZEM3U8zv6dY2AejHe5Rw.text: I visited the Texaz Grill yesterday with some friends of mine following a funeral for their infant grandson. We badly needed a break and a place to just sit down, eat, and talk about something else.  When we first entered, the hostess, a blonde older lady, already had a crappy attitude. We'd come in two cars and there was a little confusion about whether my friend's husband and son were already there. The hostess was very snippy with my friend, I suspect because my friend is a larger lady. We let it go.  Brisket sandwiches and some catfish: flippin' awesome. Our actual waitress was nice enough, thankfully. Desserts were consumed in spite of being stuffed from the nice entrees.  When we finished we sat a bit and talked. The hostess approached and brought a bag for the leftover boxes. It was clear she wanted us OUT. My friend asked for water and the hostess said hotly, "To GO?" My friend said no, and that hostess was preeeeetty huffy about it. I don't know if she's the owner's wife, or what, but someone who thinks she can behave that way to customers needs to be spoken to.

oUtRzsOGUfy3NjFPi5FVDQ.text: Wow. I'm tempted to hide in the booth and spend the night so I can wake up and eat another chicken fried steak for breakfast . Nancy took great care of me and kept my ice tea filled even with my post airplane ride thirst. The chicken fried steak was incredible. Very good mashed potatoes though I didn't eat much of them as I was trying to get all that chicken fried goodness down. I will make this place a regular stop when business brings me to Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried heaven

NHanOWpsWdXyDiwl3kr4KA.text: Great ribeye and newyork! Anytime my wife and I are craving a good steak we end up here.

NriaRHZGp1NgMU1iLoX0Gg.text: My search for chicken fried steak has finally come to an end. It was bigger than the plate!!! Hands down the best I've had.

xFh-9_SBg-4oUwXdgUdspQ.text: Sometimes, predictable is a good thing. A dear friend moved away and was coming to visit for a weekend. Turns out, despite being a sucker for anything chicken fried, she had never heard of TEXAZ. So we put together a small dinner party (8 of us) to celebrate her being in town.  The server was fantastic! We all came in at different times, she never missed a beat with greeting us, getting us drinks and taking care of all the substitutions and special requests in our food order. Everything arrived exactly as ordered - and we were a happy and full group of people.  The food is still consistent, the ambiance is still kitschy Texas roadhouse dive, the prices are still very reasonable and I am still super happy TEXAS is in my hood.

Dt8gohdH9xw14S3ArmJicA.text: Walking in, the decor was just ok.  We had the chicken fried steak, kids prime rib, and rib eye.  The prime rib was smoked and they didn't say that on the kids menu and it had an odd taste to it.  I liked the ice cream cup at the end of my meal.  Editing to three stars.  GREAT customer service.

j1Jn_NBCfd3Bt8ROwY1zmg.text: I am so confused by all of the ratings. I've tried this place twice now hoping that things would be better and that I just ordered the wrong items but I was, yet again, very disappointed. The only thing this place has going for itself is that they have large portions.  As for the food, it should be called Tex"ass" Grill!  First time I visited, my boyfriend and I ordered the ribs meal. The ribs were dry and extremely salty. The sides weren't any better either. Their potatoes were bland and coleslaw was over-dressed.   Seeing the highly rated reviews on their Chicken Fried Steak, I hoped my most recent visit would bring redemption to this restaurant, but, boy was I wrong!  Their Chicken Fried Steak was bland as was their gravy and mashed potatoes! They didn't bother to season the meat and it seems like it was just dredged in season-less flour batter. The gravy was flavorless as well.   I really wanted to like it but my taste buds fought against me. I felt dirty trying to take another bite because I kept trying to fool myself into thinking I tasted the meat... or the batter... or the gravy... or the potatoes. My last bite of redemption... the biscuit.... which was also flavorless! What happened to buttery, flaky biscuits? They would be well inclined to consult the Pillsbury Dough Boy for some pointers because those taste 100% better.  Disappointment and empty stomachs filled my household for the rest of the evening. At least something was full.

XDNmctRTMKjDT3I2KgOtdQ.text: This is one of my husbands favorite places for chicken fried steak. I'm not much for fried food, so I didn't order anything. But then my husband ordered his steak, fed me a bite and I remember being startled because it was fresh - not frozen. You could TASTE that it was not frozen. Probably the first restaurant I've been to that didn't have pre-frozen fried food. It's also beer battered. Flippin' delicious. It's basically like going to a southern mama's house and going for a home cooked meal.

4F5yWZLY0c08ObcQdecYNw.text: Their chicken fried steak is enormous. It is literally hanging off the sides of the oval plate. My problem is that there is just a stripe of meat in between two thick coatings of breading. On its own, it's very bland; but with the gravy and variety of condiments on the table it comes to life. I suppose it's a matter of taste; but I would prefer the option of a traditional, smaller, thicker, piece of meat with the same breading and a little seasoning. The mashed potatoes are real and tasty as is the corn. The biscuit is... OK. Seating is cramped and most seats are occupied. Wait staff is personable.  They do a good business. I left full; but still craving a traditional chicken fried steak.

pp3n3uRJZco2-NFIZ_z44A.text: Wow, those are big portions. Great food and service. Prices were decent, and the atmosphere was awesome. The catfish and ribeye are worth the trip. Daily specials are a good value with a tinning it home cooking.

NbdypxI-Zqk533lFdj4t7w.text: I am a sucker for great service. The only complain I have would be I wish they included their daily specials in their regular menu.  My ice tea never went half empty unless I begged them to stop refilling.

8p6O1Re4nQ9P29UqXxdIYA.text: This is not my favorite place, but I am giving them 4 stars since the limited menu has a specialty that couldn't be done any better. Chicken fried steak, chicken, or most recently CF pork chop are all outstanding. The family loves this place and we come back a couple of times per year to get our Chicken Fried on.

NpvW6SyILWFz3cszDvTBcA.text: The service at this restaurant is some of the best I've seen in the valley. The moment you walk in the door you are greeted warmly from servers, the hostess and even the manager/owner... I'm still not quite sure who he was but everyone was amazing and friendly from the moment we walked in until the moment we left. Our server was like a second mom, doting on our boys and always making sure we had everything we needed. I chose this restaurant for my birthday dinner because I knew we'd be going out with our two small boys and thought it would be a fun experience for everyone. I ordered the chicken fried steak because that is what they're famous for. It was a gigantic and I could only finished half of it. I would highly suggest if you don't have a Texas size appetite to do the half order or split it with someone. A little detail to most but a big thing for me was that they served green olives chopped up on their dinner salad and I loved it. We will definitely be back. My only negative on this restaurant is the lack of parking space, but this is a common issue in the central Phoenix area.

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The famous chicken fried steak!

R7Uctx38SBupm_OOkx1PSQ.text: Texaz is it!   Some of the best dining you'll ever have. Great service, great food great atmosphere. This is the place I miss when I travel.   Chicken fried chicken is amazing! Mashed potatoes are wonderful and gravy is perfect!   They feed you. No BS.   My favorite place!

wXIyteKx11q1PABrQK6fCw.text: This review is coming from a gal who had never had chicken fried steak until middle age- because to me, it was one of the most unappealing looking cholesterol laden dishes on earth. Well, that changed when dear papa took me there for dinner after picking me up at the airport about 6 years ago. Since then,  I've been to Texaz one or two times a year and....still haven't tried anything except their chicken fried steak combo, always with a Shiner Bock Bohemian Black lager.  It's perfection. Eventually I'll try something else, but why tempt fate?

7GHhx4BCfrgUKfuIhhrkpA.text: I've going to this place for years.  Never been disappointed for lunch and never left hungry.  The place kinda looks like a hole in the wall.  And the decor inside is not the best but the quality of food is.  So good looking for some good country food this is the place.  I think truly it's the best chicken fried steak I've ever had.

EKrxxNurZBYp3TKiTW8PUQ.text: Best chicken fried steak, chicken fried chicken, steak fries, biscuits, rolls, coleslaw, desserts, ice cold Shiner Bock, crafted cocktails, need I say more? My husband and I can split a chicken fried steak dinner, and still have some for breakfast the next day! I'd say that's worth the $17 a plate price, for 3 meals. Parking can get a little crazy, try going for happy hour during the week before 6 for dinner. You will get $2.25 bottles of Shiner Bock and a parking space! If you do go and can't find a spot to park, don't give up, the food is worth the walk. This place is also super family friendly. There is just enough noise for you parents with younger ones to not feel bad if the kiddo gets noisy. Their kid's menus are Armadillos that you can color, cut out, and fold to make 3-D. The friendly host was telling the kids jokes, and asking Texas trivia questions. Adults without kids, not to worry, there's a nice comfy bar stool waiting for you in the back!

photos.caption: Photo of TEXAZ Grill - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Z1IAmDu8kL-BoXB8jdjo2g.text: Well, our son decided we needed to eat here - we are in town visiting him.  I would have preferred something lighter, but I am telling you that if you want a hearty meal in a very colorful setting  this is the place.    The menu is largely steak and fried foods, but you get a salad and potatoes with every meal.  They do give the options on some of the foods - pork chops, chicken, shrimp, fish - to have it grilled if you please.  Special of the day was liver and onions, which we all passed on.  I decided to go whole hog, and got the bear battered fried shrimp, our son got chili as well as two fried chicken breasts (he is a construction worker, so can eat like this), and my husband got the grilled pork chops, with  big sides of grilled onions and grilled mushrooms.    The service was excellent and the food very good, although maybe not the best choice for the night before Thanksgiving.   The decor, if one could call it that, was the most fun of all - walls and ceilings plastered with old advertisements (haven't even thought of Nehi in years), letters, pictures, license plates, and on and on.  It was a lot of fun, but back to salad and lighter things.  Except tomorrow for turkey day.

HhdlShEAG69agcJn0ugsJg.text: I had a steak sandwich and my husband had the burrito. I decided to get the mash potatoes and mushrooms on the side and they were delicious. The streak was very juicy and tender. I will be back and will probably try the chicken fried steak.

qKp3d-BJ-wtTs-EnA7TK7g.text: I work at the sundevil auto right down the street. Me and my techs eat here 2 to 3 times a week !!!!  The service is absolutely amazing and the food is to die for !!! If I was not worried about having a heart attack from the delicious food I would eat here every day !!!!   Well done and keep it up.

ps7RnMw9fXmfnnpEDoBMEA.text: I really love Comfort Food sometimes!!  And this is AWESOME!  The Chicken Fried Steak, Mashed Potatoes, it is really all good!   And so comfortable inside, so much to look and such a nice change from all of the modern stainless stuff around.  Down home & Comfort food!   Oh and if you have them cook you up a  prime rib for a family get together!  Wow it's great!  :)

dD7YfbHM666yKrK53avOMA.text: We stopped here for the first time today for lunch on a recommendation from friends. We each had the Texaz club which was hearty and did not disappoint! Big, meaty sandwich and very filling. We noticed the chicken fried steak/chicken plates were being ordered by most of the people around us and looked delicious! One heckuva meal we will try next time. Met the owner who was real nice & made us members of the clean plate club! Look forward to going back and cleaning our plates again in the near future!

R44Izmv7P5CbDgPxk0iE_Q.text: Their chicken fried steak is the best, ever. And I'm a Texan! Along with it the mashed potatoes are like mom made them at home-seasoned just right. I assumed I'd get the steak each time I visited this grill full of Texas memorabilia, but then the next time was all-you-can-eat catfish. Oh, my. Possibly some of the best catfish I've ever tasted. Iced tea is also something to write home about. All in all, if you can't eat in Texas, this place is just as good!

7vEqgq9KYiEnJO4u6380dQ.text: Great place! Just a hole in the wall with great food. Country Fried Steak was the best. My wife loved the catfish. We will be back

8rOPUbSLGdrtQ26tXkc5uQ.text: Meh. Alright. Nothing to brag about. Ok, Ok they have Titos vodka, big score. The portions are humongous, I ordered the chicken fried steak and it literally could have fed 4 girls. The batter and gravy were both pretty bland, what's all the rave about this place?   My bf got the Ribs, and they were just ok, very fullof fat pieces, they had a smoky sauce where I normally prefer a sweeter, tangier bbq. It almost seemed like they try to make up for the lack of flavor with huge servings.   The inside of the place looks like a dumpster monster from Texas puked all over it. Crap everywhere and not very clean. Yea it is cheap, but you get what you pay for.

DqpMeOaDc_GLQuJ0lr0fCQ.text: I know that this place is a Phoenix staple, but just because something is really old doesn't mean its always good.   TexAz Grill is very mediocre.   The building is cool, lots of old stuff all over, almost feels a little cramped, but for an old spot, that's to be expected. The menu is very small, Chicken Fried Chicken, Chicken Fried Steak, T-bone, and sometimes ribs on special. Everything we had was yummy, however the coleslaw was a bit on the soggy side for me. The ribs were smoked to perfection, fell right off the bone, and the chicken friend chicken was great. Service was exactly as you would expect it to be, nothing to write home about. But we had everything we needed.   Check it out if your in the mood for some home cookin, but don't be expecting to get blown away.

_V3udBotD7U7kLxCFPi5_g.text: I loved the food!  Reminded me of my grandmother's cooking!  Cherie was a sweetheart!!
